description:
Good tasting burger fairly clean restaurant...I had a basic burger and it was juicy and flavorful. French fries were crispy and freshly fried! I was surprised as I have passed this one up many times! Mainly because a contingent of neo-hippie -homeless crowd is usually at this corner! 

I was really surprised by the decor pretty cool! Guitars everywhere and mural of Rolling Stones with actual guitars!
author: Paul D.

description:
We tried this place for delivery, and we're sure glad we did. Food was delivered hot, organized and well prepared.
The food was fantastic, burgers, sweet potato fries and onion rings were delicious!
Would recommend will order again.
author: Pstephan A.

description:
Yikes!  16% "service fee" on everything.

You have got to be kidding me!  Quite the surprise when we order the pizza for 23$ and the total comes out to be 30$.  I mean, what the heck is the service fee for?!  If you come here, which I DO NOT ADVISE, be prepared to pay extravagant fees.

The pizza was okay, but it was definitely not worth what we paid.  One pizza and a couple of beers that cost us about 50$.  Uh, no thanks.  I could have just held off for a little while longer and gone to literally anywhere else.

Take my advice, and just keep on walking down the road.  There's plenty of stuff to do around here anyway, than waste your money here.  

Good day sir.  I SAID, GOOD DAY, SIR!
author: Michael S.

description:
Meh. 

I saw garlic fries on the menu and decided to give them a shot. These fries had not one note of garlic flavor,  just potatoes ... fried.  

Instead of tossing them, I brought them home to make chili fries later.  

Next time I'm over that way,  maybe I'll try a burger; as that's what they're known for.
author: Lynnette F.

description: Not bad. I am not a huge fan of burgers, but I figured I'd give this place a shot. I ordered the turkey burger quesadilla (yes this is an actual thing), as I didn't want a traditional burger. The quesadilla came with two huge turkey burger patties, sandwiched between a cheese filled tortilla. I was pleasantly surprised at how tasty this quesaburger was, as I had never had anything like it before. After a few bites, I was stuffed! The portion was huge. If you are in the area, and have a big appetite, I would say this would be the perfect spot for you. There is ample seating, and they seem to be pretty quick with service. As I came around 3 pm on a Saturday, there wasn't a wait; I'm sure this place fills up pretty quickly during peak hours. They also have quite a large menu; they serve salads, hot wings, pizza, burgers, and so much more! Check this place out, if in the area.
author: Alexus S.

description: $50 for two burgers, one fry and two sodas. Didn't add up to me so I requested the receipt thinking I was overcharged for an extra meal. Nope, a 16% service fee is added to the meal and the employee just shrugged his shoulders and said yeah I get a lot of complaints about that and I can't take it off. They don't make it clear and I can't see how this is even legal. Then at the bottom of the receipt they state you can ask to have it removed. I'm all about tipping well but this is not cool.
author: Margret H.

description:
With a couple of friends in town, we decided to pop into Burger Urge after wandering Golden Gate Park and before grabbing a drink. The atmosphere is generic but clean and I don't have anything to complain about service-wise. 

The meal prices are horrendous unless you're there during happy hour (5:30-9:30, I think). I couldn't decide on a veggie burger to split with my friend so opted for a side of fries to hold me over until dinner. They were about $6 and a hefty portion for the price. 

One of my friends got a veggie sandwich with sweet potato fries for ~$15 and my other friend got a 10" pizza for ~$17. With a name like Burger Urge I expected the sandwiches and fries to be the highlight but surprisingly the pizza was everyone's favorite. The crust was uninspiring but crispy while the sauce was decent and the pineapple was grilled -- a nice touch. 

The veggie sandwich was dry and the sweet potato fries were nowhere near crispy enough. Pretty common occurrence with sweets but again, the place is supposed to be all about burgers and in turn, fries! 

My regular fries were crispy albeit a bit bland and got soggy quickly. 

This is an ok stop for a desperate bite or if you're fine with paying big for something not exactly worth it. I'm sure there are other, better options in the area but we were starving. I'll look a little harder for something more worth my buck next time!
author: Alex K.

description: Came here with a friend for lunch. I didn't know what to expect here. This was my first time here. I really like the interior. My cheese burger was great. I also enjoyed the curly fries. It is weird to see a place that serves pizza, deli sandwiches and burgers at the same place. The name Burger Urger is miss leading. When I went here I thought it was a burger place such as Superduper burger that only served burgers.
author: Isaac H.

description:
Worst burger I've had since the airport. First of all they charged $33 for a Burger fries and a soda. Second they took a temperature on the burger and then spit out a well done burger anyway. It's bland, greasy, and honestly an insult to burgers anywhere.

Disgusting
author: Z R.

description:
I have not even received my food. The place looks nice, the people are pleasant, and the food is probably good. Maybe I will update later. 

I ordered. "Thought" I saw something about gratuity flash across the screen. Was handed my credit card receipt and pen with a smile. 

I received no itemized receipt showing the gratuity. When I asked, they told me gratuity was included. This seems like a massive scam. If I had not seen the word gratuity flash on the screen, I never would have known and would have added gratuity again.
author: Justin S.

description: A great little burger joint in the heart of Haight Ashbury in San Francisco. Great choices of burgers, and toppings giving you the West Coast feeling. My burger had onion rings, bbq sauce, extra cheddar cheese, and topped with Ranch Dressing. Outstanding, juicy, plenty of o rings on it, a fresh bun, everything you need for a perfect burger.
author: Greg S.

description: Haight hangover cure and comfort food. Cool decor inside that's a tribute to Haight-Ashbury and other popular spots in SF. Delicious burgers, solid vegetarian options, and pizza that will hit the spot.
author: Sarah N.

description:
Warm day calls for milkshakes and ice cream!!

We ordered two milkshakes. The most basic flavors--- one strawberry and one chocolate. We got a number and sat at one of their many tables. I like the memorabilia used and all the drawings done to decorate the restaurant. I thought we were going to be in and out of that place, but man, I was completely wrong.

I watched another girl sit at a table near us. She ordered after us and still managed to get her burger, fries, and drink before our two simple milkshakes.

I wish we went to Ben & Jerry's down the street for quicker service and more flavors.
author: Steffi G.

description:
Have you ever had a BURGER URGE?

I get them now and then.  But usualy I just pass because I don't want a soy burger.  I don't miss meat perse but I miss the texture of meat at times.

We were hungry after a day of hiking the redwoods.  Bunny needed a nap. I stayed up because I thought if I went to sleep I would not get up until 3am and then be hungry and not be able to go back to sleep.  So I stayed up.  I gave him 30 mins to nap then we got up and went out for dinner.

We were not feeling like walking to far or taking Uber anywhere and spotted this place at the corner as we were walking.  I wasn't sure they would have anything for me to eat since this is a BURGER JOINT so I figured I would get fries, onion rings, maybe a salad of something.  I wasn't trying to be picky I was just hungry. This place is located in the Haight Ashbury area so there is plenty to see and do.

We walk in and are greeted right away.  We peruse the menu to see what they had and I decided to ask about veggie burgers thinking they wouldn't have anything but I was WRONG and they did have veggie patty's.  YEAHHH!

The young lady told me I could get any burger I wanted and swap the patty for a veggie one, or turkey if you like those instead.  SO MANY CHOICES I had.  I normally ask what type of veggie patty it is but I wasn't caring at this point.

I ended up getting the DOWN N DIRTY veggie style which was cheddar cheese, BBQ Sauce, onion rings on griddled rye bread but I swapped that out for a wheat bun.  Bunny got the basic CHEESE BURGER which was a meat patty with cheese, lettuce, tomato, onion and pickle.  I asked if they had fruit instead of fries but NOPE so we didn't get any fires either.  Bunny got a chocolate shake and I got a diet soda.  What a treat I almost NEVER get soda anymore.

We paid and got a number and went to find a seat.  The restaurant was decorated in a rock style with murals all over of San Francisco and different musicians.  The ENTIRE ceiling had old guitars painted and adhered to it.  VERY COOL!  There was even a couple that were like 3D images which laid over the painted ones in the murals.  They also had 2-3 TV's up and on.  One was on the Worlds Series but both teams had 0 at the time and while I USED to like watching baseball it is painful now and feels like I'm watching grass grow because it moves slow.

Our food soon arrived with a loaf of bread on each burger.  Yes I'm being facetious but the bun was SO FRICKIN thick I took off the top.  Their buns are VERY THICK and not on the SUPER SOFT side like brioche buns at all.  JUST THICK!  

We could hardly pick it up to eat it so we dug in with a knife and fork.  I liked my veggie burger. It was a little different and I could see it had some carrots or sweet potato in it which was good.  Very filling. Bunny liked his burger as well and we both were happy we didn't get fries or fruit.  The burgers were more than enough with something to wash them down with.

The staff was super friendly and nice and didn't look like slobs. The restaurant was clean and had a steady flow of eaters all night but they were able to keep all the condiments stocked and everything clean.  I appreciate that.
author: Ryan P.

description:
Full disclosure, I haven't received my food yet. This post is in reference to the 16% "Svc charge". 
Our cashier did not offer a receipt and luckily my girlfriend happened to notice a 16% charge added without asking or alerting us. And of course they have a tip line on the receipt we had to sign and a big jar full of dollar bills. 

I work in the food service industry for 15 years and I always tip wherever I go. I feel that this was so dishonest and rude. I asked for a receipt and on the bottom was a paragraph explaining this charge and it does offer an option where this charge can be removed. However I had to specifically ask for a receipt to get this information and when I asked the cashier she made it seem like it was the 5% tax added for the SF HRA. 
This has left a terrible impression on me and I will not return and I will warn others about this sneaky practice. 
BE WARNED!
author: Tim W.

description: The burgers were great. Nice clean place  The service was great    my only complaint was not noticing that you automatically get a 16% charge added to your order. The bathroom were very clean which was a huge plus
author: Kat J.

description: Great food and great service - the combo we all want.  Burgers are done to perfection and the sweet potato fries are not sweet but definitely have a nice bite to them.  Cobb salad very generous in size- a little speedy but the flavor and portions are worth it!
author: M O.

description:
Last time I was here I don't remember a veggie burger and fries costing $15. Add a milkshake & tax and you're paying a whopping $25!!!

The burger was delicious but damn. Shame on me because I have a house full of groceries but still spent money at an eatery. 

I also noticed one of the ladies that works there use a serving tray to push the garbage down with when the can was full. 
Not too sanitary so I hope they wash those trays with hot soap and water! 

Still 3.5 stars.
author: Court S.

description: The burger is quite good however the prices are a gouge even considering it is a historic area. I recommend the burger with pineapple. Then you get the sandwich and its not even the big patty, automatically charging a %16 service fee. They accept tips too. I can see this being for tourists and the flavor is good but every time the exchange leaves a bad taste in my mouth. I won't be back, unfortunately.
author: Tracey H.

description: Pretty good food.  Went here with my niece and the food was great. Very pricey though.  If you're on a budget this isn't the place to eat.
author: Ricky L.

description:
Gave a 1 star only cause I couldn't give a 0-star rating. So let's start with saying this is THE worst burger I've ever had. The room for error on a burger is not a thin line. The burger we received was well over done. It was cooked til you couldn't squeeze an ounce of juice from it. And the outside was burnt and charred as black as you can. The only reason I made it to this place was the happy hour deal labeled outside on the window. The next part of it was the garlic fries. There was NO garlic on the fries whatsoever. It felt like they just drizzled some garlic flavored oil over it, creating your Burger Urge poor man's garlic fries. 

Also, there is no beer on tap here. Everything served in a bottle. 

If you're able to pick between this place and ANY other place in SF. Please pick any other place in SF, including McDonald's and any other fast food restaurant. 

I was very displeased with the food if you cannot sense it through this review. Business is pretty lackluster itself.

Will never be going back nor recommending this to any other person.
author: Yi M.

description: The sourdough burger was amazing but we were charged almost $10 service charge. This is an order at the cashier and sit down place. Almost 20% add on without warning is not ok. I wasn't offered my receipt. I had to ask and it was a bit of a production. I now know why.
author: Liz S.

description:
At the urging of a cohort at work I stopped in after a long day there, and then a head spinning acupuncture session. I was hungry, tired & I came away full after tackling the "slammin Marley" or some such thing. It was good and fresh too.

The patty was tasty, the pesto good but could have had more. I guess it also had mushrooms as well. And where was the Swiss cheese that was supposed to be on top of it? I had to get a little nit pick in there! It came with garlic fries, the total was close to 19 bucks. It does not represent good value at all but ...

I think they need to trim down the bun, too much carb on that baby, and also maybe have some kind of ingredient disclosure on the food. Example: on the fries, are those GMO potatoes? That said, I'm glad I went & now I know. Yeah especially after looking at the reviews, me thinks I got hosed on the automatic tip caper.
author: Henry K.

description: Very over priced! Food is ok. Little advice to staff.... a smile goes a long way! And, if you're going to BS a customer, go all the way!
author: Lori W.

description:
UPDATE: THEY OVERCHARGED ME ON THE FINAL CREDIT STATEMENT!!!!

This place is a total tourist scam! My order was supposed to be something like $17 and that's even what my receipt said. But then when I checked the credit card statement, they upped the charge to $19.99! They must have written in a tip to my receipt or something nefarious like that. AVOID THIS PLACE!
author: Mike S.

description:
Thought the food is adequate, the person manning the cash register is illegally adding 16% gratuity to everyone's bill. Don't go here. I'll be reporting this to the BOE also since they claim there is no present manager nor supervisor here now. 
Order #665. Cashier Jacquie. 8-12-17 @ 7:13pm
author: Preston H.

description:
Just a precaution: as others have mentioned, this place automatically adds a 16% service charge to every order. Not only that, but the receipt still has an area that urges you to tip! This can be very deceiving if you aren't paying close attention. 

There's a certificate on the wall that reads, "best burger in San Francisco". I'm not sure what year that award was given, but this was probably one of the most tasteless burgers I've eaten in the city. Perhaps I wouldn't mind the 16% service charge if the food and service were actually phenomenal, but unfortunately they are not. 

I will say though, the sweet potato fries are great. And for that, they earn one additional golden star.
author: Matt H.

description: One of my favorite places to eat burgers in San Francisco. I had the pleasure of having dinner here with some friends. Great burger and fries with incredible customer service from all of the workers. Very clean and really enjoyed the atmosphere. Highly recommended!
author: Kangaroo K.

description:
BAY TO BREAKERS 2016...

SOBER Chun P: Checks Yelp App to make sure its at least a 3.5 star eatery. 
DRUNK Chun P: Just stumpled inside with his wingman. Need food!

SOBER Chun P: Checks prices and leaves if its a ripoff.
DRUNK Chun P: Whatever...wingman is paying for us anyway, yes!

SOBER Chun P: Checks if the burgers come with fries or not(hint: they don't!)
DRUNK Chun P: "Uh...yeah...sure...those garlic fries sound great!"  

SOBER Chun P: Checks for automatic service charges...
DRUNK Chun P: Did not see the fine print for the automatic 12% service charge...F**K!!!!

$38 for two burgers, an order garlic fries, and one soda in a fast food setting...WTF?

CONCLUSION: Don't be a DRUNK Chun P and get ripped off. But at the time, all the food did seem pretty good...though a lot of things do when I'm drunk.
author: Chun P.

description:
Went there today for the first time when the Haight Street Fair was going on.  The place was not packed but about 80% of the tables were taken.  My friend and I ordered a pesto chicken and hamburger with mushroom and cheese and fries.  It took about 35 minutes to finally get my order.  Another table got their order, which looked like a couple of hamburgers and fries and their number was after ours.

After getting our food, the taste was nothing special, only the garlic fries seem to really have the real garlic taste.  We heard other people complaining why it is taking so long to get their food.  

It looks like they had 2 people working in the kitchen.  You would think with the street fair, they would have more staff in the kitchen.  Perhaps they thought they could not compete with the street fair vendors.  Now I can understand why.

Skip this place.
author: Lester C.

description: Not worth the price. $20 for a hamburger, fries and drink. Burger and fries were sub par. Really nice inside. Definitely a one time place to go
author: Lilah L.

description: Decided to stop here for a quick bite. My burger was amazing!!  Cooked just right and super hot. Can't wait to go again.
author: Juana L.

description:
Maybe you have to be really stoned to appreciate this spot. Girl working at the counter was totally checked-out. Barely made eye contact and had the listening skills of a rock. Walked away in the middle of our order. This was our cue to escape this over-priced spot. 

The urge at this point was indeed for a burger...just not from here.
author: Captain C. Branagain G.

description: Absolutely horrible experience. My friend flew in from Indianapolis and i took her on a tour of SF for her first visit. It was Bay 2 Breakers and the place was busy so i understand why they wanted to control the bathroom situation a bit but they were absolutely ridiculous!  Absolutely zero use of bathroom until we wait in line for almost an hour to order NO EXCEPTIONS!! Then they proceed to charge over $25 for 1 single cheeseburger. But then her bank account showed a charge for $205.11 !!! Still have not received a refund... DO NOT GO HERE!!! THEY ONLY CARE ABOUT $$$ NOT CUSTOMERS! ZEROOO STARS!
author: Jeramy S.

description: I had the SF sourdough turkey burger and my friend had the Haight & Love with curly fries. Both we're really good!! Price and portions are good as well. Friendly service too. Actually one of the best burgers  I had.
author: Eva B.

description:
I saw the 16% gratuity in the register out of the corner of my eye. I mentioned it and the cashier immediately took it off. I later saw the sign that says that gratuity will be added. Tips are at the discretion of the customer. This is clearly a service charge that they use to keep their prices from going High to sky high. How many people have they fooled who double 'tipped'. 

They also messed up my burger, which was pretty decent, but that could happen anywhere. 

Very friendly staff.
author: JR R.

description:
Wow! Did not even realize that this place charged 15% automatic tip until I read other Yelpers reviews.  No wonder the bill was so high....There really isn't real table service as it is one of those places that you order and they give you a sign with your number on it.  The service was poor as my daughter and her friend ordered shakes and they did not arrive until everyone was finished with food.
Our table ordered:
A burger-was good.
A Caesar salad- Had what  looked like barbecue sauce on  the croutons and was served with tomatoes.  Weak.
Chicken nuggets with fries.  The fries were the best item served.
The chocolate milkshakes while tasty had a strange reddish, pink tint to them.
author: Derald C.

description: Best burger on Haight St! I love my organic burger and milkshakes! I usually get the curly fries with my burger, the regular fries are great too. I always crave their milkshakes! Sometimes I pop by for only a shake, they are that yummy! The atmosphere is awesome and the place is super clean! The staff has become my friends throughout my years of going to Burger Urge!
author: Pita Q.

description:
whassup y'all i just wanna show y'all this onion ring i got. 

but also, i don't understand the automatic 16 percent service charge and there's barely seats cause it's always popping but we weren't standing for too long just had to put it out there. The onion rings were dank though
author: Jaspur P.

description:
There were 9 of us going to this eatery on a not particularly busy weekday.  Out of 3 orders of food, they managed to get ALL of it wrong.  Two people, myself and a pregnant woman ended up in the ER shortly after eating here between under cooked food and a food allergy.
-Four of the burgers were essentially raw and cold in the middle.  When people went to return them, they were told they cannot take food back. 
-The garlic fries were regular fries.  When we took these back, again- nope. Wouldn't fix it.  Not one bit of garlic. 
-The grilled cheese #1 had maybe ONE slice of wrapper tasting cheese on it, 
- The onion rings were burned.  Again- refused to correct the order. 
- The grilled cheese #2 was burned -refused to correct the order. 
- the pizza, I'm not sure what the hell the pizza was- under cooked dough, non melted cheese and a few toppings the diner did not even recognize that was not on the menu.  Asked to cook it a little longer, nope.  Not happening.   
  
My burger, I am glad to say was not raw, but badly overcooked and had one onion, which I specifically said NO ONIONS, and confirmed no onions. 
 Set off an allergic reaction that got ugly very fast.   The staff denied putting onions on the burger and claimed I had eaten onions off someones plate.  Yeah, that's exactly what people with severe allergies do.  It was an insult after another.  

If I'm going to be paying $89.13 for three burgers and ONE order of fries for my family, it had better taste good and keep me out of the ER.  
  
The 16% service charge added to all orders on top of tax is an insult.  
The greasy haired young kid presenting food is an insult.  
The individual who called himself a manager who refused to correct sub standard food.  ( Im not 100% sure he was a manager) 

We heard the staff lie to the customers over and over about how the 16% service charge was standard in the city.  Being locals, we know that is 100% false.  
Stay away, stay far far away.
author: Sam G.

description: Ordered a Chicken Pesto sandwich and Pepperoni Pizza. The sandwich wasn't that great and definitely not worth 14bucks. Plus the fries weren't cooked all the way. And the pizza I ordered was basic, nothing special. Save your money this place is overpriced for their quality !
author: Love O.

description:
I should have checked Yelp before going to this place!  I was in the area getting some new body jewelry and this place was just close by. 

Then french fries were good. That is the ONLY good thing I have to say about this place.  It is very over priced.  That should have been my first clue to go somewhere else.  There was a group of us paying separately.  I ordered first and told the girl we were all together and asked if she wanted to use the same table number.  She said, "No! That's too confusing." Ok, cool. Just trying to be helpful, but that's too hard, I get it.  I asked for a cup for water, but was informed they would have to get it for me.  After paying, the girl just looked at me, like it was time for me to go.  I again asked for the cup of water.  If you can't remember what I asked you for 30 seconds ago, maybe you should put it somewhere where I can just get it myself. Thanks.

Then, the bugs. There were many of them flying around. A mosquito eater landed on the table. I killed it. Sorry bug lovers, I couldn't help it.  As mentioned, I ordered first, my food came last. Great! 

You need a key because restrooms are for customers only.  No problem, you don't want random people wandering into them and trashing them. Oh wait, they're already trashed.  No toilet paper to use, but a ton of soiled paper all over the ground.  The ground was also just randomly wet.  Paper towels everywhere, probably because that's what people were using as toilet paper. So gross.  I walked in, took a look around, and walked right back out (and put on some hand sanitizer).

Don't go here! You can find way better food at way better prices for way cheaper.
author: Elle H.

description: Do not eat here unless you want to pay a ridiculous premium for the quality of food.  And risk getting ill!  My daughter, friend and I ordered 3 burgers, 2 sides of different fries, 3 sodas, 1 water, and 1 milkshake.  The lady rang it up - $68.72!! I'm like WHAT??  She said "do you want a receipt?" (had only given me the credit card receipt - not the detailed receipt) I said "Yes" - and I noticed she added $8.74 service charge! I read the blurb below on the receipt and assumed it was a San Francisco city ordinance, so let it go considering we were starved.  But when I got home I saw that I could have asked for that to be removed! (see photo of receipt). And they charged $7 for the milkshake! Which they took forever to make - by the time it arrived - we were about done.  The burgers were really thin and super high-fat and greasy - my daughter's friend got a bad tummy ache soon after which ruined the rest of her afternoon.  So on top of it she got food poisoning!! I nor my daughter didn't get sick but I was burping mine up for hours afterward.  I highly doubt they were "Neiman Ranch" as advertised.  The sweet potato fries were dry and without the chili pepper seasoning on top as listed on menu.  This place is the BIGGEST ripoff and food is SUB-PAR and RISKY!!  Bottom line - take your "burger urge" elsewhere!!!
author: C G.

description: The burgers here have no taste. While it's not the worst burger I've ever had, it makes me remember the rule about glitzy neon signs... Similar to Pat's and Geno's in Philadelphia: What they lack in delicious food they make up for in glitzy neon signage.
author: Leo I.

description: Are here last Sunday and had a great cheeseburger and fries. I had really great service from Thommy. She really took care of us. I would recommend stopping by if you are in the area.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Burger Urge, has some explaining to do. Why...WHY charge 12% Gratuity charge!? 
While on my visit to San Francisco on numerous occasions, I have seen a 4% gratuity charge added here and there, never this much. My husband ordered the Down and Dirty for 11.95, and I the San Francisco Sourdough for 12.95. We ordered a 7$ish Child's burger for our son. A Drink for 2.50 and an upcharge to sweet potato fries for 4$ ...Where in the hell does that add up to 50$?? Our bill should have been around 38-40$. This is just ridiculous. The restaurant was busy. My hubby had time to walk back to our car, put in change and come back before food arrived. 
The food was good.. Which is what makes this so hard to write for me!!! However, they were NO 50$ burgers, SORRY NOT SORRY! 
Last time we were in town, we ate at Blue Front Cafe just down the street from here... AMAZING Mediterranean food, the best falafel I've ever had and much, much cheaper!!
You owe it to yourself and your wallet... Find somewhere else to eat that won't rip you off. 
...Like Blue Front...where I'll be eating next time...
author: Stephanie G.

description:
This was my very last visit at Burger Urge as they're running a tipping scam.

Usually this is my spot to stop by while in the Haight. They always had a clean larger bathroom, and drinks to pack away for long shopping trips.

But this last experience was so not good. I ordered a burger, simple - but in watching her ring up the meal I was charged a 12% gratuity fee. I didn't think about it until I was waiting for my food and had used the extremely dirty restroom. I mean, many SF (and now SB!) spaces have a surcharge for employee insurance so at first glance that's what I thought it was - except at 12% that doesn't really make sense.

Adding to the fact there is a "tip section" on the receipt I signed, this leads me to believe Burger Urge is not an automatic/non-tipping establishment and that the cashier charged me (1 person, 1 burger) like I was a party of 5 or 6. Then conveniently did not give me a copy of the receipt afterwards.

It's a nice scam they have going - which lead me to pay $15 for a super thin pattied burger and a bottle of water. Added to the barely-flushing moldy toilet bowl in the women's restroom = this will no longer be a stop on my Haight trips.

Bye Felicia.
author: Meg T.

description: 4 stars for the variety of veggie burgers alone! They about 8 different types of burger which is nice! The patty itself was crust in the outside but not overdone and the flavor was great! The garlic fries were perfectly crust and garlic but not overpowering! Friendly service and clean surroundings!
author: Tiffany J.

description:
5 stars for our service today- came here with my mom after buying stones from the shop a few doors down. We got 2 meals- and both loved them! My burger (recommended from the wonderful cashier Thommy I believe her name is) was delicious! I also recommend the bacon cheeseburger! Great customer service goes a long way- made us feel at home and was very kind with my mom. 

For 2 meals and drinks, I think the $35 price was a great find in the neighborhood! Looking forward to my next visit to explore more of the menu!
author: Laurina M.

description:
Delicious!! 
My favorite burger so far in SF area
Greeeeeaaaattttt LOCATION! 
People watch and charge ur phone on super comfy benches 
Tons of great art&guitars on wall
Fireplace too 
Had great time here
author: Kaleo C.

description: Fries were good. Milkshake was a regular old milkshake nothing exciting. Actual burger was bland but the sauces and other toppings were pretty good. The service charge is crazy and the prices are already high. I get that it's in a tourist area but that's gross. Pay your employees a living wage!
author: Emma M.

description:
Okay I came here for the happy hour meal. One problem is I don't like asking questions. One you order the happy hour burger meal. On the window I just remember burger fries soda. So when asked if I wanted cheese I say no (I should had said is cheese included in the happy hour price) Then what kind of fries would you like  I would love sweet potato fries but is that going to increase the price? So I just say regular fries  

I just wish they would be more up front of answering yes to those questions would increase the bill. 

This boy is on a budget.
author: John C.

description:
Sleazy pricing: a 16% "service charge" is added to every purchase. Of course, since the charge is added indiscriminately to every purchase, it's not a service charge; it's just part of the price. The (already high) prices listed on the menu are there to fool you. You are then handed a non-itemized receipt, with no mention of the charge, encouraging you to add a tip. If you hadn't noticed the fine print on the menu where the charge is mentioned, you might be inclined to leave a tip if you are a good person. But you're being swindled. Once you eat your just-okay sandwich or burger, therefore, you may have to join the buskers on Haight just to recoup your losses and think about your life choices.

Note: A review below says the charge is 12%. It is currently 16%.
author: Dustin C.

description: Super yummy food in a very interesting spot of San Francisco. Must try this place when you're hungry. Fries are good and the burgers are filling.
author: Elizabeth S.

description: If it was just on the veggie burger I probably would give a 3 or 4.  BUT - we got there at 9:15, we ordered, we were charged 16% extra for "service," we sat down, and then was told it had to be a to go order.  So that was $19 for a veggie burger with onion rings that I had to take somewhere else to eat.  Nope.  Rude.  Not service, and if you are open until 9:30 - then you serve in the restaurant until 9:30 unless there is signage setting expectations otherwise.
author: Tia B.

description: Located right on Haight Street, Burger Urge is a quick fix if you are looking for a basic burger and fries. Although the food didn't knock my socks off, I was happy with the service, promptness, and the atmosphere. I have gone here a couple of times, and always just ordered the basic burger and fries, and milkshake to fill m craving. The price is a little higher than what it should be, but for San Francisco not too bad. Check out burger urge if you are on Haight and in the mood for a burger
author: Ross S.

description:
I want to first say that even though I'm giving 2 stars, it wasn't BAD, just a little below average. I wasn't sure what to do for dinner, but  was walking down Haight street (I try to avoid driving to Haight, I don't like having to deal with the parking), and had a vague idea that a burger would be good. I took a look on yelp and Burger Urge seemed like it would be reasonably priced, even thought it didn't have the best reviews.

I walked in and liked the ambience. TV on the Radio was playing, which put me in a good mood. The rest of the music was a mix of more mainstream, and a little of lesser known artists, mainly rock and pop. The restaurant was about a quarter full, and pretty quiet. There was a fire place, which was a little surprising given that this is a burger place, but it was a nice touch. The waitress at the register was friendly and attentive. I ordered the cheeseburger and regular fries (fries aren't included). It was just under $16, which was more than I had expected, but not a huge deal. 

After a 5-10 min wait the waitress bought my food out. There were a loooot of fries, it was a huge serving. The burger looked pretty good too, except for the beef, which was sort of shiny (with grease). I was excited about the grilled pickles. The burger was sort of difficult to eat, if that makes sense. Maybe it had something to do with the size, but it kept falling apart. And the beef ended up dripping a good bit and making the bun wet, and I had to keep stopping to wipe things up. It also seemed a little rubbery. The taste was just kind of bland, it just lacked a whole lot of flavor. Even the pickles that I'd been so excited about didn't have much flavor. The fries were better, about average. Nice and crispy and actually tasted like potato. A little less salt than I like, but a table full of condiments was available. 

Even though the food wasn't all that good, I ended up eating most of it. I think that's because I was hoping it would somehow get better, and trying to get my money's worth. It never happened and I finally gave up. Maybe I was wrong to come for the food, maybe people come here more for the ambience or after drinking. Based on the food, I don't see myself coming back.
author: Dana C.

description: I will say that this is a below average place to eat.  I mean, nothing sticks out for me.....other than the expensive menu and a lot of tourist frequenting this place.  I probably came at a wrong, so I won't fault management.  But I won't be coming back anytime soon.
author: Alex W.

description:
It is just a regular burger as you can find in any place.

The restaurant is very pricy for the product they deliver to clients. Also it takes too long to be served.

They have the space in the kitchen to serve faster now that their menu is very simple.

If you want to have a better quality burger with lower price go to Super Duper or The Melt.

Definitely not worth the wait.
author: Juan Camilo C.

description: 16% service charge for no service and a dry flavorless burger. It should be a crime to serve poor food for outrageous prices.
author: Jordan P.

description:
I am a BAY NATIVE! I hella love SF for its delicious food and the day I discovered Burger Urge I felt it was made for me! I am the burger queen! So I will always keep coming back and definitely keep telling not only my friends but my hotel guest from Carl Hotel. I want to give a special shout out to Thommy for all her help, hope I spelled her name right. She even made sure to turn the Raider game on for me as I requested one Sunday Night Football. YEEE!
Also they have an awesome Happy Hour Menu I just discovered! M-F I believe
author: Salwa R.

description: The cashier woman was soooo rude to me. I ordered a burger I usually love and when I tasted it it tasted different like really bad for some reason it was undercooked. I complained and asked for a refund very nicely explaining why I wanted atleast partial refund I paid nearly $20 and only ate a tiny bit there was a whole burger left it was so gross. The cashier was extremely unprofessional and after insisting she finally got the manager who was like scared to even talk to me. The manager wanted to give me a refund but the cashier kept insisting she couldn't do it and made up reasons why she wouldn't refund me. They have awful customer service to say the least I won't ever return and I am telling all my friends about this. Very rude. Food was bad. Don't give them your business.
author: Maria Elena A.

description: The burgers were good, but the portion they give you for fries is ridiculous and a waste of food.  There's no way humanly possible one person can eat all of those fries.  Also, the fries are the thin string cut fries and are soggy. How about quality over quantity with the fries.
author: The R.

description: This place has horrible parking  (if you can find any, took me 20 minutes). The food is way over priced! Also a 16% extra fee on top of taxes and before tipping, have fun finding out what it is for. The service is OK, nothing special. Hard to find seating. To sum it up....Tourist Trap. Go to a fast food place or a more modest priced establishment with no hidden fees instead. Three burgers, chicken nuggets, side of fries and a drink $75.00!!!!! WTF! Where is that reasonable????? Will not be coming back.
author: Jay D.

description: Excellent burgers.  Good fries and serve beer at a good price and have a cool beer called brew free or die.
author: Spencer S.

description:
The food is nothing particularly good or bad, so an alright place for a quick lunch in the Upper Haight. You might want to sit away from the windows when they're open, unless you enjoy the dulcet tones of the usual gathering of panhandlers telling you that you suck if/when you ignore their pleas.

Theres been a recent jack up of prices w/o any change in menu or quality, but the real kicker here at Burger Urge is the egregious addition of a 13% service charge. It's noted at the bottom of the menu in minuscule font. And they've got an explanation of same at the bottom of the receipt. And still there's a tip jar. 

Where do the Burger Urge-ians think they're located? Paris?
author: Kevin M.

description: Taste of pizza was delicious. Crust was soggy. Service was okay. Took almost 40 minutes for two pizzas to be made. And they charged a 20% gratuity on all purchases with no warning. Then have the audacity to ask for a tip on my receipt. Was a good one time shop, but I won't be back again.
author: Michael C.

description:
Do not eat here.  As others have pointed out, Burger Urge is doing something fishy with their mandatory service charge.  The explanation they gave me doesn't add up.  Plus, the restaurant smelled like industrial cleanser.

For something close by, try Street Taco.  If you really want a burger, walk a few blocks to Burgermeister.
author: Lucullus L.

description: I regret going here. Overpriced and not tasty. The staff was friendly and I liked the guitars on the ceiling. But overall, I was disappointed by the quality of food.
author: Lauren S.

description:
PLEASE BE ALERTED TO THE FACT THAT YOU WILL BE AUTOMATICALLY CHARGED 12% SERVICE CHARGE, you will be handed a bill to sign with TIP: $__________  portion line and it can be confusing if you are being asked to tip again. This appears to be DELIBERATE! Cashier did not mention this AUTOMATIC GRATUITY charge. It is for you to find this on the menu board. 

Cashier will ask if you need a receipt, TAKE IT! -------If you DOUBLE TIP, ask for your money back.-------

This is not just for large groups, but everyone. A small notation, on the menu boards, are the only hint of this charge, until you are presented with the receipt, AFTER you have paid. There is a rather lame explanation, at the bottom of the receipt (only if you ASK for the receipt), stating that the charge goes to the staff to provide a "living wage", which is what the employer should be doing in the first place. The fuzzy un-ethicalness of this will promise that I will never step foot in this place again. To add insult to the preposterousness of this issue, is the additional tip blank on the credit card receipt. When we discovered this, we stood in line again and requested all of the service fee be refunded immediately. The cashier did so, but it took much longer to accomplish, than the original purchase. Oh and the food? I've had much better for a lot less. As to service, the cashier was pleasant enough, but you stand in line to order, you fill your own beverages, you collect your own utensils, the food was delivered to the table, so I'm not sure what even 12% was being charged for. In short: AVOID THIS TOURIST TRAP AND EXPENSIVE MISTAKE, as we will be doing from now on.
author: Doug W.

description:
3 1/2 stars might be more accurate. 7/25/16 3:04 pm Cheeseburger, Fries, Fountain soda.
Burger: Excellent
Fries: Excellent almost as good as In& Out and plenty to take home.
Fountain: Coke & Ice good refills OK.
$20.52 Total. That is a too high for this type of food and location. I did not like having to pay 12% service charge with out being asked. There was a option after the transaction. There was also a TIP jar in front of the cash registrar.
author: Ed S.

description: Just kind of average. Good portions but overpriced for an okay burger. Food has a great looking presentation but you're left disappointed when you bite into it. Staff seemed to be annoyed with everyone in the restaurant as well.
author: Jimi B.

description: Burger, fries and shake = $28, not worth it by any means. Crappy service and so overpriced. Idk what happened to this place in the last 4 years but it's not as good as it was.
author: Mandy F.

description: Had a really good cheese burger and onion rings. My fiancé had the Steak burger on Sough dough bread and it was a little small but also really good. Location has a really cool vibe and nice staff.
author: Allie S.

description: Too expensive, no flavour.. waste of my time and money. The place looks really cool and the menu has lots of variety, also the meals are huge. So you can imagine my disappointment when all this built me up only to be let down on the taste. All 4 of us had different burgers and they all lacked flavour. Even the fries had no salt. Wish I checked yelp before going there!
author: Rayna C.

description:
To Burger Urge

So I came here with three people, one of whom I was treating out to eat. I work down the street so I've frequently seen their giant lettered sign as I've walked past this restaurant. And today was indeed the day I had an urge for burgers. I got a 8oz shake, a double burger (fries not included), chili cheese fries for my friend, and a vitamin water for my sister. If someone can make sense of this receipt for me that would be great. 

None of the employees would make eye contact with me after the food was paid for. 

Sincerely, 
C
author: Christian L.

description: We accidentally walked into this place thinking it was something else. Everything here is way overpriced and mediocre tasting. The only thing interesting is the facade which is what probably hooked us. It has plenty of other bad reviews, so not much else to say.
author: Darren T.

description:
A little pricey? Yes. Worth the money? Yes. Tried this place on whim one day with some friends, I was originally going to try one of the burgers until I saw the Buffalo Chicken Salad on the menu. Ordered it with a side of the garlic fries (good lord when I die I hope these will be my last meal). The fries and the salad came in LARGE portions (had enough to fill me up and leftovers to take home!) Definitely worth a try if you're ever in the city. 

Only downside was how long it took for a SALAD to be ready. My friends and I ordered at the same time- they ordered burgers and those came before my salad did. Didn't get my salad until AFTER they finished their burgers...
author: Jen D.

description: This is place is super cute with vegetarian options. I came just in time for happy hour. The food was good but nothing special. Ordered the mozzarella sticks and beer. My only complaint was when I ordered the shake, i got the strawberry shake and could hardly taste a strawberry flavor and was pretty pricey for a shake.
author: Khristine C.

description:
Haven't been here in 3 years. But everything was as amazing as it was from the last time I have been there. Went with my cousin who hasn't been to SF before. Everything was perfect from the staff to the food. Huge gourmet burger that look fresh out of a burger commercial! They could barley got in your hand. Charlie, who I assumed was the manager/owner came over and talked with us for a little while. He's a cool guy. Highly recommended this place for all locals and tourist who never been to the Haight/Ashbury area. Thank you Charlie. If you're reading this, remember to come to Broadway and I will hook you up like you did us!
-Zak
author: Zak B.

description: Short but sweet the Vegetarian burger Patty is deep fried! Not a positive. I will have to try the others before I write a full review.
author: Roger C.

description: More like 3.5 but who's counting fun burger ,sandwiches and salads all well cooked with good flavors fries big orders so share. Fun to sit and people watch too. Staff pleasant place stays cleaned up too. I would try for a lunch bite
author: Michelle B.

description: The lady with short dark hair working behind the counter is very inconsiderate. Food is blah.  Eat somewhere else.
author: Sean S.

description: The best thing here was the service. Thommy was awesome. Really sweet and attentive. Go for happy hour - $3 delicious wings. The sweet potato fries were awesome. Things to improve: We wish the burger was thicker, and come out medium and not well like we asked.
author: Oscar W.

description: Horrible food. 16$ for a sandwich,  charged me an extra 12% gratitude for having them "split" the meal because I was sharing with a friend. GTFO. The sandwich is already cut in half you are going to charge me extra just to say we shared it. This place is robbery. Stay away. Cafeteria food
author: Mark C.

description:
Great burger, way too big to eat!!

We wandered in a little concerned because it was a little early and the crowd had not started to roll in.  They have a great selection that includes vegetarian burgers and sandwiches!   Soda, beer and shakes to select from....nice!

Our order was prompted, delivered to the table and quite filling.  They have a combination of casual and semi casual which I like.  And they are proud to giveon you enough to be well fed when yiu leave - which is what my server told me when observed how huge my burger was.

Most impressive was how clean and comfortable it was.  It is so obvious that the management is concerned about their client's full experience. 

Now as far as the burger.  Excellent!

If in the Haight /Ashbury district this is a must stop!
author: Angel T.

description: Solid burgers, great happy hour specials on beer. Service was awesome, our waitress Tommy was super attentive and friendly!
author: Courtney R.

description: I was visiting S.F from Montreal and walked in this cool area and saw this place. I am a vegetarian so I got extremely excited when I saw ALL the amazing Veggy options they had. Sadly they were out of the veggy burger (it was 2-3 pm really out of veggy ???). I had no other option so I took the portobello burger which was OK but I had better, the fries were very disappointing a McDonlad style fries I would expect a cool place like this to have normal fries with skin and all. Bottom line very pricey, ok but not amazing food and was a little hungry afterwards. I dont live in the area so I wont have the chance to not-return again but if you do
author: Tomer N.

description: Great burger place! They do pizza, chicken and vegetarian options too. Good food, great garlic fries and awesome staff! Thommy was her name I think. She was super friendly and really sweet, even as the place was a mad house! Highly recommend it if you're looking for something tasty.
author: debra l.

description: Good food (great garlic fries and shakes). They even let you take away (and into Hobson's, which is awesome. Great service (Thommy is really attentive and sweet). Would recommend if you are around Haight Ashbury.
author: Jason L.

description: Worst veggie burger I've ever had (potatoes and whole beans, falls apart-- tastes like Elmer's paste, if you ever ate that as a kid). Tasteless Kraft-like cheddar cheese. Also, it cost $16 and the cashier added a mandatory $2 tip for herself. Never again.
author: Danielle F.

description: Bit nicer than most fast food burger places, it serves beer which is cool, the burger I got was pretty big and filling, I forget the name but it had avocado on it, it was brought to my table relatively fast, nothing spectacular but got the job done for a quick decent meal
author: Daniel S.

description: Awesome happy hours .. delicious hamburgers great place :) I met the owner Charlie really nice guy .. the taste of the food it's just great
author: Lenin J.

description: This place has the yummiest garlic fries and Tommy is such a sweetheart. She took great care of us.
author: amberley w.

description: Amazing atmosphere. Particularly if you're into rock. Awesome mural of the Stones using real guitars. Very good burgers as well
author: Tim B.

description: The place itself was cute w all the wall art so that's nice but the food was very bland and nothing special. My burger had no flavor, it was very basic. And the French fry serving was way to much , I don't need a mountain of fries not trying to get fat here. My friend that was with me was vet disappointed even more so and her sati which was fucking shit. Plus it gave me bad diarrhea, and good burgers don't do that to me. I don't suggest this spot and it's a little pricey, and not worth the price. I feel like I paid and extra 10$ than what the food is really worth. Over all , id still eat there if I'm hungry and around but it's not a place where I'd go back cause of a craving.
author: Sophia H.

description: The veggie burger was lacking flavor, but the shoe string fries are great! The margarita pizza wasn't all that great either. The staff on the other hand is very nice and welcoming which is always great and a major plus.
author: Kat G.

description:
I actually enjoyed my burger, the Love & Haight, super Californian. I love sprouts, you never see that around anymore since some health scare years back. It was pretty big, shared it with a friend for an afternoon snack. Not cheap for a casual burger joint, doesn't even come with fries.. which I really wanted but didn't get because I'm trying not to be a fatty.

Cashier was odd.. not friendly but not outwardly mean. We were one of 2 parties in the restaurant at the time, so it wasn't like they were busy...
author: Vivian H.

description:
Had a nice chat with the owner.  He refilled my soda and struck up a pleasant conversation. However! Their fishy mandatory (unless you specifically request that it's not included) 12% service is most definitely illegal....

On second visit, staff won't give me a bathroom key or exhibit any level of basic customer service.

In the end... high prices, poor service and fishy business practices will keep me away.
author: Sarah N.

description: We were close by at a festival and we were all pretty hungry. Didn't want to stand in the long lines for the street food so we stopped by here. You can't really mess up a burger right? Prices are a little high compared to what you are getting but it's good so I'm not complaining.  Cooked just the way you order it. And the side of fries is huge! We needed up taking a lot to go and giving it away to a nice young gentleman that was looking for food.
author: Jordan C.

description: My dad and I parked in front to go check out the shops and we were quite surprised how tasty the food was. For $17 we got a medium pizza, two drinks (free refills) and mozzarella sticks. Good deal, friendly staff, yummy food and cool vibes.
author: Breanna A.

description:
If you're a tourist: eat here. San Francisco hearts your money.

For everyone else: go somewhere (anywhere) else but Burger Urge. I mean, unless you like paying almost $50 for two burgers, two drinks, and one order of curly fries...
author: Tori D.

description: They think they are serving burgers in Paris they charge you $$$ and self service and they get the order young the food is good but last time I went I said never again because based on the prices gordon Ramzi should pop out of the kitchen and serve you your burger
author: Hashem K.

description: Great place. I love the environment, music and artwork. All the guitars hanging from the ceiling and artwork everywhere are so cool. Food is amazing! Very clean. Great service.
author: Beth H.

description:
Great service & staff! Thank you Charlie
Tasty Fries. Always opens seat , beer, burgers !!! Cant beat it!
author: JO W.

description:
1) Way too priced, and not worth for the money paid... $18 for a burger? I was looking for caviar in there, but couldn't find it. 
2) Also, they include a 10% tip automatically in the bill, hidden between tax and SF employee mandatory, and than they give you to "sign" - read to leave additional tip. Ridicules...
3) They didn't give me a receipt. You have to ask for it. 

NEVER AGAIN!
author: Alexander A.

description: Scam and a half if you don't go during happy hour. However, the food is really good, the tv's are nice, the location is nice for people watching, and the fireplace is a really nice touch. The good news about the pricing is that 'Happy Hour' is every weekday from 5-9 (or something like that) which basically covers all of dinner time, so great news for locals but not for weekend tourists. Happy hour prices basically get you a burger, fries, and drink for the same price as a weekend/Non-happy hour burger
author: Joe D.

description:
The wine deals were absolutely amazing! Also, the owner Charlie talks with the guests all the time and attends to their needs exceptionally.

Great vibe. Great deals. Great food. What else do u need from a restaurant?
author: Antonio G.

description: This place is Awesome! Best prices, best staff! Especially the beautiful Fi (sounds like number 5 without the V)
author: JeNeel M.

description:
Had a vegetarian burger.  Unlike most burger joints this place offered many styles of the vegetarian alternative. 

Pretty tasty too with all the trimmings. 

Clean and fast. 

12% service charge which many folk hate but at least it avoids the American obsession with thing.
author: Joseph L.

description:
Okay, here's the thing: the food is pretty good. Actually, some of it is amazing; pretty much all of their signature burgers are delicious, and their garlic fries are to die for. Everyone seems to be on the same page about this.

Why the low rating? Well, Burger Urge is absurdly overpriced, it takes forever to get your food, and the staff is just not helpful. For example, you need to have a key to open the restroom, but every time I've asked an employee for the key, they'll wander off and then reluctantly hand it to me with at least mild annoyance. I know stuff like that is a distraction from your job, but come on. If I'm paying almost $20 and am waiting almost 20 minutes for a burger, some fries, and a drink, then at least provide decent customer service.
author: Erik B.

description: This place has an interesting menu. The food is overpriced by $2-3 for anything on the menu. I decided to get a chili cheeseburger and it was okay. I hadn't had a hamburger in a while. I had seen this place and never tried it. I might stop by again to grab a bite.
author: Denise C.

description:
This was the first time we ate at Burger Urge and we loved it. The atmosphere, the burger and garlic fries and the owner was outstanding! We truly enjoyed going to this local SF joint and enjoying their food and speaking to the owner, super friendly and inviting. We will go back for sure and try their pizza next time. It was a happy yummy Friday at Burger Urge thank you owner you made our first time there memorable. We will be back said Arnold... 
Alicia & Sasha
author: Berta Alicia B.

description: They are still running the same sleazy auto gratuity scam. What is worse, is that if you don't catch the charge flashing by on the register, they don't give you an itemized receipt, AND TRY FOR A SECOND TIP on the credit card slip. Not to mention it was an expensive and disappointing burger. Tasted like the cheapest of cheap flavorless grey beef, and doesn't come with fries. Is that worth 12-17 dollars to you? Not me. TOURIST TRAP CRAPHOLE, stay away.
author: Jack S.

description:
A little pricy but, I think the burger was good enough to warrant the $10 price tag. It's the Haight, this is relatively cheap compared to some of the things you're going to buy here. I wouldn't come here everyday but it is worth a try. 

My favorite would have to be the garlic fries, unlike most places that dump a fist full of chopped garlic leaving you with breath strong enough to take out a whole city block, this place takes a relaxed approach. The garlic flavor is there, it's buttery, but not over powering.
author: Ben D.

description:
Fancy? No.
Quality? Yes.
Large portions? Definitely.
Reasonably priced? Absolutely.

Strolling down Haight with no particular agenda, passed by the Urge.  Wasn't hungry yet so we decided to keep walking and shopping for a bit before deciding what to get.  We had looked at the menu and it looked pretty filling so we strolled back.

They have a good vegetarian menu as well as a standard burger menu.  1/2 pound burgers looked huge, and so was the veggie burger.  I noticed a good looking combo on the "meat" side and asked if I could substitute a veg pattie and they happily obliged.  Really really filling burger on sourdough with grilled onions and mushrooms.  A little ranch on the side and I was set.  We added an order of sweet potato fries which was HUGE.  Plenty of food, and reasonably priced for what you get.  

A nice thing about this spot too is that it's really large and spacious inside.  I like this because after pushing through tiny boutiques and shops, sitting elbow to elbow with strangers at a tiny restaurant doesn't really sound too appealing to me.  So, I loved the space and our own private table.  

I'd come back for sure next time I am in the area and have the burger urge.
author: Sean M.

description: Didn't try a burger but omg that chili boy is that the business just what I needed for a light and delicious  meal this is an amazing find just off Haight and ashbury
author: Nicholas L.

description:
Halleluja! Rejoice, both  carnivores and vegans! Now there is a place where everybody can - and definitely will - satisfy their burger urges, yearnings, and wild desires. No compromise, Burger Urge has something for everybody - juicy meaty options (pretty much everything on the Signature Urge list, Pineapple being our favorite), classic options (BLTA, Chicken Club sandwiches, Classic burger), something for staunch vegans - Portobello Mushrooms are strongly recommended);  something for your skinny ever - dieting friend (yes, the one you hate) - tons of salads, hummus sandwich, pretty much everything, if you skip the bun (and it's not going to be wasted, bread is good here, your friends will happily devour it :)

Savvy options are there, too - soup and salad combo is good example.
Special kids menu is not even necessary (though pretty ample), since even picky little eaters can find something yummy - Classic Grilled Cheese sandwich makes everybody happy. We personally didn't dare to try the Elvis (banana and bacon) but hey, who knows? As they say in German, there is a lid for every pot, someone might be brave enough and enjoy it :) 
Skip the Vegge-tastic salad, though - with so many thrilling options, this is something you can replicate at home, but by all means, try the Garlic Fries - they just hit the spot! The pleasure spot, that is - not too crunchy, not too mushy, not too overwhelming garlicky, just pure indulgence.
Prices are reasonable, portions are big enough to stuff a hungry (old) hippie and to share some with friends, too :) 
Recommend to a friend? You bet! To all of them! 
Coming back? For sure, lots of things are still there to try.
author: Chris V.

description:
The two stars here are only for the customer service. They were very nice and did their job with a smile.

So what's wrong with this place?  Sub par food at prices too high to justify.

BF had a burger and I had a pizza.  I would never recommend getting pizza here and think they should take it off the menu.  It tasted like a frozen cheese pizza what was cooked in the oven and had basil sprinkled over it.  Was it? Or was it actually hand made? I'll never know, but I know it wasn't good and actually made me sad.

The burger was better.  It was cooked as we asked it to be and the whole thing was good, albeit a little on the salty side.  What gets us is that for a $14 burger it didn't come with anything.  No fries, no drink.... nothing.  I mean it was a good burger but not for that price.

I can almost guarantee I won't be coming back here. The food is mediocre for the most part and over priced.
author: Vicky C.

description:
Good place to take a lunch break while strolling and shopping in The Haight...

Garlic Fries-Good flavor and aroma. I prefer a thicker cut fry but still enjoyed the generous portion. 

Love & Haight burger:  They ran out of sprouts which would have given it a different mouth feel. Nevertheless, it was a good burger. The meat, cooked medium rare, was juicy. 

Pineapple burger:  My daughter liked the teriyaki sauce which enhanced the medium cooked burger. 

Both burgers were the 1/3 lb regular size fare which was more than enough!
author: Gene D.

description:
If Jerry Garcia was alive, I'm sure he and his Grateful Dead band will enjoy the newest burger joint in the heart of the Haight-Ashbury area- the street he built. 

One of the newest burger joint is one of the biggest I've visited. I do like the vintage artworks, mixed music played, a pair of huge TV with satellite programming, and a warm fireplace. With the recent cold and windy weather, "heck yeah" I quickly snag that table near the fireplace after I placed my order. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/goW9LHk_2ozTNypmq2pO8g?select=R1wv7c59FBWZ81VQBf_xyQ

I ordered the "Down and Dirty" burger. For $8.99, the sandwich had a third of a ground beef patty, melted cheddar cheese, BBQ sauce and onion ring in a toasted bun. There are no combo packages here. So for another $3.99, I got a side of Onion rings and a $5.00 bottle of Sierra Nevada Pale ale. This is a very solid burger, especially for the area that lacks any decent burger places.  The onion rings are good. But I wish I got more, which is always the case. There is not much of a beer selection. At least they have my Sierra Nevada Pale ale. My meal: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/goW9LHk_2ozTNypmq2pO8g?select=b3kJlMRa2fwgENQDkiNDMw

As I was enjoying my meal, I was watching the NFL network. I also met the owner: Sam. He gave me a sample of the freshly made Spinach and feta calzone, which the joint also serve. I might try that very soon. My free treat: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/goW9LHk_2ozTNypmq2pO8g?select=_SwBc0KdbI5c-LDbiMJ5Tw

The workers were very nice i.e. the petite and happy Chinese lady continuously refilling Joe Cool's glass of water. 

We all know new burger businesses can be pricey. But for them using fresh ingredients, it is definitely worth a spending and an experience of pleasure for burger lovers like me.
author: Matt G.

description: I love the happy hour prices that's available from 5:30 -9:30.  They have chicken wings that are super crunchy but I believe there might be two recipes - from their original recipe.  Charlie the owner is very friendly and will be sure you have a great time in his restaurant.  All the staff are awesome; they just give excellent customer service...my kids love the pizza.  It reminds me of Tony's pizza but more tasty.  I give this restaurant 5 stars because of its convenience to me, the super friendly service, and the crunchy chicken wings from their original recipe.  My kids also love coming inside as its environment and theme state the perfect hang out place.
author: Yasmin P.

description: AMAZING BURGER. This place never fails to impress. The love and haight burger is perfection in a bun, and Thommy was very helpful and kind and enhanced my overall experience
author: Hannah J.

description:
I hesitated between 3 and 4 stars but ultimately I had to go with three.  The food was really good but it was way too expensive if you ask me.   A burger and onion rings came out to $17 and that didn't include a drink.   That is WAY too expensive for a fast service place if you ask me.

Now for the positive: the food.  I had onion rings and the San Francisco Original burger which consisted of sauteed onions, mushrooms, Swiss and cheddar cheese and steak sauce on sourdough bread.  I liked how they used sourdough bread and the steak sauce added nice touch.  The patty was also cooked properly so that it was juicy.  The onion rings were crispy and in general really good.  The food was a little on the greasy side but was still tasty.

If the prices were cheaper I'd have no problem recommending this place but they are a big turn off.   If you're on Haight and you're REALLY craving a a burger then go but if you're not then consider going somewhere else.
author: Julia D.

description: As someone who can't go a week without a burger I can say that this spot is worth every penny you spend. Not only is the food good but the customer service will definitely keep you coming back. A young lady named Thommy helped replace my friends food after a random homeless man grabbed an onion ring off his plate before I could even get out of my chair to make a replacement order. Being someone who works in the food industry as well the one thing I appreciate above all else is excellent guest experience and it was delivered toda
author: Dylan H.

description: This place overcharges for everything and includes a 12% gratuity. Food is meh and owner is an asshole about the bathroom. Total tourist trap
author: Ben P.

description: This restaurant was wonderful from the start. Charlie the owner was an amazing host and great person all around. He was super attentive and outgoing, the vibe felt just like home. The cashier Thommy was super sweet and friendly as well:) not to mention the amazingly cheap happy hour prices prices; you can NOT go wrong with giving this place a try.
author: Dilcia B.

description: Have been here a few times. Try to stop in whenever we are close by if we visit the city. Burgers are great and the garlic fries are awesome!
author: Zach W.

description: One of the best burgers in SF! Wonderful customer service! Love it. Thanks Tommy for the great service awesome and polite
author: Xochitl C.

description: I got the Love & Haight burger and was not disappointed!! My table split an order of half curly fries and half garlic fries. Both amazing. Glad we split them because it was too much for one person!
author: Rachel Y.

description: Don't ever come on a busy Sunday afternoon ... what a big mistake!  The burger was good!!  but when it came down to the Fry's  they were very overcooked and dry. We took them up to the owner. He said it was too busy for them to make some more for us!!!  After driving an hour and 40 minutes to get here and waiting 45 minutes to even place the order, to get this.  Not good!
author: Nope N.

description:
Met Charlie the owner tonight and he explained how he's put all his effort into improving the place since he took over at the beginning of the year.  The food is delicious and the happy hour offers can't be beat. 
Definitely check it out and grab a bite and a beer.
author: Michael G.

description:
Girlfriend just went in to grab a burger and fries for us on the way to the beach. Then texts me as she's waiting to say it was $18 for one burger and one side of fries. 

That's obscenely over priced for a counter-service burger, even for haight street.
author: Andrew S.

description:
Don't really know if i LIKE this place or if i was just REALLY hungry but i think this place is ehhhhhhhhhhhh. 

My friend and I were shopping on Haight street and she really needed to pee so we came inside but they require you to order to use their restroom so I looked at the menu since i was starving, and every burger was over $10 bucks and they have a special double or triple patty burger for $29.95 like c'mon cuhhhhhh. I would make it splash and order that triple patty burger but i settled for some garlic fries for $5 bucks. Turns out to be some really good garlic fries so i might come back and try that thirty dollar burger one day when i get a job that pays $30 an hour. 

Overall, i've experienced better burger joints so ehhhh.
author: Mark R.

description: i have been going to this place  ever since i got to the city two years ago, i love the guitars on the walls and ceiling as decoration, huge burgers, BEST fries you will ever have and their happy hour special is the best if you dont want to spend that much. (garlic fries and yucca fries!!) this is seriously the only burger place i bave encountered that makes also great pizza, wings, salads and milkshakes. Thommy is an attentive and friendly person and all the staff in general is great, i highly recommend this place, my friends and i love it!
author: Sofía S.

description: $18 and some change for a simple hamburger (no cheese which will cost another $1-2) and fries (no drink).  That includes an automatic gratuity (tip) that I wasn't expecting.  You should save that $18 and have a feast at In N Out.  Anywhere on Haight street should be cheaper and more delicious.
author: Marlin D.

description: For a family of 5, on vacation and stumbling in for dinner, Burger Urge was just what we wanted. Awesome happy hour specials, average San Fran prices, and a cool atmosphere. The burgers were good, garlic fries were great, and the Buffalo salad was awesome. Portions are big, so 3 meals feed 2 adults and 3 kids.
author: Larry R.

description: Great Happy Hour!!! Burger fries and a drink for $10!!! Thommy helped us with deciding what to get and everything was very fresh and delicious.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Burger urge is basically the ideal burger joint. It has everything one who craves a burger could ask for. Starting with a pretty solid burger. Im not gonna lie and say the burger was the best I ever had but it was good and followed all the proper criteria to be a nicely made burger. The fries where in fact very tasty and the combo of the two is perfect they complement each other very well.
The restaurant itself is put together very nicely it is not to clutter with decorations but has enough to create an easy going atmosphere. The workers where exceptionally nice and tentative. For me all of these things put together is all I can really ask for in a burger joint.
author: Haley M.

description: A total scam. First they added that 12% tip without asking - I didn't realize until I got my food. Second - this is a picture of their "large"  1/2 lb burger they charge $15 for! And that doesn't include fries! You can see the burger is barely larger in diameter than the sliced tomato. I complained and they said nope, that is the large. I complained some more and they finally just made me another burger. That's the only reason for 2 stars instead of 1. DO NOT EAT HERE.
author: Michael A.

description: Best vegan burger ever! Fries were delicious. Found this gem randomly and I like that they offer vegeterian options. Was pretty pricey! Payed almost 25$ for a meal
author: Laura S.

description: Save your money.. This place is a joke. I went with my boyfriend he ordered a sandwich and I ordered a cheese burger both combos...the total ended up being $42!!!! So 20 bucks for each plate?! Ridiculous... Anyways I was expecting burgers that tasted like they came from heaven based on the price.. I thought wrong! Disgusting! McDonald's burgers taste better than this crap! I felt terrible that my boyfriend had to pay that much for our food! Especially because I didn't eat it..
author: Tanya R.

description:
Had a great experience, the food was not overly prices and delicious.  It was a bit busy and it seem like they where a bit overwhelmed, also the glasses they gave us needed to be sent back because they where not rinsed correctly.  Aside from that we would try them again. 

To the owners.. make sure you go the extra step in checking things before they go to your customers... a little quality control would be great.
author: Frank C.

description: Ate at 3 PM, and as of 10 PM haven't eaten anything else, due to my stomach being messed up. Not worth it in the slightest.
author: Christopher M.

description: AMAZING FOOD!!!! Worth every penny spent. Quality food, quality service. Will come back again. Highly recommend!!!
author: Andrew A.

description: Great place to have lunch.  Burgers and wings are bomb! Definitely recommend this place great food with amazing and friendly staff. Service is fast too which is always a plus
author: Denise F.

description: Great burger, good service. The portions of the fries are massive so if you're with a group order half of what you need. This place is super expensive.
author: Lee S.

description: I would give it 0 stars if I could. Both me and my mom ate there and got food poisoning right away. We had burgers and we asked for it well done and noticed it was a little raw but we just kept eating it cause it didn't taste too bad. We have been throwing up the whole night and day and it's been 2 days now and both of us still feel horrible. Never will go there again.
author: Maria P.

description: Burger Urge is a nice place to get fries with friends. The prices are very reasonable and the portions are nicely sized. The manager, Charlie, is very friendly, and the staff are patient and helpful. The thin garlic fries were very good, with just the right amount of garlic. I love the setting, which makes for a unique experience.
author: Apis M.

description: My gf and I ordered 2 burgers with fries and a drink and it came to $49.57 along with the 12% gratuity that they top on your bill lol. They expect you to reas the bottom left small font on the menu, thats how they justify that 12% tip. Are you serious? The food doesn't seem worth it so we walked out. We went to Cable Car on Geary and enjoyed a delicious burger, fries, and drink for $20.00, it's well worth the 5 min drive.
author: Devin W.

description:
Awww. It makes me so sad to see this place with only 2.5 stars! I thought their burger was one of the best I've ever had. Deee-licious!! We were actually next door at Hobson's Choice having some rum bowls and they offered food from Burger Urge. However, since it was right next door, we decided to just walk over ourselves and order it (cash only if you order at Hobson's and they also charge an extra $4-$5 per burger).

All of us got the Love and Haight (love the name!) and it was so yummy. Came with sprouts (very unique) and avocados (my favorite). My boyfriend and I were able to share a burger 'cause it was just that big! We also got some sweet potato fries but those didn't stand out to me as much. I think some people next to us got their garlic fries though, and THOSE smelled delicious. I would definitely come back for more!
author: Jennifer T.

description:
I was seriously disappointed! Expensive and undercooked. That could be why my food was delivered so quickly. The garlic fries were fair to middlin', but the rest convinced me never to return.
The wait staff was very nice. Seating uncomfortable for anyone over 20.
author: Cherry S.

description:
The most expensive hamburger meal you'll ever eat! For a $12/+ cheeseburger,
 fries should be included! Not $4 more. Potatoes are cheap throw them in! 
Three stars for at least being a good burger!
author: O. S.

description: Can't Believe this has an average of 2 1/2 stars! Our food was excellent! I had the down and dirty, my husband had the San Francisco sourdough. The portions were generous the fries were enough to share. Service was very friendly. Restaurant and restrooms were very clean.
author: Mindy P.

description: The special we ordered was advertised as $9.99 for a pizza & two drinks. The total came to close to $14--huh?
author: Sarah M.

description: I'm giving it four stars for one reason only: too expensive. I would divorce my husband to marry those garlic fries if I could, but holy hell the price makes the delicious food unjustifiable. Had the salami and cheddar sandwich and it was amazing. The food is excellent here, but you can only afford it if you wipe your butt with $20 bills.
author: Hollie M.

description: I was excited when I first saw this place. Looks cool from the outside, and we could use a decent, quick burger place in the area. I was very disappointed. Touristy and overpriced. No thank you.
author: Ryan Y.
