description: Shout out to the owner Charlie for making our experience excellent. We will be back very soon! The chicken wings are out of this world!! I highly recommend this!!! Thank you burger urge!
author: Nick D.

description: I ended up at this establishment twice in the same day while moving a cousin into college and enjoyed two fantastic salads as well as a good beer selection during the extended happy hour. Yum!
author: Allison H.

description: The food is actually pretty decent, but the prices are completely outrageous. They have great financing options though, I think I locked in 1.9% APR for 30 years...
author: Phillip E.

description: Happened to stumble into this place since we were hungry for 3 hours. I ordered the cheeseburger medium rare with sweet potatoe fries. Food came pretty fast and burger was cooked just right and the sweet potatoe fries was not too thick but also crispy! Charlie came to check table to table to ask if our food was okay and even served us another round of sweet potatoe fries on the house! This place is definitely a must for a classic burger/fries combo!
author: Amir M.

description: Overpriced even by SF standard.  Staff is nice but food is not really worth talking about....family of 4 and $65 for a burger joint where burgers are below average...
author: Mo A.

description:
Wow I definitely should've ordered a burger here.....they're GIGANTIC!!  (Regular hamburger starting at $6 I believe) And the buns were freshly baked and toasted lightly; according to my friend, they held the burger together perfectly and didn't disintegrate.  

The house-made chili cheese fries http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/goW9LHk_2ozTNypmq2pO8g?userid=4MHFQcFfHzVe4ISx3lvHlw#2lFRffwSuYf8nT8_T8jo5A were $4.99 for a large basket... the chili was basically pinto beans and hardly spicy, so we added a bunch of tabasco.
author: Christina G.

description: Excellent quality food at a very reasonable price! The happy hour is amazing and delicious!! Very nice staff and very nice owner! Would recommend this place for anyone looking for great food at cheap prices in the heart of haight Ashbury. Definitely coming back!
author: Iman G.

description:
I made my way across town from the Marina to the Haight and I was starving! I stopped in Burger Urge because I didn't know when I was going to get something to eat next. 

I had the best chicken sandwich of my life (look at my picture...can't you see the love shining through?) and the best sweet potato fries ever. I washed it down with a San Pellegrino and I had enough energy to fend off the unusual people that roam up and down the streets in that neighborhood. 

I love burger urge. Wish they had one in DC. I'm a fan!
author: Kelly G.

description: No longer impressed with this place. The burgers are good but they have gone up in price a lot and are are now overpriced.  Also they now charge a 10% service charge!!! For what ?  This is a fast food burger joint !  One burger  with no fries and no drink is over $13. Save your money. Lots of other choices for that price.
author: P S.

description: The only reason that they may deserve one star is the garlic fries. Burger 13.00 and it was dry small although supposedly 1/3 lb...don't believe it. Fries did not come with it. Way overpriced for bad food
author: rassors T.

description: I enjoyed this place. The double 1/3 pound classic burger was good. One of the few place i have been to which asked how i wanted my burger. I asked for medium well my wife got well done. I had classic shoe string fires while my wife had garlic fires. Both were delicious. This place was a bit pricey. I paid about $40 for two people which I feel is kind of high for two burgers, fries and drinks.
author: Sarmad N.

description: Awesome burgers! I had the love and haight. Not too overkill with the ingredients, and is surprisingly light for a burger of its size. The yuca fries are also killer, and don't miss out on their homemade sauces! If you're looking for a hearty, and relatively healthy, meal, burger urge is definitely worth your time.
author: Yousif S.

description: THEY WILL ADD 12% GRATUITY TO YOUR ORDER! These people know absolutely NOTHING about service. U hasn't evehr been three before and i didn't-
author: James M.

description:
Burger Urge is doing what no other restaurant has the courtesy to do: prove they care about customer experience by doing construction work in the restaurant during the lunch rush, not to mention having the two guys working on it argue loudly with each other about how it should be done to maximize customer experience. 

We walked into Burger Urge at about 12:15pm on a weekday, when every restaurant SHOULD be doing construction, and found that the place where we were to place our order was blocked by a ladder with a man on it using power tools - just like you'd want for your dining experience. Then, after shouting our order over the sounds of the power drill, I was also lucky enough to then get to repeatedly say "excuse me" to another employee who was standing in front of the water cooler arguing with somebody into his phone, just to get some water. Finally - a restaurant that understands that what the customer wants is to be treated like an inconsequential, meaningless annoyance by the people taking their money!

Then we sat down and waited. We had ordered our burgers medium rare, but luckily Burger Urge knows that the BEST way to get a burger is medium-well, so they took their sweet time and overcooked the burgers for us. Then they brought them out and we had to remind them that we had also ordered fries. But hey - they're busy doing construction, who has time to remember who ordered fries? 

The overall experience was also helped by the nonstop power-drilling and arguing that went on through our entire visit. It was much nicer than listening to some boring muzak over the stereo or even the inane chatter of the people we choose to spend our time with and really made for a relaxing, fun lunch. 

And then the price - about $25 for two regular burgers and an order of fries (that we almost didn't get). What a bargain! I would expect they would start charging more in order to pay the never-ending construction laborers. 

So if you enjoy being treated like garbage, disregarded as a human being and customer and you couldn't care less about flavor, try Burger Urge! Yum-yum! *DRILL SOUNDS* *DRILL SOUNDS* *DRILL SOUNDS*
author: Drew H.

description: This place is ok. Defiantly not the best around sf. The thing that pushes me to give this 2 stars is not the fact that it's super expensive and not that great of food but the fact that I came in here by myself and they charged me gratuity without even mentioning it, and then to top it off there is a tip option on the receipt that they never asked me if I wanted a copy of. A burger and garlic fries with a water cost me 19.73. This place is sad.... When I asked about the gratuity the lady at the register looked like she had no idea what I was referring to. If it was a great burger I would've talked to the manager just to understand why they charge that when it's super expensive already. But no point to waste my time if im not going to come back.
author: Joe C.

description:
If Service,Quality Burgers(Neiman Ranch)
Garlic fries,Salads and veggie dishes are your thing....look no more....
"Burger Urge" ....enough said....simply the BEST!  *****
author: Kenny B.

description: Where do you go where your belly is URGING for food?? You go to BURGER URGE!! I go there 5 to 6 times a week and i got to say, the food just keeps calling me back!! Dont start with the customer service!! So i met two awesome, well known, great smiling workers at urge! They names are Ana and Frederick.. they are always in the front line waiting for action to happen. They work soo hard, always serve their people and make other happy. I got to to say, Burger Urge is one of the best places ive eaten at.. i will always go keep on URGING back!!
author: Francisco F.

description: The going price of a burger is on the up and up. I'm guilty of shelling out an average of 15 bucks at my favorite burger joints so i'm not turned off by Burger Urge's menu. It took me a nano second to land on the Love and Haight burger. A good balance of veggies and red meat with alfalfa sprouts, avocado, cheese, and some pesto aioli sauce slathered on a bun. It wasn't greasy and cooked an even medium. I'm a sucker for sweet potato fries! I had to salt them lightly myself but no real complaints. Sweet potato fries don't taste as oily too. After all, it didn't leave a lasting impression but it was a solid meal. I'm not trying to hold it up to something it's not. I didn't come out of my way to dine here. It's just a good burger and perfect when you're in the mood for one!
author: Samantha L.

description: Still wondering how their substandard offerings generate enough revenue to pay the lease on the prime corner location. I am a SF native and that means I'm an automatic foodie, this place is certified trash as the reviews imply; I can only assume that Midwestern tourists or an underground card room are keeping this place afloat. Cheers!
author: Tianna R.

description: We had a spectacular experience here. Wonderful food, even better hospitality! Happened to sit next to the owner who was a very outgoing, friendly, and generous person. Would definitely recommend to anyone who is on the fence. No doubt our number one stop on the next visit to San Fran!
author: Kayla B.

description: The food is not worth the price. They got my order wrong (I ordered the vegan veggie and they thought I ordered the vegan sandwich) which was still really lacking of ingredients (2 slices of cucumber??) and not at all worth 13$. It was actually even more expensive since they require a 12% service charge... For hardly any service. The only thing they could tell me to make up for my meal was a milkshake (even after its clear I'm vegan)
author: Emmeline M.

description: My boyfriend and I were hungry while shopping on Haight. We shared a mushroom swiss and fries. The burger was pretty good and the fries were crispy but nothing too special. The price was a bit pricey for what it was. Maybe if they brought down the pricing I would give this place a 4.
author: Lena V.

description: The burgers are at the low end of OK, far from great. The buns are massive and really detract from the burger. When you add the huge prices and iffy service, I go from three stars to two. I went here twice and can't imagine going back when there are other far better and less expensive options in the neighborhood, in particular Kezar and Burgermeister.
author: bill d.

description: Very expensive for burgers and sandwiches. Fries are not included . I had the basic burger which good, nothing exciting  $8.95. My boyfriend had the cheese burger! $10.95 and his friend had the sourdough burger $14.95. We got a basket of fries, which again weren't anything fabulous. We will not be going back.
author: Kelly P.

description:
Quite honestly, my best friend and I just came here to use the restrooms, in which you have to be a customer, which I've expected. 

The cheapest thing on the menu was a order of fries for $2.99 which is a standard price I suppose for restaurants in San Francisco. Wanting more flavor, I ordered garlic fries. Ugh, what a mistake. Could hardly taste the garlic flavor and I ended up drowning my fries in ketchup. Should have just saved a dollar and ordered the normal batch. 

My best friend ordered a pineapple burger of some sort, which she found delightful, but the plating was basically a burger over a sheet of wax paper. The pricey burger doesn't even come with fries! Lame. 

What really made me dislike the place was that our order took over half an hour, while I watched people from other tables (who arrived after us) receive their food. Finally I asked the waitress, who seemed very sweet, and she went to go check. Turns out our order got mixed up in the process somehow, and they haven't even started making it yet. I guess at least she was honest about it. 

Not spectacular. Not even good really, though it was a nice pitstop. Restroom needed a key.
author: Natalie Y.

description:
We ordered vegan burgers with family. The protein patty was bit below average in taste. It was close to tasteless. Also the bund was similarly dull. The burger was big and filling, but didn't give any good experience. 
The service was super good. We where there at late evening and there were very few customers. They helped to select the food and communicated with us in very nice manner. 
The place also looks very beautiful and that was got us in there. It's bit like rustic, but also modern and clean - exactly like a burger place should be.
author: Raimond S.

description: Had a really nice burger over here. Only the automatically applied gratuity reduce the rating by one star. Would come here again.
author: Felix H.

description:
I've been coming to haight street on random sundays to accompany my gf to sell off her unwanted clothing right at the dawn of 11am. For numerous reasons 1). 11am is the time most of the stores barely open 2). Sunday free available parking 3). We are usually the first in line because it can take a damn long time selling to those clothing stores

Also, im usually hungry with all this so with nothing really open except for that pork breakfast spot with a huge line of drunk, hungover young hipsters.

We didnt order any burgers or anything. We had brunch. Breakfast burrito and french toast. These were definitely fulfilling and big in portion. I had to take a to go box for more than half of my remaining french toast. Saw that everyone was ordering up burgers at this time in the morning. 

Customer service was great. The overall appearance inside the restaurant should be in the top when compared to all the neighboring businesses on haight.

So glad we discovered this restaurant [we parked right next to it]. Didnt want to settle and eat McDonalds on this particular morning. Plus breakfast stops at 10:30a?!!! [Adam Sandler Big Daddy scene. lol]
author: Jeff C.

description:
Worst veggie burger I think I've ever had. I had three bites to get down into the "meat" of it and then gave up, cut off the part I nibbled on, asked for a box, took it outside and gave it to a homeless street kid. I almost feel bad for the kid but hunger can be a spice and perhaps that made it eatable.  

About the veggie burger-
The cheese was barely even warm on top of the burger while the bun was hot and soft. Great bun but a horrible combination with the layer of cool cheese between the hot bun and the hot fried veggie burger crust. So yeah that gets us to describing the patty itself which boasts a hot fried crust giving it an exterior texture similar to the chicken patty things you used to find in the grade school cafeteria but with a ground combination of veggies on the inside that barely has any flavor. 

Anywhere on Haight street is better for a veggie patty... 

Side note- they make their milkshakes with Mitchell's ice cream which is a plus but even if you eat in they don't offer or ask if you'd like it with whip cream and it comes in a medium sized plastic cup for basically 6 bucks. Mitchell's = SF joy but the rest just makes me neutral on the shakes. I was so annoyed at the whole experience I just left it behind. 

And yes I was nice to the staff, paid full price, tipped 20%, and didn't bother them. Is not their choice that the veggie patty is sadness incarnate. 

I guess I'll have to go find something else to eat...
author: Justin T.

description:
Whoa whoa whoa, is this place really that well unliked? I can understand that not every burger joint is Umami Burger, but c'mon! They make a good burger here! Some of you make this place out to be worse than McDonalds. That's pretty unfair since MickyD's is absolute garbage. Worst of the worst, i'm sorry. They're down there with Applebee's.

Anyhow, let's get to the ol review, shall we? First off, the environs of this place are great. It feels part old school and part new school in this joint. Lots of places to sit as well, even when there's a lot of people being serviced. Seats are comfortable as well, with bench-esque seats if that's what you're into.

The staff here? Very friendly, patient, and timely. My order was taken quickly and without any issues. Food came out super fast as well. And that food? Great. My burger came out just the way I ordered it. It was juicy and flavorful through and through. This bad boy was huge as well! I ordered it with the garlic butter fries as well. Them junks was om nomin' on the real son! I was definitely filled and satisfied after that meal.

I'm not sure what else these folks need to do to please some of you guys. Seemed like a great eating experience to me. If you guys want less frills (and even less quality), there's probably a McDonalds or Burger King nearby that's ready to take your order.
author: Eric A.

description:
We came here during Bay to Breakers, so this review may be a bit biased due to how ridiculously busy it was. 

However, when a place doesn't serve fries with their burgers, that's a big thumbs down. 

It took forever and a day for the food to come out, and they lost one of the orders. 

It was crowded as F. And the workers were not very happy. Though that may have been because we were attempting to drink beer in their joint.
author: Melanie P.

description: Although the food WAS good, I did have to pay a 12% automatic gratuity which I was okay with... Until my order was messed up twice. I don't know why I had to pay a 12% gratuity if my drink order and fries were not correct. It wasn't even busy or loud.
author: Tanaya J.

description: First of all, they are playing Christmas music! Already in love! Second, the food is delicious, you can tell it's made to order. Third, our server, Thommy was awesome. It was our first time here and she gave us 5-star service! She was attentive and checked up on us to make sure we were enjoying ourselves. Overall, I'll definitely be coming back and bringing my friends. Found my new local burger spot
author: Royce N.

description:
I don't know what everyone is going on about, but this place is... Absolutely fantastic. Prices are very good for a gourmet burger joig in San Francisco, the food was excellent, quick service, and a very nice variety to the menu. 

Their tomato bisque, is to die for. If I had to live off of one food in the world, that soup would be it. It was over all of my expectations for such a place, and it easily is better than Super Duper Burgers, or any other place of such a style.

The Chicken Pesto sandwich, is also very good. They have a well measured out bread to food ratio, and it was very filling. 

The chilli cheese fries and the sweet potato fries are both, easily in the top 3 of their kind. I have rarely tasted fries that don't reek of grease, but at the same time are buttery and nice and delicious.

If you are in the Lower Height district, come here and check it out. Its amazing place.
author: Polina F.

description:
Came here with the boyfriend after the usual thrift shopping on Haight Street. Came in with high hopes... and boy were we let down. I got the "Down N Dirty" - beef patty, sharp cheddar, onion rings, and bbq sauce. The beef patty was so dry and tasteless that despite all the wonderful additions, it was still a let down. This place is overpriced for food that is lacking in quality. Sad to say, but Burger King's Rodeo Burger definitely beats the "Down N Dirty."

The only thing that saved this trip from being a complete disaster was the Garlic Fries.
author: Sam R.

description:
What an enormous amount of food we got here! 

I took a burger sandwich which i did not really enjoy but the garlic fries were amazing!

My two friends took a burger on a bun and enjoyed every bite of it! 

It was quiet pricy but for the amount of food it was worth every penny:)
author: Neil H.

description:
Dined here during the soft opening and can't wait to go back once it's open to the general public, because..... it's YUMMY DELICIOUS! Wow! Haight St. really needed a place like this! The prices are extremely reasonable, and the food is delicious. This is what we ate:

Regular Burger: 
on a fresh multigrain bun, very good and nicely cooked 1/2 pound patty of quality beef. The pickle slices were a nice size instead of those that you can't taste. Overall, a great burger!

Fries: 
thin cut, perfectly crispy, well salted.

Sweet Potato Fries: 
LOVED the sweet potato fries!!! They are served with a chili powder that goes so well with the sweet of the fries... in fact, I thought it was cinnamon tasting. I'd say these were the best sweet potato fries that I have had in a while.

Garlic fries: 
thin, crispy, and a lot of garlic, but not too overpowering. Parsley is a nice touch.

Veggie Burger: 
this is HOMEMADE style, not the frozen kind. It's soft, tasty, very good and good for you.

I hear they will have a turkey chili on the menu soon, which is meant to be a healthier option and it's the owner's recipe. 

Can't wait to go back.
author: OcchiDiGatto S.

description:
Cute place and good food.  The cashier could be nicer and my burger could have had more pesto.  The wait for our food was kind of long, about 20 minutes but I would say it's worth it.  

The garlic fries were the best I've had, they didn't have too much garlic like any other place does.
author: Rana D.

description: Decent food. Fri servings are giant. Meals are way overpriced but it's San Francisco so what do you expect. Got the tuna melt, it was okay, definitely had better. Biggest turn off was the prices. Also they don't serve free water! That to me that is ridiculous.
author: Dis K.

description: We found ourselves on Haight with 7 hungry young kids. Not many places were able to accommodate our party of 11. Burger Urge met all our needs. The food was really great and the staff was so helpful and personable. Thommy was especially awesome to all the kids and checked on us quite a bit. Not sure why this place doesn't have better ratings. So good!
author: Sarah C.

description: These are great burgers! I've been here many times and each time I've gotten a different burger, they're all good. Thommy was super helpful and friendly the last time I went... it's a solid establishment.
author: Blake S.

description: They don't serve foods to table but tips gonna be included on your bill automatically. Place was super clean but nothing special, and some table has a sign says only for big party. I feel like this place has few things to say without talking to you in person which wasn't really welcomed and taken care of. Also major down side was the price, no fries on the side but regular size of burger costs 13 something dollars? It was bit expensive for what we were getting. After all food was okay but again it was EXPENSIVE...
author: May Y.

description:
The green and orange paint is really ugly, but I'm glad to see something other than a tattoo parlor in that corner space. Even with the ugly color, it's a nice addition to the neighborhood.  Any use of the word "urge" on a sign is a plus. 

I asked for well-done but it came out medium-rare. Pink hamburgers make me squeamish. Overall impression: It tasted really good. The condiments were good and the bun was great!  They've been open only a week so they're probably still working out the kinks on the grill line, so I'll give them a couple weeks. Three stars.

Minus one star for onion ring situation. I asked for onion rings on the side. They charged me four bucks for an order of onion rings, but there were only nine in the box (see my photo).  Nine rings is just fine for a side order, but a side order should cost two bucks, not four. I expect to pay four bucks for a full order, but a full order should be a whole crap load more than nine rings.
author: Tim W.

description: Rude staff, way overpriced and unfresh food. Veggie burger drenched in chipotle sauce. Pizza was worse than a supermarket buy. If you want to pay for a $15 burger there's way better places. Had to put a star, but not deserving of it.
author: Nicole L.

description: A little pricey but what do you expect in the middle of a tourist area. The food was good, the service was quick, the employees were friendly, and they have what seems to be is the only clean bathroom in the area.
author: Art T.

description:
ONE STAR.  

I was showing some family around Haight Street - they were from Australia and we had to stop and use the restroom.  We went inside and I totally understand that restrooms are for customers only, so even though I didn't really want anything, we were all going to order beers so there aren't just 6 people coming in, using the restroom and leaving.  It would also be a nice time for us to grab a quick beer.

I asked for the bathroom key while the other people I was with were waiting in line.  The lady behind the desk smugly gave me the key.  I used the bathroom and on the way out I her my friends talking to someone over the counter saying we aren't supposed to use the bathroom before ordering, even though we were telling them that we were in line.  It was very rude to me how they were talking.

But whatever, we got to the front of the line and ordered 6 beers, 1 for everyone, and also by doing so thought we more than "bought our right" to use the bathroom.  Nope, I couldn't hear what the lady at the counter said but basically they can serve us just beers, we had to buy something else as well, like some fries. Needless to say we all just walked out... think someone was still convinced to buy a can of orange juice or something...

So basically, we can't use the bathroom without ordering.  We have to order first before using the bathroom.  We can't just order beers, we have to order food. I feel like the only way they can sell food is to swindle people into buying something...  It was pretty ridiculous, as we were about to spend over $30 (just to use the bathroom really) and that still wasn't enough.  They even seemed pissed off about the entire thing... just a smile would have changed the entire situation and would have warranted at least 2 or 3 stars since I hate giving out 1 star to a business. 

Like I said, I understand the rules of the bathroom.  It sucks, but I get why the establishment does it.  This, however, was completed stupid and made me give this place 1 star without even having it.   But judging by the other reviews, it looks like the food here isn't good anyways.
author: Jose R.

description: Doesn't really deserve 2 stars....terrible service...brother & his GF  ordered lettuce wraps and they were very rare - came with sprouts which neither wanted. Extra jalapeños were missing...took burger back up because it was just all wrong (we're not people who complain but this was bad.). Girl behind counter just looked at him like he was an idiot - she didn't even apologize...got new burgers pretty quick!  Finally right!  By that time who wants to eat...fries n sweet potato fries are nothing special....decent though...my buffalo salad was good.  No complaints.  Very expensive and there are much better places in the area than this place!!!  Skip it and go down to Cha ChaCha or the street taco place!!
author: kim p.

description: A pretty awesome selection of burgers and super cool staff.  I had the Love & Haight burger and it was cooked and seasoned perfectly.  YUM!  Everything on it was FRESH and they had a nice bottled beer selection.  It has awesome seating inside with a large windows to take in the scene outside while you fill your belly.  The price, for San Francisco, was decent too.
author: Patti M.

description: This place was amazing!!!! If you get the opportunity to order from Thommy you're in luck. She has the best recommendations. Also shout out to their fun festive holiday music vibes!!
author: Sean S.

description:
I was randomly walking around Haight lookin for some grub.. Then I saw it.. a new place I've never seen before.. Burger Urge.  Something about this place made me go here.  

I walked up in that joint and ordered a Down n' Dirty with a side of garlic fries.  The Down n' Dirty turned out to be a cheddar cheese melted, BBQ sauce slathered hunk of burger wonderfulness.  The BBQ sauce was tasty and tangy.  The meat was cooked just how I asked.  Topped with crunchy bacon and a fresh lettuce/tomato combo.

But the best part:  You know how when your demolishing a big burger and it starts to slide apart.  Well guess what.  That didn't happen.  The melted sharp cheddar kept my burger intact til the very last bite! YESSS!!! 

The garlic fries were thin and crunchy, not that much potato in them...  I would say they were just alright, compared to other bay area garlic fries. (Gordon Biersch for example)

Staff was quick and nice.  Place was clean and pleasant.  Overall a pretty good burger spot that I will for sure go back to.
author: Tim L.

description: This is hands down the WORST burger in San Francisco.  How they stay in business defies science.
author: Nate W.

description: The food and service was awesome!!! They had plenty of options for my whole family to eat. We loved it and their happy hour is spectacular! Our server Thommy was very nice and helpful. She made sure we had everything we needed. We will definitely be coming back.
author: Maya M.

description: Horrible food. Chili cheese fries consist of fries with pinto beans on top. Burger was raw.
author: Jennifer W.

description: I am very pleased with both the customer service and the food. I got the down n dirty with both sweet potato and garlic fries because the lady suggested I get both and she was right! I have to say the garlic fries are the best I have had in a while. I'm just really happy with the service and the welcoming smile from the lady I should have gotten her name!!! African American woman with a bun you're awesome!!!!
author: Heidi W.

description: Went there today and had a great meal. The burger was cooked to perfection. The waitress Thommy was great., A great experience.  Will return there again chris
author: Chris c.

description:
I don't like Burger Urge. It's like meat-loving America teamed up with some would-be fast food mentality to make a big, overpriced letdown of a burger joint.

The decor is whatever, license plates and TVs and some pop art. That's cool, that's fine. The cashiers and servers are nice and friendly. It would be an added bonus if you could get a burger and fries for less than eleven bucks, let alone a standalone burger (no, burgers do not come with fries), but that's fine too.

And they mayonnaise things, which is just not right. If it's gonna somehow end up on your burger, it should at least be listed on the menu board too. That pisses me off. And then if you return the burger - oh, it's got mayo - they will merely scrape it off and give it back. Big red flag there. I mean, I get it, not wasting food, but it's a big, expensive slab of meat coated in crap. Just make one not coated in crap to begin with. Problem solved.

I don't eat red meat anymore, so I had the Elvis with a turkey burger instead - peanut butter, fried bananas... great idea. Really though, it's creative, but the excitement is gone after two bites when it's just kind of dry and the only enjoyable thing is the size of the thing.

Ultimately, Burger Urge just isn't what you so badly wish it was. The people are nice, but that's not nearly enough of a reason to return.
author: Jiordan C.

description: This place is amazing. The atmosphere here is very chill and friendly. There are so many vegetarian options and you can't beat the happy hour deals. We got a medium pizza and two sofas for only 10 dollars! The service was phenomenal and the food was delicious! We've been here twice and it's been excellent every time and we love coming.
author: Leah W.

description:
Finally, San Fran showed me some good eats. Nothing special EXCEPT the healthy local bought feel.

Value: Good
Quality: Excellent
Atmosphere: I felt like I was in a ski lodge with all the pine around. Open kitchen.
Cleanliness: Clean
Service: Very Good, friendly, and prompt. The teller I had could speak up a bit more.

What I got: A soda and the love haight. Satisfaction! Sometimes the simplest works out so well. Next time I will try the milkshakes.
author: Steve L.

description: The food is awesome. Clean, Good Service. I had the mini sliders and just the right amount of food. The buns are delicious.
author: Andrew K.

description:
I love a readable board above a counter, angled down to me in line. I treat it almost like a draft board, where everything listed has a chance to be bought. When I read "Fat Boy Burger," it was destiny, cuz I definitely eat like one. Case in point: two burger places, in three days, where I ordered two burgers each. But this time, I held back on the fries and rings (yes both)....Fat Boy uses a damn quesadilla instead of a bun.

You definitely get the sense of a kitschy Americana theme here - perhaps a little forced, but not terrible or unwelcoming by any means. Plenty of good tv's, with the sound from a live Sharks game. Digging the fireplace and wishing more seats were next to it. But some guy spread out his hat, coat, and keys beyond his personal space across a table so he could read by himself in front of the fireplace, the entire hour while I was there. So annoying....Ok, I was kinda cranky. Sorry. 

I talked to two folks at the counter about what would be pink without being raw, so I decided on medium. Some places undercook, and some overcook. I'm disappointed without my rareness and juiciness. Obviously I need to start specifying medium rare when in doubt. You don't need to say it.

These folks were really nice and hopeful/confident that I'd enjoy my burgers, which goes a long way, and why I feel bad for dissing the burgers. They're conscientious as well. When I came out of the bathroom, the manager asked for the key back to give it to the next patron. I mentioned they were out of paper towels and he immediately apologized and wouldn't pass along the key  until he'd replaced them.

But regarding its burgers, Burger Urge remains a head scratcher. The Fat Boy wasn't pink but still tasted interesting due to the mild peppers and cheese (see pix). The Bacon Cheese burger was pink but tough and dry, is the only way I can explain it. Just odd, and disappointing. The burgers just don't live up to expectations, even though a 3-star average on Yelp isn't high in SF. Much of that is due to service and a clean, bright ambiance IMO.

I have no problem with the pricing when you consider fresh ingredients, service, interior, and location. None of them is cheap. But based on food enjoyment, I just can't recommend.
author: Mike H.

description: Ordered a classic cheeseburger along with some fries. Burger was too greasy and patty did not meet my expectations. The fries were also not cooked very well and became soggy after a few minutes. Although the food wasn't the best the atmosphere was great and the service was exceptional!
author: Junior M.

description: Food was fresh, I'll give them that. My boyfriend got the SF burger and he really enjoyed it. I got the veggie burger. It was good but lacked flavor. I just expected a little more for the price. The restaurant was clean and the decor was cute.
author: Liz M.

description: Initially went because we were a bit hungry and the sign outside read "Hamburger and Fries $9.99" thought that was a good deal so went in. The cashier informed me it was just Monday through Friday. I thought since we are already here we might as well order some food. I am glad I did. the food was great delicious burgers and oh so yummy fries. I must admit it is a bit pricey two fries, two burgers and two fountain drinks $32.00.  They made a mistake on one of the order but quickly fixed it before our food got cold, so that was a plus. Its a good clean place so I would definitely come back when i'm in the area.
author: Kylie L.

description: A great place for comfort food in the Haight. vegetarian choice will be the chili fries.. no meat. I made a mistake getting these realizing there was no meat. they were still awesome!
author: Love C.

description: I was trying to stick to a vegetarian diet and to my surprise, this burger place had an entire vegetarian menu. Pretty over priced, but not surprising considering the location. My sandwich ended up coming on regular sliced sandwich bread rather than a nice french roll which was disappointing and was skimpy on the cheese. My friends who got burgers said they were really great - so even though they have a lovely vegetarian menu, it's apparent that you must stick to the burgers.
author: Samanths M.

description:
One regular hamburger, one bacon cheeseburger, one order each of garlic fries and sweet potato fries, two drinks.  They got the drinks right anyway. And here, that means they successfully handed me two empty cups.

The toppings on my burger should've been on his bacon cheeseburger, umm, including the bacon.  The toppings on his burger should've been on mine. He got my sweet potato fries, I got his garlic fries. 

The garlic fries were delicious. The sweet potato fries were disappointing.  The burgers were okay.  Certainly not worth the inflated prices you'll pay. Most are over $9, and no, that doesn't include fries. $3 soda, about a can's worth of drink.

There's a $29 burger on the menu, this one comes with fries.  I assume this is a gimmick in hopes of getting on a food channel tv spot for ridiculous menu items.
author: Meg W.

description: Had the veggie-tastic (if my deteriorating memory serves me correctly) salad with a light balsamic dressing here on 11/18. Ample food that sufficiently filled my belly. Also ordered the sweet potato fries that I shared with my companion. The staff is friendly and the establishment clean, including the restroom.
author: Frank L.

description:
I was hungry while walking along Haight st and this place looked promising.

Turns out I was wrong. I spent $7.49 (after tax) for a drippy, soggy burger. I'm glad I didn't pay 2 dollars extra for cheese. 

Definitely won't have the "urge" to come back here.
author: Emily D.

description:
I went to Burger Urge a couple of times now and it's hit or miss. I had great burgers there, but then I had really dry burger's there as well. 
The portion of fries is really big, so it's great value for your money and the milk shakes are very good. 
But if I really want a burger I probably get it from somewhere else in the hood.
author: Magda S.

description: I really liked the fat boy more then what I ordered which was love and haight. If I go back again I'm definitely going to get that !
author: Karissa K.

description:
After having totally failed to find decent Indian food on this stretch of Haight, I settled on Burger Urge.  Though much more spendy than I'd anticipated (and fries are extra-boooo!), the burgers were great!  Top quality meat, well cooked, nicely portioned.  the fries were good too and fed two people.

The ding in the star comes from the cost and and lack of inclusive fries.  Personally: I think you can do one or the other (lower prices w/o fries or higher w/fries).  But higher prices w/o fries is a bummer.
author: Caleb H.

description: The onion rings were very tasty. Bathroom only for customers.  Servers were helpful also.
author: Michelle V.

description:
The burgers were good, nothing spectacular
But the staff was rude. They wouldn't give me the key to the restroom until we ordered. Really, I get it, you only want customer's to use your facilities but our party was in line to order and two in our group had already ordered and paid.
author: Lora S.

description: With such a low rating I contemplated stopping here however having come to this neighborhood numerous times and always spying that iconic burger at the store front I was finally inclined to pay a visit. I liked the venue. It seemed trendy, clean and was a good mix of restaurant and diner type feel. The menu offered a unique and diverse array of tastes but I found I wasn't hungry enough to order an entire meal. My friend ordered the chicken sandwich with garlic fries. He said his sandwich was good and I ate half of his garlic fries which I found tasty and perfectly cooked. Service was friendly and quick and the prices are a little high (roughly $10 a burger not including sides which are about $4) but reasonable compared to the other dining options in this area. I'd pay another visit and order a burger next time. The venue, service and fries were good enough to warrant a 3 star rating.
author: Kristy F.

description: Never seen anything like it.  I was starving and didn't have time for a sit-down.  Big mistake.  Got the small burger and fries and it was $17.  Yup.  The food is shit and even at that price they wouldn't give me a cup of water.  Cashier could see the rage in my eyes and said "hey I just work here."   Run from this place!
author: Mister H.

description: If I could give this place zero stars I would. First off the chick with the pink eye is a bathroom nazi. I work on Haight too and when someone needs to use the restroom just let them. She actually followed me in the bathroom and woukdt let me pee unless I bought something. So I ordered their burger just so I could pee. What a mistake. Not only rated like horse meat, it gave me pink eye. Don't ever eat any thing from this upper Haight joint its nasty and the people working there were farmed from McDonald's rejects.
author: Samson S.

description: My daughter and her friend were exploring haight-ashbury when we decided to stop here for lunch for the first time. The restaurant was clean and had very cool decorations! Painted guitars on the ceiling! Lots of murals on the walls, it was truly a cool, Instagram worthy restaurant. Not to mention the food was delicious! The food was very fresh and the garlic fries are TO DIE FOR OMG THEY ARE FRICKIN AMAZING!!! Overall great restaurant and I would recommend it to anyone in the area!
author: Jenny M.

description: I love their San Francisco sourdough burger with extra BBQ sauce on the side, garlic fries and Chocolate milkshake.  I normally request the fries to be made well done so it's crispy.  By far my favorite garlic fries because it has the right garlic flavor and not just straight up crushed potent garlic slapped on top of the fries.  Their Chocolate milkshake is quite popular so they run out quickly.  The Vanilla and Strawberry milkshakes are also good.  Curly fries are very good as well.  My favorite burger joint in the Haight area. :)
author: Heidi S.

description:
I've tried three times here. While the waitstaff is trying, the cooks are snoozing...or bored...or dead inside...or something. 

Fries should be something you just get...you should be able to hit at least a "B" 100% of the time and this place has messed them up all three times. This place survives I think because they serve typical american food to tourists, and is completely out of place with san francisco. A nod to vegans with maybe one soup or one salad dressing is not to much to ask for the bay area. 

Horrible fries (take your pick of how you'd like them messed up), basically zero options for vegans, high prices....yep, I think third times a charm...I'm done trying you out Burger Urge.
author: Taylor S.

description:
I've been here a couple times now when i'm visiting Haight with friends/family from out of town. I really like their burgers, they always  have big portions so either come with a big appetite or share a burger. I ordered the cheese & bacon the last time and was full the rest of the day. I LOVE their garlic fries, always yummy.
The only problem I'd say I'd have with this place is the price, it's extremely pricey but it's expected being off of Haight/Ashbury. And the food is a bit greasy.. but either burgers or Pizza off of Haight, it's going to be messy.
author: Penelope V.

description: Delicious food! Hilarious decorations everywhere. Adorable area of San Francisco. Huuuuuuge basket of delicious fresh fries. We loved the patty melt, cheeseburger, and SF Sourdough. The owner was super nice and the food came very quickly. Pricey but giant portions. We recommend!
author: Natalie W.

description: Not bad. Spacious. Look out they charge 12% service fee   Got a generous sized personal pizza. It's the service fee that bugs me when you don't see it coming and no warning.
author: Robert F.

description: So surprised with what a great sandwich I had here (Chicken club)  .  I was with friends that wanted to go and this was not what I had in mind but it was really a great experience!  I would definitely go back.  Plus the people were so nice and it is so clean!
author: Louanne S.

description: It's probably my fault for ordering a chicken salad at a burger place. The chicken was so over cooked that it was hurting my teeth to chew. My fiance did order a burger that was supposed be be cooked medium. It was beyond bloody and he had to sent it back . I am a big fan of burgers so this was a huge disappointment.
author: Linda F.

description: The burgers where large. The food itself was fair. The kids loved the food. It was kind of pricey. I did enjoyed the open windows seating which allowed a cool breeze. The only bummer was it took a hella long time to get our food, other then that it's was cool. I don't think I will be back.
author: Armando S.

description: Bread was soft, garlic fries were great but burger was small and really expensive. 18$ for burger and fries. Great dine but not crazy about it
author: Shawn Y.

description:
Ok, I'm the person everybody hates - a very picky vegetarian, who can be cranky and moody. What would I do in a burger joint? Have a lot of fun, that's what - if it's Burger Urge. Plentiful salads (go beets! Fiber+iron :)), delectable veggie burgers, very good onion rings - not too batter-y, and onion taste is ever so delicate, not overpoweringly "gimme-the mints-right-now" onion... I can go on and on. The ciabatta bread they are using for burgers is a vegan dream - chewy and tangy. 
And the pure ambrosia - fries! Garlic is my fav ones, but the Sweet Potatoes are yummy, too - with a bit more of a crunch. Chili-cheese fries I skipped, since there is meat in chili :( 
Some people complain about the prices, well... It's SF, baby. 
Next time I'm here, I'm ordering wine and Uber, since it looked very enticing. I'm already planning my next visit, since I have, have to try Portobello Mushrooms and some other salads.
author: Lisa K.

description: I had a burger here at 8pm on a Friday night in late March 2015.  The place was not crowded and the neighborhood streets were not crowded.  The burger was very tasty and good.  The meat patty was thin, which I like.  However the service was poor because they got my order confused with the order from a different person.  Oh well.
author: Richard R.

description:
Spectacular!  

2 burgers at $7 each, perfectly cooked and delicious!  There are a lot of other options on the menu: salads, sandwiches, burgers of every imaginable type.  A soda for $3, and a split of cabernet for $6.  A wonderful, friendly staff, and happy customers.  

I know I'll have an urge for another burger soon.
author: David D.

description: Loved it!!!! Great service and great vibe! Travelled from South Africa and had a fantastic experience! Highly recommended :)
author: Jessamy A.

description: Everything on the menu is good! They give plenty of fries and free refills so it's worth the price :) I encourage everyone to come here and try it out!!
author: Serena M.

description:
Resist The Urge~!!!

I was drawn into this burger place not by the murals that feature  a beardless Jerry Garcia, Janis Joplin, George Harrison, and Chet Helms that line the front of this large corner location on Haight Street, but by a sandwich board set up on the sidewalk that proclaimed $9.99 Burger, Fries & Drink. I guess that I didn't realize the real problem with this place when I saw the couple before me pull out their credit card to pay their $46.99 bill.  When it was my turn I asked for the "Burger Special"  which the counter gal told me was their happy hour special and not available until 2:30.OK, It was noon time and I  was hungry, plus I had to go to the bathroom really bad, so I ordered a Cheese Burger, fries, and a water ,and,  gulp she asked for $19.37 ~!!!!!   I guess that I should have cut and run right there, but I was hungry and those two coffees that I had earlier were dying to get out so I pullout a twenty, got a number and waited for both the bathroom, and my order. The trip to the can proved faster than getting my order though as I waited nearly twenty minutes. While waiting I looked at my receipt and noticed that there was a service charge of $1.91 that was more than the tax of $1.56.  When my order finally came after a 20 minute wait the French fries were cold.  The burger itself wasn't bad but it would have been much better if the roll wasn't stale.  From my perch I watched as a couple of young people walked away from the counter and moved on when confronted with the price while older, tourists, just pulled out their credit cards.  I will say this, the bathroom was clean and on Haight Street that's good for a couple of bucks. 

Burger Urge is certainly no Super Duper in the burger dept.  It is, however, a way overpriced tourist trap with a good clean bathroom.
author: Nick C.

description:
This place looked right up my alley. Saw there was a line at 4:30 PM-- I took that as a good sign. In retrospect the line was probably long because they took forever at the cash register. There was one person ringing, and she was taking her time. 

The two girls in front of me ordered milkshakes with their order. Just keep that in mind while you finish reading my review.

When I reached the front, I ordered and asked if fries came with the chicken burger I ordered -- nope. I just assumed an 11 dollar chicken burger would come with fries. No combos here. You're going to pay nearly 20 bucks for a chicken burger, fries, and a drink, + tip. 

The food came at a reasonable time. The burger was big, and super delicious. Was it 20 dollars delicious? Not really, but what chicken sandwich would be? 

I had nearly finished my burger, when a food runner asks if I ordered a milkshake. Then she asks the people next me. And well, everyone around me. Until she finally reaches the girls that were in front of me. They had JUST gotten their milkshakes. Well-- one of them did. Both were almost done with their meal, and one still had to wait for her milkshake. 

A slow cashier, and a slower food runner. It just seems like they need to hire some more staff. 

All in all, a good burger. Staff weren't anything special. And for those prices, I won't ever come back.
author: Raquel R.

description:
Financially it met the 2 star standard of being overpriced.


First off for flavor and an overall burger I would give them 3 stars. The quality of the meat was a nice slab of Niman Rancher's chuck I believe- good stuff. I ordered the Italian Stallion with sweet potato fries. The burger comes with basil, mozzarella , garlic aoli. I opted for the Gouda instead - felt right. So off the bat I notice the crabby patty sized bun-a chewey texture with a nice pull apart consistency, but a little too greasy. I ordered my burger medium well and got it medium. Big whoop I know, but the little things count and preparing your food how you ordered it should be a standard. The meat overall was good, a step up from Fatburger. I could barely trace the garlic aoli which I was looking forward to. The Gouda was not melted well onto the meat. It looked like a half ass attempt at what usually happens when I try to  make a cheeseburger, except i didn't pay near as much lol. So maybe the Gouda was not the best substitution- nonetheless still tasted descent. The portion of sweet potato fries were good and they tasted very plain with no seasoning in "sigh" (i crack myself up). But regrettably after lf trying the garlic fries from a colleague I had to slap myself 2x for not getting them.

The price is insane. For a burger, fries, and a bottle of h20 it cost around $20. If your going to sell gourmet burgers at gourmet prices then the dining should match. Otherwise its like you filmed an amazing movie (visually), but used crappy actors to carry it out.
author: Imran H.

description:
Very overpriced and bland food. There is no service other than they place food on the table. They WILL charge a 10% service fee without authorization or warning. For a burger, salad, one drink and one order of fries it was almost $40...

Didn't think you could do something like that but they will.

Do not tip since they overcharge you as it is.

Also, when we went in, it smelled gross - didn't smell anything like food. This should have been a sign that we shouldn't have eaten here. Learn from us and do not go here.
author: MC T.

description:
I went here for lunch on July 20th, 2012.  I ordered the San Fransisco Burger for me and the Cheeseburger for her.  Also fries and a coke.  

The good:  The Coke was good.  The fries were cut and made there and were enough for two with the one order.

The bad:  The burgers.  They were ordered "medium" and they came "medium rare".  Medium should not be pink on the inside.  I don't send food back because i don't trust anyone to re-do my food.  I was very, very hungry so we ate them anyway.  Greasy and overpriced.  We spent $33 on two burgers, one order of fries and one Coke plus tip.

The ugly:  Salt shaker had catsup caked on the lid so that no salt would come out.  Why don't they notice that?

Final opinion:  I won't eat here again.  They are overpriced, dirty, greasy and they don't know the difference between medium and medium rare.  If you're hungry in this area, keep walking.  There are plenty of other places to eat.
author: William F.

description: i had the steakhouse burger and french fries. they were both amazing and the owner is very welcoming. overall super pleasant experience
author: Chris D.

description: OFF THE HOOK AMAZING....this burger was awesome.  My husband said "what is this a tv ad" the burger looked and tasted so amazing.  The wait time was short, the food was the yummiest ever.  The fries were fresh cut potatos and crisp.  This is our 2nd time here and I will continue to come here.  Clearly they have the gig for burgers down pat!
author: Audrey P.

description: If I could give this place 0 stars I would. Word of advice, if you don't like your job find a new one, PLEASE. I visited this establishment and did not receive great customer service.  I ordered chilli cheese fries with my meal.  Normally beans and meat are included in the chili unless otherwise stated. Let's just say for staters NOTHING that I ordered was correct. What irritated me the most was that I was served beans only for my chilli. Jackie was the one whom I voiced my concern to and she had a nasty attitude and response. She stated that the chilli comes only with beans and pointed to a sign that was severely hidden. She did not offer a refund however offered to replace my whole meal with another that was of lesser value. Needless to say I didn't get what I paid for. I was completely disappointed in this place and will not be a returning customer to this establishment.
author: Sephia M.

description:
For $40 we got 1 beer, side of fries, cheese burger, and a veggie burger. It is by far the worst burger I've ever eaten, both the meat and meatless: flavorless, mushy, served falling apart. The curly fries were mushy and moist. It is way over priced and I'm sure even the street youths outside wouldn't eat it for free. 
The only redeeming quality of this place is the staff.
author: Natasha H.

description:
As much as I'd love to come up with something witty to make this review awesome, I just have to go ahead and say this was one of the worst dining experiences I've had in this city. 

Long and short of it.. Order a veggie burger and a regular burger for my boyfriend, and a side of garlic fries for us to share. After paying with my credit card, I sit and wait for my to go order. Ten minutes go by, and one of the employees lets me know that they're out of veggie burgers. The only other veggie item on the menu that isn't a salad is veggie tacos, which guess what, they're out of too. So she talks me into a grilled cheese, offers me a free side salad, and I'm not stoked but whatever, shit happens.

Finally my order is up, I grab it, get on the bus, head home. Open it up, they forgot the fries. Yikes. My "grilled cheese" is a hamburger bun (stale and tasteless) with almost no cheese. My bfs burger is over cooked and mediocre at best. 

I call them to complain about the missing fries. Don't really want to get back on the bus for a half hour each way to retrieve them. they offer to reimburse part of my credit card payment. My boyfriend quickly mentions how odd it is that they didn't even have to get a manager or ask questions... probably because this is something they encounter often?

Needless to say I won't go back. Between the service, the taste, the price, and how everything was handled, I'm sure I'd have a better experience at burger king.  

Lame.
author: Mez L.

description:
I can understand why Burger Urge has its detractors, but the amount of vitriol this place gets on Yelp is a bit surprising to me. I would say its menu could be tuned up and its prices are a bit high for what you get, but I'm not about to lambast the place for accomplishing what it sets out to do: make serviceable burgers and part tourists from their money. I've been in multiple times because I used to work in the area, and found the counter staff to be courteous and helpful. 

So, let's talk about their food. Their garlic fries are delicious and greasy as one would expect. I love their milkshakes, and due to the open kitchen layout you can see that it's straight up ice cream and milk going in there, not some weird pre-mixed sludge. Their salads are enormous, easily two meals worth of food, making them the ironic standout in terms of bang for your buck. And their burgers are ... adequate. The portions are hearty and some of their specialty burgers are pretty great. If you're the adventurous type, I'd highly recommend the Elvis, and if you're opting for something more conventional The Love & Haight or The Italian Stallion are all strong contenders. Their Pineapple burger was weak, though: it just had some canned pineapple strewn atop it, which was not what I pictured when they said it came with "grilled pineapple" 

Given the price for a burger (high) and the relative cost of french fries (low), I think an order should really come with a nice handful of plain french fries. In the mean time for my money, I'll stick with the grilled chicken salads.
author: Aaron Y.

description: Wasnt a good burger. I won't eat there again. The staff not too friendly. Nice clean place, though. But nobody in there
author: Lee F.

description:
The specialty burgers are to die for. During my few weeks I was in SF this summer, I went here three different times to show three different groups of friends. 

The Italian burger is the best!
author: Kara H.

description: PRICEY in general for a burger. Chili cheese fries, with NO onions, YUMMY! Wish they would do a sweet potato French fries option with chili cheese.
author: B K.

description: I wanted a veggie burger but they ran out... so I had a portobello sandwich. It was pretty forgettable.
author: Bree M.

description:
I've had two different experiences with this Burger Joint during this past summer. The first experience I had with this place was very chill, as I expected it to be. I love the rustic decor of the place and the plating of the food. The paper that the food is served on, customized newspaper, is really unique.

What i really don't enjoy; the water dispenser dispenses some gross ass water. Like forreal? It looks like someone drank it, spat it back out & backwashed into my cup. Why. Like. WHY. 

The vegetarian burger that my friend TRIED to eat was tasteless. The "meat substitute" was a grilled portobello mushroom, that, however much you tried to add more sauces and seasoning to, did not seem to want to taste like anything but nothing. In short, that burger was flavorless. 

The sweet potato fries came in a large portion, but my friends and I preferred the regular fries which is unfortunate because you want to get the bang for your buck, right? I liked the convenience of the outlet under our seats, though. That was a nice touch :) Otherwise, I wouldn't recommend this place very much unless you're dying from starvation.
author: Kai S.

description: First of all, my meal cost $18. I got a burger and fries, no drink. They charge 10% service fee as well if you don't tip... Sigh. Never again.
author: Celena F.

description:
The food is just ok, but the value is complete crap.   $50 for two bacon cheeseburgers two shakes and an order of fries?    Plus add a 10% service charge on a Togo order on top of the SF healthy mandate?    

The food is marginal at best.     The add on fees just to buy food are insane.  

(I totally get and support SF healthy mandate, which is for the good of the employees. This extra fee was 10% over that.)
author: Greg C.

description:
Too expensive! I just called a hamburger ,was spent 16$! And if Costumers Want to go restroom , u need to ask the cashier give    
u the key to open door! Ridiculous!

The point is, their food wasn't very good. I just hope no one will go there than rue.
author: Home O.

description:
Pretty decent place. I got the love and haight burger with a turkey paddy. The turkey paddy had decent flavor.  I also got a side of onion rings, and they were okay.some were overbattered and undercooked. 

My friend got the veggie burger and said it was very bland. her side offries was really delish though, they at least got that right.

The table we sat.at was bussed but not wiped down. I noticed that they weren't that good at bussing tables there. t was also quite pricey.
author: Michele W.

description:
INSANELY OVERPRICED.  I order a Haight Burger and chili fries, and the total was $17 plus tax.  I work in very highly reviewed casual fine dining restaurant and we make an awesome burger, but it "only" costs $12 and includes fries!  (Fully loaded it is $16)  I'm not saying Burger Urge's burger is bad. In fact, it's pretty tasty, right on par with In-N-Out beef.  But the problem here is that the price is just way too overpriced.  Would I really pay four times the amount for an In-N-Out burger?  Even though the burger was good, I can't imagine who would come here on a regular basis.  There's so much good food around here and a much more decent price range.

The chili fries were horrible.  They were soggy and salty, and way too big for one person.  In fact, they were so huge and salty, I just boxed it to go and gave it to a homeless person outside the restaurant.  Is there a reason why they can't have regular-sized side of fries included with a burger?  Potatoes are dirt cheap and they can't just include at least a SMALL portion of plain fries?

I came here when it first opened and they had these amazing fried veggies (tempura style carrots, broccoli, zucchini) and it's not on the menu anymore.  Bummer.  All in all, the second star was because the burger was tasting.  Otherwise, I would've given a 1 star.
author: Alan C.

description:
As other reviewers have said, this place is definitely over-priced for burgers that are quite forgettable. $6.99 for a hamburger and $8.99 for a cheeseburger? I got the hamburger on principle and it definitely needed that slice of cheese and more. Also, they need some sort of combo or at least a way to add a side order of fries for less than $2.99 more.  

An extra 1/2 star for the lovely young lady in a wheelchair that was bussing the tables.
author: Michael K.

description:
This place gets a solid 3 stars.  The atmosphere was jovial in a sports bar sort of way (at least it was during the Niner game).  I got a Classic burger with sautéed onions and a side of fries.   I do have to say that the service was really good, both behind the counter ordering and the waitresses.  They even had a paraplegic waitress in a wheelchair which I thought was AWESOME!  I have honestly never seen that in a restaurant before and this place gets major props for that.  

The food on the other hand was so-so.  The burger was cooked well, however the bun overwhelmed the sandwich quite a bit.  Too much bread, even though the burger was pretty big which means the burger came out looking big and awesome, but it ended up being a lot of everything but the actual burger.  I'm wondering if I got the San Francisco burger which came on toasted sourdough if it would have been better.  The fries were shoestring cut, thin and sadly under seasoned.  Good sized portion though, both for the fries and the burger.  

The seating at this restaurant is both single tables and shared tables, which added to the atmosphere watching the Falcons choke as predicted.   The average rating for this place is about 2.5 stars, and that sounds about right.  It's a fun place that isn't as crowded as some of the other Irish/Sports Bars that serve food and  he chances are you'll probably get a seat.
author: Adam E.

description: Overpriced under-average burgers. 2 burgers, one drink and one order of onion rings for almost 40 bucks? No thanks. Burgers were undercooked and bland. Nothing distinct about the place except for the exorbitant prices. I'll never come back here again.
author: Kurt T.

description:
My girlfriend and I checked this place out before a Giants game a few weeks ago...and I was definitely impressed. It's right on Haight, so great location. I liked the seating area, with lots of TV's and other stuff. My girlfriend was also happy, so extra points for that as well. 

My main gripe with this place is that it's pretty expensive. You have to pay extra for fries, and they like to nickle and dime you for each and every thing you get. Our order (two burgers, fries, and drinks) came up to somewhere like 40 bucks, which is way more than I would expect to pay at a place that is basically a to go burger place. 

Other than that, it's a great place. I've had a few of the burgers and been impressed every time. I gave it three stars because of the prices. It would be 4-5 stars easily if they eased up a little bit on the overpricing.
author: Sean F.

description:
Very unfortunate because I really want a place far better than this to exist in the same location. 

No matter how much I spend or how many chances I give this place the conclusion never changes much: These are bland bland bland cuts of meat on bizarrely textured buns with really outrageous prices. 

I understand that the trend inner city burger joints have adapted in this economy is to charge you out the mouth for sides and keep the burger a minimal 10 bucks...but with that business model the least they could do is deliver a flavorful burger. Some have; I like burgermeister in cole valley and pearles burgers is equally worth the occasional splurge. Yet these options are far away and I love my haight ashbury neighborhood so I would prefer to spend my change more locally. 

I ordered the bacon burger..the bacon itself was torched and the "medium rare" burger was charred on the outside and an unnatural pepto-bismal pink on the inside...tempting, right? 

I didn't both ordering any sides because they already talked me out of it with the prices and the additional 7 bucks for fries and a milkshake would have added insult to injury. 

hopefully this will close down soon and inspire someone to open a real burger-joint in its place.
author: Jake F.

description:
I'm an Upper Haighter and was pretty happy when this place opened. We have shortage of decent food on Haight Street, and I was hoping this was the first of a new string of appealing establishments. First time in--fantastic; high-priced, but good. 

Today was my fourth visit, and it's gotten worse each time: overcooked burger and really dry bun ( had to actually choke it down!), and possibly the greasiest (and largest helping of) fries I've ever seen.

Like every time I've been, the staff was really friendly and competent.

I'm really sad and like Matt, hope the owner reads and does something about this--I'd love to see this place make it.
author: Elle C.

description:
I gave this place a shot today, I wish I hadn't given them 20 bucks for food that was literally on the cusp of editable.  If it wasn't for a decent milkshake - I honestly wouldn't have had over 100 calories based on what I actually ate.  I ordered a veggie burger - and while some places have good homemade ones - and others have clearly frozen patties - Burger Urge had the worst concoction I'd ever seen.  It was as if the thing was breaded fried, and seriously it was crumbly and fell apart.  I likened it to the leftover stuff that accrues on a flat grill like they use - it was as if that was put into a patty of some kind - and covered with onions, bean sprouts, and a poor excuse for good bread.  They claim this was homemade - I claim they have no idea what a veggie burger is.  Seriously it was so bad - I was going to save it and show it to my neighbor who is in the food business. 

Then I not too smartly order Cheese Fries.  This was an adventure - the fries honestly were not freshly cut - and in a place like this, how do you expect to differentiate yourself? Cut 'em fry 'em - serve em! Nope, these were truly awful shoestring french fries, and instead of a nice you know, cheese sauce - which is what one typically thinks of when they order cheese fries - these geniuses threw it onto the grill with some cheddar cheese forming a nice block of bad french fries and clumpy cheddar that only hung onto a few fries.  

So not only was it truly the worst veggie burger I've ever been served, it also came with french fries that were awful - and not cheesy.  

I am not a vegetarian either, I just like a good veggie burger - and I'd say goodbye to ever considering a burger from this place again - of any kind.  The milkshake was good, but of course, small in size for the nearly $6.00 I was charged for it. 

I don't think the owner understands that there is a mix of walk about tourists - and locals that eat here all the time.  Your location will need both to survive - tourists will find something more niche like and interesting - unless they are from the Midwest, you'll get those folks (me).  Locals - well honestly the quality is just so far below like 4-5 other burger options around this place - and you're charging more.  

Not not good - and I try to find the good.  There wasn't any here.
author: Paul D.

description: Priced way higher than what you get! The food was good, but did not match the price! And on top of that, it didn't seem like the employees did what they could to deliver the food ASAP! They were talking with friends instead of working.
author: Stian J.

description:
Actual Rating: 2 and 1/2 stars
Pros:
All the burgers are descent, and the customer service was good. I ordered the Portabella mushroom and tried the original. I was satisfied by both.  My favorite part about the burger menu is that there was the option of alfalfa sprouts.  As far as the side orders, I very much enjoyed the garlic, sweet potato fries and the shakes which are well prepared. 

Cons:
For all the positive points I am giving to this place, there are far more outstanding burgers in the city.  Burgers can be found anywhere. So to recommend a burger place would demand a distinct preparation and taste.  Seating was also difficult, since this place can get busy and is frequented by tourists. 

Bottom Line:
If you are walking in the Haight, and you are very hungry, this place will not disappoint. I was going to Cha Cha Cha, but the wait time was too long and my visiting cousins wanted burgers.  There's a good variety of burgers, even "Elvis' famous peanut butter bacon" sandwich. If you are hungry and you've got the urge for burgers, it must be wonderful there is a place for that in the neighborhood.
author: A. V.

description: Best Garlic Fries I ever had! Burger was really good as well. The only reason I didn't give them a perfect score was their prices are a little too high. $8 for a cheese burger that should be about $6. I know Haight rent is high but they would make it up in quantity if their prices were lower.
author: Shawn S.

description:
I live near Burger Urge and was glad to see them open recently. But after three disappointing meals, I decided not to go back. Three reasons:

1. The burgers are not very good. The meat lacks flavor, the buns are stale.

2. The atmosphere isn't very appealing.

3. Burger Urge is not a good value compared to other restaurants in the neighborhood. The mediocre food isn't worth what they charge, and they really gouge you on beer and soda.

The next time I want a burger, I'm going to Burger Meister in Cole Valley.
author: Dave W.

description:
+ excellent selection of burgers, some crazy delicious combos
+ prices are fair as well
+ good location
author: Craig M.

description:
Can this place just close already? 

I've been to Burger Urge twice and I have complaints about almost everything. 

The service: The last time I was here, the woman at the register charged me a dollar tip that I didn't write on my credit card receipt. She said a small squiggle looked like a 1. I asked why my TOTAL that I had hand written didn't include the tip and she implied that a lot of people just didn't factor that in. What the hell? Usually I tip in cash AFTER I eat, but this time I didn't bother. 

Also, when the servers bring your food to you, they pass a counter with napkins, silverware, etc. You'd think they could bring some napkins to you... Especially since their burgers are sloppy, drippy and falling apart? Apparently not. 

The food: Why can you get a small amount of fries as a side? Why do I have to pay $5 for a huge basket when I'm eating alone? Guess I won't get fries then. Shoot. 

And my final annoyance: Why does blue cheese cost $3 to put on a burger? Jeez. 

So, friends, please don't come here. Instead, visit these places: Burgermeister is at Carl St. and Cole St. They have a nice happy hour and charge $1 for blue cheese and they have sweet potato fries! Magnolia at Haight and Masonic has a delicious burger and microbrewed beer. Crepes on Cole, also at Carl and Cole, has a burger special where for $10 you can get a burger with avocado, grilled mushrooms and onions and cheese, with potatoes or salad.
author: Laura K.

description:
I'm downgrading my review.

At this point, Burger Urge has been open for two months.  In that time, you'd think they'd have gotten things together and be operating fairly smoothly.  You'd be wrong.

Part of it is that I think BiRite is no longer involved in running the place -- they've replaced BiRite ice cream with Mitchell's.   In fact, nobody seems to be running the place.

Hours are not posted and seem to vary each day.  Sometimes service is enthusiastically helpful, and other days it's grunt, look away, and get your order wrong.  Sides and what's included seem to vary according to who's serving you.  If the place is even moderately busy (i.e. more than 3 tables full), your order can take up to 40min.

I love the fact that they make their own veggie burgers.  I don't love that these veggie burgers are mushy and fall apart as soon as you bite in.  Wheat gluten folks!  Holds things together.

Despite living 2 blocks from BU, we've stopped going there.  I predict an inevitable downhill slide followed by closure a year after opening.  Too bad, it had potential.
author: Josh B.

description:
I went back for breakfast because all the other places nearby were packed. We should have just waited it out. It wasn't terrible. It's just not the same as getting breakfast love at a breakfast place. I love breakfast love.

I'll just stick to the getting burgers or onion rings.
author: Loli L.

description: Juicy delicious burgers with amazing fries. Great for quick walk throughs & great service to go with it. One of my fav food places on haight
author: Joe L.

description:
I will have no urge to eat here ever again! The burgers I ordered were overpriced and bland, and my experience was less than accommodating. For instance, I came here seriously hungry for a juicy, mouth-watering burger, that would fill my stomach, and make me satisfied in a comforting way. The large sign "Burger Urge" pulled me in. My sister lined up, ready to make a purchase that would satisfy my craving, as I waited in another line to use the bathroom. 

As I was waiting in this line, one of the workers started barking at the people waiting next to me, saying you have to make a literal purchase before you can use the bathroom. In my opinion, I think if your party is about to make a purchase for you, that counts as being a customer. A tourist said to the barking employee, "I have someone waiting in line," but the employee said "no, it's our policy that you have to make the purchase first." I felt bad for the tourist, who obediently left, while I stayed quiet and used the bathroom. 

I ended up not finishing the mushroom cheeseburger my sister ordered for me, and the tuna melt for my mom was too salty.
author: Jenny L.

description: A bit overpriced, but very good burgers. I got one with onion rings and was happy they didn't squish it all together ala Carl's Jr. It's a pretty big place so i can imagine it gets quite busy, but when we were there it was fairly empty and we had quick friendly service.
author: David M.

description:
If the 'San Francisco Burger' was not drenched in oil... maybe I'll give this place another try
If the garlic fries were thicker.. maybe I'll give this place another try
If there meal cost less than $18.. maybe I'll give this place another try
If I want to consume over 1000 calories... maybe I'll give this place another try

O wait, let me go to McDonalds and save myself $10. Their BigMac and crispy fries are DELICIOUS compared to Burger Urge. I'll take that extra $$ and buy myself something nice. Perhaps....... another BigMac.
author: Martha T.

description:
I though the burger was actually quite good, despite some of the reviews. I order a Love & Haight (medium) and an order of garlic fries. The burger is huge as stated, so I just split it with my friend. The bun wasn't overly big like many people are saying. Meat was juicy and at least the Love & Haight was a really good combo. The fries were a little greasier than I would like, but not a deal breaker. They're the string kind so really thin and they give you a giant bread basket of it.

The only reason I'm taking away a star is that the price is too high. The Love & Haight was $9.50 but I felt it was more like a $7 burger. Fries were like $6, way too much. More like $3.50.
author: John N.

description:
Do not eat here at all.

This burger joint is expensive f or no reason. I order a chesseburger, fries, and a strawberry milkshake and it all came to 20 bucks. It was horrible.
After ordering my food I was not given a receipt nor a number, this created a problem later on.  Since i was not given a number  the waiter could not remember what I had order. They ended up giving my burger to a family who didnt eat beef, I watched at the family cut my burger and than realized that it was beef and sent it back.After wating another few minutes, i decided that I would get up and ask about my burger. When I asked they gave my the one that the family before had handled and cut.
