I asked for a another burger and they wanted to charge for another one. So i got pissed and asked for the manager and he was not there.

Burger Urge is not worth the time nor the money. There is notheing special about their burgers at all. They are bland for the most part and to damn expensive.

Overall the customer service is horrible also.
author: Daniel H.

description:
I'm wavering between 3 and 4 stars after only eating here once. 

I got a basic cheeseburger which was tasty. A little pricey, but I gave it a shot. My brother sat down after placing his order... $20 for a burger, fries, and a drink. Wow. 

The place serves a few breakfast items as well, so I might go back to sample those. 

Bonus: high ceilings and brightly-colored glass windows at the top. Oooooo pretty.
author: Eva T.

description:
I'm a little boggled on how one of the most successful business families in San Francisco can produce such a craptacular burger.  I truly hope this place improves by actually making some easy changes.

I've lived in the Haight my entire life and have tried all the restaurants the neighborhood has to offer. I waited in anticipation for Burger Urge to open! Alas, my expectations dwindled after the fist bite.

I ordered a basic cheeseburger and the basket of fried vegetables. I was happy to see something other than fries on the board. Sigh.

The burger: BLAND, under-seasoned and uneventful. The bun was tasteless and close to eating a piece of dry foam. I sort of ate around the bun, but since the burger wasn't much better, I left half of it on my plate.

The fried vegetables: On a good note, there was broccoli and asparagus! On a bad note, it came with no dipping sauce or anything to combat the dryness. Even a small side of ranch dressing would have worked here. The only condiments on hand were ketchup and yellow mustard, not really what I want on my broccoli. I didn't even see any mayonaise in the house. Maybe there was some int he back if I had gone back to the counter to ask.

In short, skip this place for now and maybe they will get the kinks out in the future. If they season the burger, switch out the brand of bun, and offer some decent condiments I will try them again. For now I'll stick to Magnolia and Greenburger.
author: Sebby X.

description: 30 minutes for a simple milkshake. The place was moderately crowded, but still, it shouldn't take that long. And then they ran out of strawberries for a strawberry milkshake and waited for my friends and I to say something rather than inform us. Huge waste of time and money.
author: Gabriel G.

description: You do not get what you pay for here.  Burger was bland and overpriced, and the person taking my order was bland.
author: Paul H.

description:
I stumbled upon this the other day and was glad to learn, upon entering and talking to the staff, that they have a vegan burger. Even happier to report that it's a pretty respectable, veggie and grain based, house-made patty! 
This place is pricey, which I would say is the downside (other than that, of course, I'd love to see more veggie options-- maybe a vegetarian chili for the chili fries??). But the staff was nice, the inside was nice and very clean, and the owner was very personable and seemed really genuine. He even gave us a free soda as we chatted with him so we wouldn't have to get back in line to buy it. 
I'd go again!
author: Ashley P.

description: Food was great! Big burgers that are tasty, one order of fries served our family (three people).  The place is just expensive!!!!!
author: Shawn C.

description:
After an hour of trying to find parking on balboa, Geary, erc. I found a space on the Haight. Thank his, as it was going to get real ugly if I didn't eat. 
Wanted Russian for some reason and well, no parking, no eating. 
So, here at the urge I had the bacon and cheese burger with garlic fries. 
I ordered it medium rare. I got it    Wait for it.          
Medium rare. Tasty and delicious. 
The garlic fries were very good. I liked the Holy Grills garlic fries a little better, but these were a close second on yumminess. It's a little spendy, but worth it. 
The wait staff were friendly and the ambiance was great. 
Good nice place to go.
author: Jonathan S.

description:
Ah yes the fabulous tale of a former down-on-his-luck tattoo shop growing up to become a hip-twentys-something-go-getter-ready-to-take-on-the-world burger joint. 

But how does that saying go? Once a tattoo shop store, always a tattoo shop?

Burger Urge is an overpriced burger joint with below average food. 

I feel like an uncle who watched his favorite nephew grow up to become a straight up douchebag. That's how I feel about Burger Urge. I passed by Burger Urge on a regular basis because it's in my 'hood. So when I saw the "coming soon" signs I squealed with joy. Could there finally be another restaurant that serves up a burger that is comparable or perhaps even better than Magnolia's famous burger?

Their menu is packed full of delicious sounding burger concoctions. But oh wait half their items aren't even available. Why put it on the menu when you can't even order it? Makes no sense.

I ordered a bacon cheeseburger, sweet potato fries and regular fountain drink. That's it. In total that cost me about $19. WTF. That is so ridiculously expensive. At least offer some sort of combo value meal. No joke I ordered two double-double meals from In-N-Out the other weekend that in total was less than my meal at the Burger Urge. If you are in the business of benchmarking, Burger Urge you fail big time in comparison to your peers.

My friend ordered a breakfast burrito from this place and he hated it. Let me qualify my previous statement by saying my friend I ate with likes everything. His standards of food is low. As long as it is mildly edible, he will enjoy most foods. And even he hated his food at the Burger Urge. Plus the side of potatoes his breakfast burrito came with were as hard as rock. His fork literally could not penetrate them.

If you want a good burger in Upper Haight, do not come to the Burger Urge. I would rather suck it up and wait the extra 30 or 40 minutes and get a delicious burger from Magnolia's.
author: Allan Y.

description:
I venture to guess that they've worked through some of their initial bumps, because this is one of the best burgers I've ever had.  And that's a lot to say.  I'm originally from the Midwest, where most meals are meat stuffed with meat and a side of meat.

So I think I know what I'm talking about here.

Besides Zachary's in Santa Cruz, this is the best burger I've had in California, and the best burger I can remember having anywhere in recent memory.  Juicy, flavorful, awesome down to the bun.  I couldn't stop shoving it in my face.  I felt like maybe I should have a private room or something.  I mean, really... I was a little embarrassed to be feeling what I felt in public.

Now, I understand that they've had some problems with getting orders wrong and shafting people on the size of their to go side orders.  And I just can't bring myself to shave off a star for that. So.  Watch that.  Whatever. Meat.
author: Lindsay S.

description:
I was travelling one night out to the Haight to do some shopping for a party costume I was trying to put together for the next night. Along the way I experienced a 1 hour delay - thanks MUNI. Anyway, I eventually got to the Haight around 8:30 and discovered all the stores I intended to make rounds at were closed. I was hungry and stumbled upon Burger Urge. I used to know the neighborhood really well because I went to high school in the area. But it had been a long time since I'd been back, so this place appeared new. 

I was really impressed with the amount of seating, that was all wood stock, and the flat panels that were all around the place. This being the Haight, I really wondered how much of a problem with the homeless they had. It is a fine line that the local Haight stores walk. From what other reviewers have mentioned about the bathroom situation, I would say you need to realize that because this is the Haight the standards are different. You can't have the homeless people walk in there and shoot heroin and snort crack in the bathroom. It happens. Regardless, the place is kept very clean and the place looked nicely lit when I visited.

When I visit for the first time, I usually like to go all out to do a mini stress test. I asked what was their favorite and predictably it was what my heart was craving. The  Southwestern burger I believe I ordered, it included bacon strips! I was too chicken to order the $29.99 burger. I thought, wow that better be a damn good burger. I added a kicker of Sweet Potato fries and an Anchor Steam. I was not really happy that this all came out to about $20. But I gave them the benefit of the doubt.

I should mention that the service was awesome that night. Shaana was really sweet and really engaging. Even liked that she threw in a little "fa'sho" while taking my order. That's the only in SF character that made me smile.  As I sat for my order she brought me my beer and poured it out. Then brought out my food. She then said she'd get me some honey for the fries. In which I returned saying, "oh you're sweet enough!" 

I think the arguments about value are quite valid, I can't exactly say that this was worth the 10-15 dollars in terms of solely the burger. A burger from Bull's Head out in West Portal station is unrivaled and far better if you get a chance to try theirs. It's highly unlikely that I'd return to this place again, but only because I'm not exactly close in proximity to this neighborhood. I had to mark it down for the value, but I bumped it up for the service. Too good to go un-noticed.
author: Michael C.

description:
They should rename this restaurant Burger Purge.

I ordered the fat burger, it was 2 revolting quesadillas as buns with a shit ass burger stuffed inside that was not cooked medium rare like I asked (and they also asked me). It seemed that the rest of the stuff in the burger was not fresh, this was evident in the burgers disgusting taste. 

fuck you burger urge for taking my $20

Never again will i go here.
author: Victoria G.

description:
I won't have an urge for these burgers ever again. We did carry out but still...
The meat is almost as bad as Acme BurgerHause. I don't like to have to pull small pieces of gristle out of my teeth while trying to enjoy a burger. 
If you are like me and have grown to expect a lot out of your burger avoid Burger Urge. 
Great chocolate shake though.
author: Drew I.

description: Love it when I order a bottled root beer or Coke and it is so cold I can barely hold it!! Burgers and garlic fries are great!
author: Michelle E.

description:
Went here the other evening with my daughter and BF. My daughter had the San Francisco/california burger. It was tasty and a nice size. The BF had the bacon cheeseburger with cheddar cheese. It just a regular burger you can get anywhere. I had the down n dirty burger. We also got an order of regular fries & garlic fries. All the items were good but I'vehad better and can make better at home

The price was extremely pricey. $55 plus change for three burgers is way over priced. Don't think we will be going back.
author: Ayana K.

description:
I live a block away from here so was excited when I saw a new restaurant opening up in such a great location. 

The decor is appropriate for a burger place but with a hint of more; the fireplace, the LCD TVs, and an overall cozy feel. 

I went in to try a cheeseburger to take home after a long day, and they were swamped with only about 1 week of being open.

 The staff was friendly and as I sat there waiting for my meal - a happy Burger Urge owner made his way around the joint to make sure all his patrons were taken care of. He happily handed out sweet potato fries and made sure orders were going out smoothly. 

I personally don't like sweet potatoe fries, but these fries made me a convert. Definitely try the sweet potatoe fries!

Now to the important part,.... the burger. It was juicy, it was fresh, the bacon was real, the whole thing came together for a nice juicy melty bacon & cheese burger. 

Sayonara Fuddruckers, Burger Urge is steppin' up.  

As long as they don't begin to skimp on quality I will find myself a regular there, especially after a hazy night of Haight St. pub crawling.

p.s. to the owners, throw in some mimosas for your brunch & beers for those burgers and you're good to go!
author: Roxy G.

description:
Great sweet potato fries.
A hamburger that is really good. Niman Ranch Beef.
Lots of different things to eat.
Salads, sandwiches, soup, chili.
Can't wait to try the grill cheese.
Not to expensive.
 The only thing I do not like is that chain burger place look!
The Haight should put a ban on neon...
-Simon the Cat
author: Simon The Cat -.

description: Love this place!  I had the best burger I have had in a long time there.  The place inside is very nice and clean. The service is great!  They have fabulous salads and delicious brunches as well.  I highly recommend this place!
author: Mari A.

description:
I think Burger Urge has potential.  But it has a long way to go.

The line was pretty long given its recent opening and it being a Saturday night, but we were only ordering sides (fries, onion rings, etc) so we didn't think the wait would be very long because these items should already be ready. Right?

Wrong.  First of all, we waited over 30 minutes for an order of sweet potato fries, chili cheese fries, onion rings, and a cup of chili.  Thirty minutes!!!! Absurd.  

Also when we walked in, we noticed the side orders of fries looked HUGE. Score!! But the amount we got for take out seemed to be a third of that amount. BOO. For the $4.50 we paid for each item, we couldn't believe how little we were getting.

As if the wait and price weren't enough, the sweet potato fries were soggy (gross), the chili cheese fries had American cheese on top (whaat?!) and the chili was more like beans and water (no thank you).  I will admit the onion rings were pretty awesome, but their deliciousness is overshadowed by the less-than-mediocrity that was the rest of our experience.

The burgers looked pretty impressive in size, but I will not be coming back for another few months as they seriously need to work out the kinks in their operations.
author: Laura C.

description:
LOVE!  This Burger joint is beautiful - on the outside, and the inside.

From the outside: clean, functional design, clever splashes of color, neat artwork on the walls, rustic wooden plank floors, and an open-air feel with large sliding windows.

On the inside: The "Love and Haight" Burger I tried was delicious.  Juicy (8oz!) beef patty grilled to perfection, toasty hearty bun (to wrangle the luscious fillings),melty jack cheese, fresh veggies - sprouts, avocado, onions, pickles, tomatoes.

I'll definitely be coming back very soon for more.
author: Shannon H.

description: 16bucks for a (small, but yummy) burger and fries...all in a place that has a fast food feel. i won't go back b/c of the price, though the fries are damn tasty (and reasonable) why is a burger $9. SMH.
author: Wendy X.

description:
Overpriced , bad service. The woman at the counter didnt hear us order fries so when I mentioned it when she brought our food she said "well it's not on the ticket so..." and walked away. After that I thought we could expect fries to come out that- wrong. We had to go back up to the counter and order them. I just paid 34 dollars for two cheeseburgers and two beers. Make it right and bring out the damn fries I ordered in the first place.

The burger was decent, but definitely not worth 9 bucks and the poor experience certainly didn't make up for it. I'll be back at Burgermeister next time where they make more of an effort to keep customers happy. It's a shame as I live a block away and would like to support a business so close, but they need to really adjust the way they price and manage this place.

One star because I won't be back and I would NOT recommend.
author: Rachel N.

description:
A very smart establishment providing tasty stuff at good prices - and what other casual place can you get a Maredsous or Chimay with your rare burger?  Certainly nowhere on the Haight.  Thinking about it now, is there another destination on the upper Haight for a burger at all (beyond the fuck-pucks at the piss-yellow arches)?  

The employees are very nice, the place is big and clean, the food is tasty and fast - less than 10 minutes to get all our food the three times I've there.  Fries are right and my girls got a couple free shakes from the owner who just happened by our table.  It's not highfalutin but for a casual meal that's consistently good, hit burger urge.
author: B N.

description:
This place is so awesome!! Everything is great, from the environment to the food to the service. 
I got the Love and Haight burger with a gardenburger - this wasn't just the average gardenburger from the store. They made it themselves, and it was delicious. I also got the sweet potato fries, which were to die for. They have ice water out for you to refill as you like, which I thought was really nice.
The entire restaurant was very clean, and all of the workers were really nice. The bathroom was clean too! 

Service was very prompt!
author: Kendall F.

description: Im surprised this place only got a 3.5 out of 5 overall.  I thought the food was well prepared and fresh.  Had the love and haight, thought the burger was awesome, also has the garlic fries which I split with my brother and we were stuffed with each of us having our own burger.  I would come back to try the other burgers honestly.
author: James F.

description:
As someone who works on Haight street, I am always stoked when a new place to eat opens up.  However, its like being in a mall food court here.  It doesn't have the local feel that is a great part of Haight.  And they don't give a merchant discount.  Uber fail.

Besides the sterile feel of the whole joint I got medium well sliders when I ordered medium rare.  At a burger place, shouldn't it be a thing to know how to cook a well burger?

Also no pickles, wtf.  GO TO ASQUEW INSTEAD!!!!
author: FAT K.

description:
How anyone could give this more than 3 stars is amazing, I think I'm being generous with two... it could be because they offered a bunch of free burgers when they first opened... for free, this place wouldn't be bad... but its not free, its actually one of the most expensive burger joints around, and one of the blandest as well.

I ordered a bacon cheesburger and a side of onion rings (just as much as a side of garlic fries) and it was about $15.

I don't mind paying for food, but this was THE BLANDEST meal Ive ever had. Seriously, not even the onion rings had much taste, and their FRIED! How can you mess up something fried???

The burgers are big, but tasteless.

The place looks nice on the inside, though its waaaaay too ritzy for Haight st., especially upper Haight.

Anyway, I don't think they'll be open for too long. I haven't heard one person say something good about them, and I live right next door to the place, so I hear a lot of people coming and going. 

If yu want an amazing burger at a reasonable price, I would check out Whiz Burger... by far my favorite place in the city :)
author: Lotan K.

description: Pretty awesome garlic fries. I didn't try the burgers but they looked fantastic. I would have given it more stars if the burger would have fit in my belly! Maybe next time... Although it did look just a little pricey.
author: Rebecca P.

description:
Ok, Ok.  Price verification!  8 oz or more, Niman ranch Cheeseburger with regular cheese is only 7.99!
Bottomless soda is 2.99, Sweet potatoe fries are 3.99.  

The best deal in the house is the Cheeseburger, so if you want a deal that cannot be beat just get the burger because it is as large as a house!
author: Curtis L.

description: Not a ton of choices around here.  For the second time this week, was charged for a half pound burger, and received a 1/3 lb.   Food ok, but way overpriced.
author: Paul J.

description: Pretty pricey. I had a veggie sandwich that cost $10 for a bland sandwich. But they have a pretty decent size vegetarian menu so maybe something else is better. Veggie sandwich, burger, one beer, and a soda was $40.
author: Shurie S.

description:
The burgers are like 'eh'. They satisfy the need for a burger if you are on Haight Street. Like other reviewers, the shakes are great. I rather walk to Cole St. to Burger Meister and get a burger from them.

Also, Burger Urge can sometimes close unexpectedly. For example, yesterday 4/20 they put a sign on the door that said, "Temporarily Closed" which meant closed.  They probably ran out of food which has happened twice to me.
author: Matthew T.

description:
I went here last night for the first time.  The place is new, clean and well lit.

I ordered the Bacon & Cheese burger, medium.  The menu mentions "crispy bacon".  I added an order of sweet potato fries.

I ordered carry-out and walked home to eat.  The amount of food for the price is decent but the quality was under par.  Don't get me wrong, it's far from affordable and I think it's over priced but it if was a 5 star burger then I could understand.  I think my burger and fries order came to about $14.50, without a drink.

My 'medium' burger was 'well done', dry and mostly flavorless.  I was a bit disappointed.  The "crispy bacon" wasn't as crispy as I like so I had to throw it in the microwave for a minute.   Generally when a place asks you how you'd like your burger done in this city, you can expect a pretty good burger that taste custom and handmade versus the "we only serve it one way, well done, frozen patties" that many places serve, like bars.  This burger wasn't much better.

The fries were pretty good but still expensive.

The service was very nice and courteous.  I think I got 3 "good bye, have a nice night" shouts on my way out.

Hopefully they'll get the kinks worked out and be more consistent in the near future.  I'll probably give it one more chance but I can make a better burger at home for half the price.

The neon lit street signage is a bit much and doesn't blend well with the neighborhood.  It's not Broadway in North Beach.
author: Scott W.

description:
Oh god I was looking forward to Burger Urge opening since the original tattoo parlor closed down, and tonight my roommate and I decided to give it a go.  

First off it was really sweet!  Very nice, very clean, very charming, and the staff was all very friendly.  We waited in line for a while, ordered, then waited for a while and people watched.  Then our food came and we were really excited to try it!

Huge disappointment.

Now I know I'm crazy, but I love bacon and peanut butter on my burger.  So when I saw that they had a burger with peanut butter, bacon, and fried bananas called The Elvis, I was stoked!  It immediately brought back nostalgic memories of a place called the Corvette Diner in my home town of San Diego, only there, on their Brenda Burger, it's lettuce instead of bananas.

Anyway...

So yes, as another yelper said, the look was initially quite impressive, and they don't skimp on the beef by any means, but when I opened up my burger I thought they had forgotten the bananas.  But then I saw the two or three little burned pieces of banana which ended up devoid of flavor.  (Bear in mind, I've had fried bananas my whole life.)  Whatever.  Then I took a bite and it was soooo dry, and I reopened my burger thinking they'd forgotten the peanut butter too!  But then I found it.  Yeah.  I found the peanut butter.  I don't think I realized it was peanut butter because it just looked like a little bit of discoloration on the bun.  Seriously!?  If you're going to have a peanut butter burger, you should be able to see and taste it!!  I think I tasted it during one bite, but it was more like "essence of peanut."

So basically I was left with a dry hamburger with a couple tiny pieces of hard bacon.  And this isn't the kind of burger you can put ketchup and mustard on, ya know?

After three bites I'd lost my appetite.  I just don't like that feeling of "I could make this better myself at home."

Also, it's not that cheap either.  Two burgers, one side of fries, and two drinks came to $33 or so.  I felt like it was kind of a ripoff for bad quality food.  All You Knead down the street has an amazing burger with waay better fries, and the one at Zazie is off the charts as well.  By the time you spend that much money, you could have had the AMAZING  cheeseburger at the W Hotel San Francisco, which is a 4 star hotel, AND comes with perfect french fries, actual casual fine dining table service, and the ability to order a beer to go with.

I'd say I was going to try it again, but I don't think I'm going to have "the urge" ever.  I was soooo looking forward to having a new spot too!  Oh well, better for my wallet, and my waistline.
author: Kicker ..

description: Let me start off by saying that I am reviewing this business from a vegan  perspective. I have in  visited this location several times, but only because it is ridiculously hard to find french fries in the Haight. Anyways the veggie burger was dry & tasted like a frozen patty. The sweetpotato and garlic fries are average but I will say they are huge portions & not bad for the price. Everything else is extremely overpriced for the quality. The staff is also very rude, short and dry. I feel bad because i think the manager is very strict on them & train them this way. Burger Urge, I wish you were better : (
author: Chelsea K.

description: Ordered a veggie burger w/ cheese and an order of fries to go...$14 of unpleasant burger. The fries were good but the burger was the worst veggie burger I had ever had. I may go there again to try other items but I will steer clear of the veggie burger.
author: Tashema M.

description:
Stepped in here one day because BurgerMeister on Carl was closed.

Burger was basically like this: Meat was very low quality.  Lots of condiments and spices put in there as if to distract you from the meat.  But once you got that meaty aftertaste it was pretty bad.  We could barely finish it and felt sick for the rest of the day.

Suggestion to management: I think it'd actually be pretty good if you sprung for some better beef.
author: Andrew S.

description:
nope nope nope.

let me just give it to you straight.  I was actually impressed at how little flavor my burger had, despite the fact that it was probably one of the greasiest I've ever eaten.  I mean, that's really quite a feat.  

that being said, the fries were good.  they serve them up in a big wooden bowl.  I would recommend splitting it between 3 or 4 people.

but do you know what I would recommend more?  just not eating at burger urge.  the service is friendly enough, but it is so forgettable and bland.  especially not for $10 a pop.

the bottom line: this is a seriously mediocre burger.  and life's too short to eat mediocre food.
author: Amanda L.

description: Meh...it was just ok. I've definitely had a much better burger in LA. I ordered the San Francisco Original and the meat itself was not seasoned...seriously a little salt and pepper go a long way. The bread was way too hard and had too much butter on it and subsequently when I bit into it the whole thing fell apart, I really hate when my food falls apart after one bite. We spent $32 on a burger a chicken sandwich and an order of fries and I'm not sure why because nothing was particularly great.
author: Reecoe B.

description:
The first time I came here I found out they had only been open for a few days but the place was lovely and the food was delicious.

I came here with my roommate after a little haight st shopping.

The staff is very friendly and the kitchen is open and bright. We both ordered burgers and a soda and then sat down to a lovely wood bar table.

The place has a nice atmosphere with lots of windows and a modern fireplace. Even the bathrooms are nice but are segregated by gender.

I recommend coming here with a date and SPLITTING a meal because the portions are ample. I was glad I didn't order fries because my burger alone turned into two meals. This place won't leave you feeling hungry that's for sure.

The second time I came here I also ordered garlic fries, and a pumpkin ice cream shake which may have been the best shake I've ever had. Once again I recommend splitting these portions with a buddy.

p.s. I LOVE the wood plates they serve the food on.


Can't wait to visit again.
author: Sophia v.

description:
Did the "Down and Dirty" burger with a vanilla milkshake= 17.61?!?!?!? 

Crazy over priced for an overcooked patty and undercooked onion rings ontop of it. They use chabatta buns which just made it even worse. I was so sad I waisted calories on this place.
author: Melissa B.

description:
I am really giving myself one-star for eating here again when I should know better.  Shame on me for being too lazy to walk to Burgermeister.

$14.50 for cheeseburger and fries is disgraceful for what you get there.  I felt like  a sucker the second they gave me my total and even worse after I finished my average at best food.

I guess the ownership just banks on tourists who don't know of another option while shopping on Haight as a business model.
author: Shaun B.

description: I think there are a lot of vegans with unreal expectations for a burger place. Burgers here are excellent and the fries are good. It's a little pricey but the service and ambiance is great. Right now, it's the best burger in the Haight.
author: John H.

description:
I've been waiting to try this place for quite sometime. I live only a few blocks away, so the suspense was killing me as I waited for it to finally open.

And I'm sorry to admit that it was a disappointment. I ordered the Love and Haight burger, while my boyfriend had the Elvis. They both sounded quite flavorful. One with sprouts, avocado, and garlic aioli...and the other with typical Elvis ingredients (peanut butter, bacon, etc).

But they were very lackluster. The Love and Haight just didn't have much oomph to it at all, while the Elvis literally was just meat, bun, peanut butter, and some bacon. I felt ripped off. We shared the chili cheese fries, along with 2 sodas. and our total came to over $30. Talk about expensive.

For all the burgers being mostly $9 and up, I would expect to be blown away with them. Even the chili cheese fries were unimpressive. Their housemade chili seemed more similar to some sort of tex-mex bean salad. Not the sloppy, gooey, stoner mess that I was hoping for.

I'd give them 3 stars because the service was very friendly, and the restaurant is spacious and clean. But the food is so overpriced and bland. And for being on touristy Haight St, they sure play out-of-touch music. Evanescence and Phil Collins aren't exactly "happening" music acts. It really added to the strip mall vibe of the place.

But the place is new. Hopefully they'll make some improvements, and perhaps make specials available. But as of now I will not be returning to Burger Urge. Burgermeister gives you far more value for your money, it's fairly close by, and they've got some great specials. Burger Urge, take note.
author: Katie S.

description: Food is great but the prices are ridiculous. $3 for a soda and $4 for fries? Add that to any sandwich or burger and you're paying $17 per person. Stupid.
author: Minx A.

description: Place was convenient to our location and we were craving a good burger.  Definitely not the best burger I've had but it was just fine.  The fries, milkshake and burger were tasty, service was fine and the atmosphere was casual and made for great people-watching.
author: Rachael C.

description: I had a veggie sandwich. It was very bland and there was hardly any flavor. My friends veggie burger tasted more like a crab cake. Garlic fries were decent.
author: Maey P.

description: bright, welcoming, all up in the middle of haight street.  basically it's a burger joint with a twist of creative burger ideas like the 'love and haight', 'elvis', sf OG, and ur classic burgers, fries, shakes, beer, etc.  They even got chicken, soup, chilli... ya just gotta check it out!  a bit pricey for a burgjoint so bring at least a DUB(of cash not bud) or hell bring both and u can do one then the other-your choice! cool for kids and before catching a show... hOLlA!
author: Omar N.

description:
The buns are dry and make the burgers impossible to pick up (bigger isn't better) and the atmosphere is not welcoming--the place feels like an elementary cafeteria. Don't think so? Look at the awful images they've posted on their menu.

Plenty of better burger spots in the city. Eating there once was enough.
author: Adolfo M.

description: I had the San Francisco burger, flavor was blan. The onions and mushrooms tasted of the oil that they had been sitting in all day and the meat lacked any real flavor.  The burgers are very over priced for what they are.  Sorry can't recommend this place for their burgers... There are better burgers and better places nearby.
author: Rob T.

description:
I am always around the Haight street area so when I saw this place I was excited to try it out! I love a good burger and fries. However, I will say my experience was more of a miss. I tried the cheeseburger and fries. While the burger itself is huge, I found that it had no flavor to it. In fact, some parts of it tasted burnt. I thought ketchup would help but it didn't. The fries also seemed flavorless even after I poured ketchup and a little bit of pepper on it. For what I got, it was not worth the price. 

I will say that the staff were nice and friendly but I don't think I'll be back.
author: Mel P.

description: Burgers are good. Not a huge fan of having to buy fries with my burger. I mean I shouldn't have to order jelly with my PBnJ. Add the fries and drop the price a few shillings and we'll have a deal. Other then that, burgers are good. If you're feeling adventurous, get the Ultimate Urge
author: Justin E.

description:
Had my hopes up and got disappointed. 

Can confirm the stock-dry meat and bun. Toppings were flavorless and couldn't resuscitate this lifeless piece of tragedy on my plate.

Bummer.
author: Janett R.

description:
How does this place stay in BUSINESS?!

Burgers are OVERPRICED, I felt robbed after my meal and I was so irritated.

-We ordered 3 different burgers, asked them to be cooked medium, we got different variations. 1 came out pink in the middle, the other 2 were fully cooked.

-They use FROZEN fries!!!!!!!!! How do we know? Our fries weren't warmed up all the way and some were still frozen! It wasn't even busy when we went, so how can they not spend a couple more seconds frying the fuckers?

-Don't get the Down & Dirty burger. It comes w/ BBQ sauce and a fried onion ring, and they literally drowned the thing in BBQ sauce. It was disgusting and I had to try to remove the sauce. The onion ring was soggy by the time we got our burger.

-The normal cheeseburger is decent, but how can you go wrong with a regular cheeseburger?

-And yes, the burgers are GREASY as hell.

-Servers NEVER smile, and they act like their job is torturing them. They're just there to take your order and bring your food out. Didn't want to ask them for favors like extra plates or anything because she looked like she wanted to shoot me.

-DON'T EVER COME HERE.
author: Megan K.

description: This place is awesome. 5 stars all the way everyday.
author: Amber S.

description: Good size burgers and yummy, big serving of garlic fries (which cost extra). Tourist prices for nothing too awesome, but did the job.
author: The Hungry Hippos O.

description: Totally overpriced for sub par burgers. You're paying for the street you're on, not the food. Save $31 and go to In-N-Out for $13.
author: Jennifer H.

description: Burgers are OK, but they have rude personnel and is annoying to use their bathroom.
author: Jonathan H.

description: I spent $92 plus a tip on an overpriced, mediocre lunch. Ok, I'm in the Haight-Ashbury district so I can live with that. After placing my order and taking a seat, I asked for the restroom key so I could wash up. I was bluntly told it was for customers only, so I replied I was a customer. Before handing me the key, the owner make me point out where I was seated. This was embarrassing. I don't know, maybe I look like a vagrant off the street but I don't think so. Funny enough, after looking through the reviews I see other complaints about their jealously guarded bathrooms. Ridiculous! I would have overlooked the high prices and the mediocre food but the personal insult was a bit more than I care to tolerate.
author: Loni B.

description: $14 for a mediocre little Portobello Burger by itself! $2.95 extra if you want fries. The customer service sucks. People don't even say hello or smile yet they have the gall to add 10% gratuity to every order. This place only exists thanks to poor unsuspecting tourists.
author: Hugh M.

description: I am so surprised by the negative reviews on here! I love this spot! One of my favorites for veggie burgers, they make them fresh daily and they are soooo good! The staff is usually super friendly (I mean come on its on haight street) and the sweet potato fries are out of this world! It is pretty pricey but worth it when you think about the portions, it usually feeds me for two meals... at least!
author: Lauren K.

description:
This place is so gross, DO NOT EAT HERE.

My friends and I were hungover so our body would've welcomed this kind of food and greasiness but our bodies couldn't even take it, that's how bad it was.

The garlic fries were okay but 1/2 of it were soggy and you have to eat it FAST or else you'll be having cold and soggy fries, not the buzinesss! Same thing with the onion rings, not as crunchy as I would've preferred.

My friends ordered the same sandwich but somehow it came out different and one was missing a pickle. **GASP** PICKLEESSS!!!
author: Emmie N.

description: The blandest, driest burger I have ever tasted. The only reason I have it two stars was because the service was good and the place was clean. Not worth the visit, though.
author: Gilad B.

description: If you are hungry not a bad place but I would not put on my to do list. Burger was mediocre but they did give alot of fries.
author: William B.

description: In my burger loving opinion...  This place is Way over priced.  The fries were unoriginal.. The burger.. Not exciting...  And the service was just.. Ok.
author: Mark M.

description:
Yummm, I really enjoyed my rare burger with spouts and garlic pesto. The owner was like a retired guido. He was very cute and friendly in his matching exercise outfit. 

The place had a cozy feel with a fireplace and was very clean for a place on the Haight. People are right about the prices, they are on the high side and only for a solo burger, no fries/drinks. I paid $17 for a burger and garlic fries and a side of free water.
author: kim w.

description: I wasn't craving a burger when I came here , I just needed to use the restroom and was rejected by like 5 different places . For a neighborhood who prides itself on being free spirited and yada yada yada and what not Haight - Ashbury businesses sure are stingy with their restrooms . I guess they have to be with all the vagrants hanging around . Anyways i decided to take a lunch and grab a burger and fries , just a burger and fries and it ended up to be like 15 dollars . I was thinking to myself it was kind of hefty for a walk in burger joint but was very optimistic about the quality of the burger . It turned out to be a pretty darn good burger 15 dollars worth ? I'm not sure  you can be the judge of that . What I can say is it's at a nice location (despite the lack of public restrooms) and they have a unique menu of burgers . Mine was called Love and Haight it had like alfalfa sprouts and avocados and some other stuff
author: Toan T.

description:
I live in the neighborhood and finally decided to give this place a try. I ordered a veggie burger, fries and a beer and my total was over $20! For the price I figured fries would come with the veggie burger but NO.  This place is expensive but hoped that everything would be great quality and worth it. I was wrong and felt really ripped off. 

The veggie burger not only had no taste it had the consistency of re-fried beans and my hands were full of grease after picking up the sandwich. I look for a napkin at the table and to my surprise there are no napkin dispensers on the tables. Half of the veggie patty or should I say veggie putty started falling out of the bun after the first bite. It was like eating a lettuce and onion sandwich and an over thick bun. The fries were the frozen type sliced extremely thin. 

I will never return.
author: Jamie M.

description: The urge was ok. My pineapple burger was good just needed a little more teriyaki sauce. My wife's burger was alright. She order jalapeños on her burger and they came out cold and wet. They also charge a lot for a milk shake that is super small.
author: Sundiata C.

description: Overall good food: tasty burgers (maybe a little too dry), delicious fries, refills! A nice restaurant, very clean.
author: Bee R.

description: I had the Love and Haight burger with sweet potato fries which were both very delicious. The chili is also very good. Burger Urge isn't really anything too special, but the food was tasty!
author: Sophia A.

description: I had the Italian stallion. The burger was perfectly cooked and tasted great. I have no idea why there are any negative reviews for this place. good food, good prices.
author: David M.

description: Absolutely over priced and bland!!  So unfortunate!  Had a $40 bill for a burger joint (for 2).  Description on the menu sold us to eat here even though the prices were definitely targeted toward the tourists (which we are not).  Save your money and go to Super Duper Burger in the Castro off Market.  I don't work for Super Duper so this isn't a one sided review - trust me on this one :-/.
author: Daniel P.

description: Overpriced and just average. It was over $11 for fries and a burger with no cheese, and I didn't even get a drink. The burger was okay, not bad but not amazing. On the other hand, the servers were friendly though, bathrooms clean, the fries were a large portion.
author: Nan L.

description: These burgers are phenomenal!! Such interesting and delicious concoctions! The staff is great and very attentive.
author: Ray K.

description: Stopped in with my wife and 8 y.o. son for lunch. I ordered a chili burger .3 sliders and a chicken salad. About 30 seconds after I ordered I saw a kid's menu and tried to change my son's order for something off the kids menu. I was told no. Then when I got my burger instead of having chili on it  they had chili flavored pork and beans instead.Honestly it didn't taste bad but it wasn't chili.It's a plain place with fancy prices.
author: Ward B.

description: I haven't had the specialty burgers, but the regular cheeseburger is great. The burgers are large and juicy. The fries are thin and crisp. The beer is cold. That's really all I ask for.
author: Erin S.

description:
Good food and reasonable prices but BUYER BEWARE!!! I had lunch at the Burger Urge this past weekend with my wife and daughter. Together we ordered 3 sandwiches, two orders of fries, a beer, a root beer, and an apple juice. The bill came to $61. That seemed high to me, but I just signed the credit card receipt that I was given (not itemized), then went to my table to wait for the food to arrive. As I was sitting there, I looked at the menu board posted above the counter and couldn't figure out how my bill got so high. At that point, I went back to the cashier and asked for an itemized receipt. The first thing I noticed on the itemized receipt was that there was a 15% GRATUITY added to the bill. I immediately asked the cashier why she hadn't told me that a gratuity was automatically added to my bill (in addition to the small tip I had added to the credit card slip myself). She explained in a matter of fact way that Burger Urge "ALWAYS ADDS A 15% GRATUITY FOR PARTIES WITH MORE THAN 2 PEOPLE"!!! I then asked where I could find that policy on the menu board. At that point the cashier called her supervisor over. The supervisor explained that the policy is not shown on the menu board (or anywhere else where the customer might see it). When I asked the supervisor why I wasn't told about the gratuity, she simply repeated that "we always do that" (or something to that effect).  The supervisor promptly removed the gratuity from my credit card charge and apologized. We hadn't received our food yet (and we were really hungry), so I didn't make a big deal about the obvious attempted theft and risk getting some "payback" in our lunch (figured it would be safer - and more useful - to simply post this review on yelp). 

It's a bummer because I really do like the food and the service is super-friendly, but the owner needs to be held accountable for a policy that is clearly implemented in a way that dupes unsuspecting customers into over-paying for their food.

I look forward to hearing back from the owner on this one!
author: Chris S.

description:
How did this place get a 2.5 star on average?
Talk about injustice in this world.

their burgers are more than awesome, they are incredible.

I asked for the medium well and told them that I want a real medium well and not a medium well that looks like a well done, and guess what?? I got the perfect medium well.

Their fries are also really good and the portion size is just about right!

It's not the fanciest place but certainly a place with good burgers that is worth to try.

I would suggest to buy a bottle of water and not get their tap water, because that isn't the best tap water I had.
author: Jason B.

description:
Do not eat the food here please.
Here's what the burger is like:
The bun is all rubber, like chewing an old tire. The patty is dry as the desert in June.
They put cinnamon on the sweet potato fries. Why would you put cinnamon on your sweet potato fries?
author: Pasha B.

description: Really good giant burgers as I would have expected, juicy too. Great onion rings, ok garlic fries, wish they had more garlic. A bit pricey but expected for the tourist location and the specialty burgers they offer. Great friendly service and clean bathrooms ( ask for the key).
author: Larry F.

description: $3 fountain soda. WEAK "chili" cheese fries (the chili is just made up of plain, dry pinto beans with no sauce aka not chili). And the fries were only topped with those beans, a pinch of onion and some cheese. Thats it. :( It cured my hangover though.
author: Maura O.

description:
This place is essentially Burgermeister with better fries. I've been here a few times now and it's always at least okay. A bit pricy but the food is fresh and the people cheerful. It's a clean, open place, which can seem a bit stark.

I'm not floored over it. I'm still looking for the perfect burger in San Francisco--but it's nearby and acceptable fare.
author: Erik L.

description:
A friend and I hit this place last night and were NOT impressed.  We live in this neighborhood and kinda thought the garish signage on the corner was gross when they began renovating for this place.  It looked decidedly commercially inappropriate for our eclectic neighborhood.  We finally decided to go last night cuz we were starving and too tired to cook!
But, the experience will not be repeated!  When you order 2 burgers, 2 fries and 1 soda and the charge comes to over $35, something is definitely wrong!
Well, the burgers sucked - they looked great when they came to the table.  But, the bread was too thick and greasy on top, there was no mayo available (my friend was upset about that!), the meat and veggie burgers had zero flavor, and were not completely cooked (raw veggie burger only cooked around the edges which promptly fell off at first bite).  We ordered a turkey burger and veggie burger and I always thought it was pretty hard to make those blah, but they succeeded.  Maybe the meat burgers or chicken sandwiches are good, but don't plan on returning to find out...at those prices!
The girl at the counter was kinda rude and uninformative to us newbies!  The only wait staff they had was one girl and she wasn't friendly either!  
But, the fries were good - regular fries tasty and sweet potato fries superior!  But, that was it.  My friend and I didn't finish our meals and when we got home we both felt sick.  The space itself is pleasant and atmosphere good, too.  But, the cost is waaaay tooo much!   We're in a recession (or is that depression?), folks!  So, it's back to In 'n Out Burger for me when I get the "urge", even tho I have to drive a ways to get there!
author: Norah M.

description: While waiting for shops on Haight to open, we walked into Burger Urge right before they opened.  The staff was really nice and took our order right away.  The burgers were delicious.  The meat was fresh and flavorful and the onion rings were deep fried deliciousness.  Small beer selection.  Neat place in a great location.
author: Sharon L.

description:
We live about 4 blocks from Burger Urge, and we love a good burger, so we were excited when it opened.  Unfortunately, our experience was fairly disappointing and I doubt we'll go back.  

There was plenty of space, nice high chairs for kids, and the space is clean and arranged well.  But that is where the good news ends.

The man who took our order was disgruntled at best.  He was inpatient, unfriendly, and unhelpful.  

The bacon on the bacon cheeseburger was so overdone that it crumbled into small hard pieces.  The fries were overdone and only mediocre in taste.  I ordered my burger medium rare and it came out completely grey.  My wife ordered hers medium and it came out very pink.  

The menu says "milkshakes: ask for flavors".  But they seem to only ever have chocolate, vanilla and strawberry.  If you're menu is going to hint at variety, you might want to try some, well, variety.

I'm sorry to say we won't be back.  We'd rather drive to Noe Valley and drive around looking for parking and go to Barney's.  At least there we get a smiling waiter, juicy bacon, tasty burgers cooked to order, and an absolutely delicious oreo milkshake.
author: Jed W.

description: This the place where I paid most money for a burger with fries and drink. I paid $19.59 including taxes. Can you believe it? The fries portion was huge, but it was a normal burger. The serving was delayed. I wouldn't recommend anyone to go here.
author: Balaji B.

description: A great place to eat, if you have the extra money! The foods a bit pricey, but it makes up for it in taste!!! A must try!!!!
author: Joseph B.

description:
My kids (both teens) and I were walking Haight Street down in SF for a day trip from Sacto.  My daughter had only driven though on previous trips and wanted to see it up close.  We stumbled upon this place and decided it was time for a bite, so in we went.  The order-takers were a little ditzy. Like an idiot, I added a 10% tip for the table service. BIG mistake.  That said, they did appear to put our orders in.  I ordered a BLT sandwich for my daughter and me to share with a bowl of tomato soup and my son ordered the bacon  burger and fries.  He also ordered a shake.   The sandwich came.   Then, a little later the burger came.  The shake came.  The soup?  Didn't come.  So I reminded the runner and she gave me this diatribe about how burgers and sandwiches are ordered through the system one way and soup is ordered a different way.  Oookaaaay -- so just bring me the soup. Whatever.  Some time later after all of our other food had been eaten, the tomato soup comes out.  It was literally swimming in grease. This soup wasn't just made with tomatoes and broth or milk.  I am guessing it must have had some kind of cheese melted and incorporated into it.  It didn't say as much on the menu, but I don't know what else would create an orange oil slick on top of a bowl of ... soup --  tomato soup.   If there were animal products in this soup, I would think vegans would need to know this. I'm not a vegan, and I will eat cheese, but still.  People should know what they're eating.   I didn't really want tomato cheese soup. Cheese is fine. I just prefer it not to be in the form of an oil float on top of my supposedly healthy soup. 

Horrible service.  Overpriced food. DON'T tip the order takers until your order has been received satisfactorily. The sandwich was mediocre. The burger was good, but still not worth the price they were charging. $50 blown and a lesson learned.  We will never, ever go back to that place. 

Pathetic.
author: Melissa L.

description:
Disappointing. My family has been eating here since the restaurant opened. Until recently, everything was great. The employees very friendly, good-size portion for the price. However, last night's visit will likely be the last for a while. I ordered milk for my son and was told they didn't have any - I asked if they were just out, and the employee said they never had it (since he'd been there 3 months he knew ALL) and offered juice as an alternative. Ummm, yes you did have milk because I have always ordered it for my son, so thanks - now he gets juice. My "medium" burger was more like medium rare, the onion rings really greasy, and the kid's grilled cheese used to be a whole sandwich - now it's a half.
My husband pays and comes to the table wondering how our bill got to $51 - no itemized receipt given. We do the math - which doesn't add up, he asks for a receipt & we notice a 10% surcharge (on top of the Healthy SF fee). He asks about this and the employee points to a sign about an add'l fee (basically a built in tip) - well, hey guess what - my husband added a tip on unaware of your extra 10%. The employee refunded the tip he added in - but we still felt misled.
author: Jennifer E.

description: The staff is bitchy and senselessly possessive over the key to whatever the magical wonderland exists beyond the bathroom door. Extremely annoying. You'd think they'd want to look like there are more customers here, because there were two occupied tables among the 12 or so they have.
author: Meg P.

description:
This is another $20 a person burger joint that serves you on a plastic tray  with OK burgers.  I hope this fade of over priced  mediocre burgers will end soon. 
$20 bucks for a burger, fries and a coke, I expect to be impressed.  No wonder why In and Out always has a line. 
I just hope the crook who owns this place offers matching 401K and paid health insurance for all his employees.
author: Bob b.

description: it's overpriced.  The food was good but nothing special unfortunately.  It is exactly what 3 stars is for.  Not great not awful.
author: Judith M.

description: the reason i gave this establishment 2stars was for the fact that the food was not bad at all. My bf and i ordered there club chicken sound witch and it was delish. BUT! its way over price. With both our sandwitches,1 soup,and garlic fries came out to $46! $46!!!.sorry i had to write that twice. I have never payed that much for the items we got. so maybe over price is an understatement..it was insanely over priced. Would i recommends if you like to take your date to a place that's expensive and the food is good.but keep in mind it's not a restaurant setting nor romantic one. Last but not least if you do decide to drop in for a bite i recommend there garlic fries,and there chicken club sand witch.!!:)
author: Cindy Z.

description: Very pricey ($25 for a burger, half and half fries and a drink) but it is San Francisco. But the amount of food and quality is amazing. It's worth it. Only thing I can point out is something tiny and it's that I asked for no pink and I definitely got a little pink. None the less it was very good and is every time we go!
author: Kellie D.

description: Great burgers! Chili is hearty and spiced just right!
author: Alba L.

description: Yeah, it's pricey here. But the burgers are HUUUGE. If you're staaaahving, it'll satiate your hunger pangs. If you're not so much, totally enough to share with a friend. I would skip the fries, they're akin to in-n-out fries.
author: Christine Y.

description: Really enjoyed the vegetarian pizza. The mushrooms and squash were flavorful. The pizza wasn't too heavy on the cheese so the sauce and vegetable favors stood out. The veggie burger was too mushy for my taste. Very clean.  Friendly staff.
author: Jodi B.

description: I am giving 5 stars because the only complaint I see from people is the price.  The burger WAS 10 bucks, but that is normal these days.  4 burgers, 2 fries and 4 drinks was over 60 bucks, but it was fresh and fast and delicious.  The french fries I would say are great.  I can't imagine what they have to pay in rent, but a couple bucks extra for the burger is fair in my opinion.
author: Aric W.

description: I asked for a medium ; got well done :(. Meat wasn't seasoned, super bland... I should've gotten a specialty burger instead of their classic. Lackluster burger spot for a steep price. The only thing I really enjoyed was their onion rings. I'll give it another try and maybe see if I can add an extra star someday.
author: Jamie C.

description: We're walking on the Haight & saw a big fat burger from outside. They have unique selections of burgers. As the burger looked huge, we opted for only burgers. There's no way we could eat fries though I wanted to try sweet potato fries. The restaurant has plenty of seating & is great for people watch while munching burger. The burger is one of the best I've ever had. Not too greasy, but melting pot of all different flavors.
author: Keiko M.

description: This place sucks!  When I pay over $10 for a burger, I expect meat that is at least tender after it has been ground.  These factory burgers were of much less quality than McDonalds or Burger King.  Only for tourists! And then, only one time!
author: James W.

description: "I went to this place with my friend and it was not good. The burger was medium well when I said medium, the taste was very bland. The bun was very dry even after putting on condiments. We paid over 30$ and it was not worth it. At least the cherry coke was good. I will not be going back.
author: Janelle G.

description: Their mark up must be huge on the burgers. They are not cheap for what you get. What you get is a frozen burger that was zapped in the microwave. They have a great location and probably really benefit from all tourists trying the place once. There are better burger joints...I'd go to McDonald's before here and chow down on 2 burgers for the price of one at Burger Urge.
author: Craig B.

description: 2.5 stars. This place is fine, but for what it costs, I think it's just ok. The bf thinks it's better than Burgermeister on Carl and Cole, but I'm torn. Burgermeister is cleaner and I think the fries are better there, this place maybe has better burgers. Go here if you're starving in the area, but don't go out of your way for it. Really they should have half the space and charge a bit less for the food.
author: Melissa C.

description: Pay $7.00 for a regular burger, no cheese and it should be good. It wasn't. It wasn't seasoned at all, it was undercooked, more like rare than med-rare. Besides they shouldn't be asking how you want it cooked because the meat is gristley so it should be cooked med-well to break down some of that cartilage. These guys need to take a lesson from all other burger joints and SEASON their burgers--that would go a long way. Weak and overpriced.
author: Greg P.

description: My wife and I came upon Burger Urge on a Wednesday night at around 6:45 pm and the place was empty.  That's usually a bad sign, but we are burger fans, and we were determined to try the place, so we pressed in and ordered a basic burger for her, a basic cheeseburger for me, and an order of sweet potato fries.  The sweet potato fries were good, but the burgers were a little lacking.  The trimmings were fine, but the meat was a little dry, perhaps overcooked.  In my opinion, they form the patties too thin, and lose out on juiciness potential; and for me, when my burger doesn't have juiciness, I'm not having a good burger.
author: Paul T.

description:
This is really Burger Ughh! 
I can't belive this burger joint came to the Haight like this. 
Terrible burger full of so much Neiman Ranch grissel. Frozen fries???? Really? They were also cold when they were served. No cool condiment station. Plain old yellow mustard &  catsup siting on plain little tables. An absolutley useless windowed firplace.
Did I miss something with the fireplace? Why not put it in the middle of the resuarant?
Why only against a wall where only two tables can even see it? 
This is Haight!  I really expected something kinda far out good.
If you have a burger at any other location on Haight(including McDonalds) you will have a better burger than BU.
They should close, rethink it and reopen with a new draw. In the meantime, check out Martin Mack,Magnolia, All you Knead. These places serve GREAT burgers with fresh potatoe fries.
author: Miz E.

description: I'm a sucker for a good burger so I had to try this place out.  The good news is that my burger (a bacon cheeseburger) and the side of fries were both delicious.  The burger was juicy and filling, and the fries were well seasoned and tasted fresh.  The bad news is that the menu is a little pricey per item and there are no combos to discount your purchase.  The really bad news is that what that meant for me was that I spent almost $20 on lunch that consisted of a burger, fries, and a fountain drink.  Not being a member of the one percent, I think that $20 for lunch for a meal that isn't particularly fancy or remarkably high quality is way too fucking much.  Was Burger Urge a tasty meal?  Yes.  Was it worth the cost?  I don't think so.  If you want a good burger and money is no object, this might be a good place to start, but for me, it's about two times too expensive.
author: Blake D.

description: Stale bun, precooked patty sitting next to the grill, stale ingredients. In a city that has a love affair with burgers, where Roam, Umami, Super Duper, Burgerhaus and the like rule with greasy iron fists, Burger Urge serves bowling alley level fare. Hell, within a block Martin Mack's and Squat and Gobble have far superior burgers, and they aren't specialty burger restaurants. A little further than that is Greenburger and one of my absolute favorites, Maven. Burger Urge preys on unwitting tourists used to Wendy's and Jack in the Box, luring them with clean tables and a flashy sign. I really wanted to enjoy that Elvis burger...
author: Sterling S.

description:
Dang nabbit! Why must food suck in the Upper Haight?! This place is awful. Burgers suck and have no flavor. 

Also, they always love to screw up my order. They've forgotten to put cheese on my burgers twice on two different occasions.
author: Steven H.

description:
I've walked by this place several times and it's always empty, so I tried to figure out how it can stay open. Maybe it's crowded when I'm not there, maybe they have a big lunch crowd, who knows? 

Now, I know: they can make rent, and payroll, and a tidy profit, by selling just one of these exorbitantly-priced, lackluster burgers.

8.99 for an American cheeseburger, 2.99 for a coke, 2.99 for fries.  With tax, that's about 16.50. For 16.50, you should get a fantastic burger, great fries, service with a smile. 6.99 for a regular burger. (How a slice of American cheese costs $2 is puzzling....)

Burger: Even with the lettuce, tomato, pickles & onion atop it, it still ended up being dry & flavorless. The bun was so dense & sanddusty, that it wicked away any moisture. And the burger, though a perfect medium rare (go cook!), hadn't been seasoned (boo cook!). 

Fries: they were fries, not $3 fries. 

Service:  They deliver to your table and that's it. "Can I get some mayonnaise?" The server pointed across the cavernous room, "You can get packets over there." "How about some hot sauce." She pointed again, "over there. Everything's over there."

Save your money. Go up to Buregermeister or Kezar or Martin Mack's or even fricking McDonalds.
author: Floyd L.

description: Sitting here as I type waiting over 15 minutes for a shake (second time this has happened). Really? This place is ridculously expensive, food is ok, but I gave it 3 shots and I'm over it.
author: Kelly F.

description: I went in the other day to get a burger, but decided to go to another place instead. Today when I went I was sorry I didn't go before. The place was very clean, service was very good as well. Yes, the burgers are a little expensive, but at the size they are I was full after my dinner despite not having lunch that day. My burger came within 10 minutes, and was very moist. One thing is that it was a little bit more done than I had ordered, but I have found this to be the case with pretty much any restaurant, which I can forgive. The Down and Dirty burger is where it's at.
author: Steven P.

description: This is a cute place to get a quick, casual bite to eat.  I rushed in here on a rainy day, the place was warm and clean, and the service was quick and friendly.  I usually eat vegetarian so I was glad there was something besides a veggie burger.  I got a portabello sandwich, and it was pretty good, vegetables were cooked just right.  I really like the burger bun, and their fries and onion rings are good as well.
author: Madeleine L.

description: "Meh" definitely explains Burger Urge.  I had the Love and Haight burger with fries and a coke and it came to over $17 dollars - which would possibly be justifiable if the burger was spectacular - but it was very bland, definitely not anything special.  This surprised me since the burger comes with an aoli dressing, cheese, tomato, sprouts, and avocado.  I assumed it would be very flavorful but it was a big disappointment. I asked for medium well and the burger came out overly well done - charred practically.  The bun was pretty dry too.  I won't  be going back, however, I can point out the positives of the place: The staff was very nice and the restaurant was clean.
author: Misty D.

description: I go here sometimes when I get a craving for a burger & fries, but hot damn are they expensive! It's a fine burger, not great, but hits the spot when the craving strikes. But a burger, fries, and soda, can end up costing you $16-20! Holy hell. Next time I think I'll walk the extra quarter mile to Burgermeister on Carl & Cole.
author: Andie D.

description: Came to SF from Sac to visit a friend during spring break & she said this place was really good. I thought the atmosphere was nice. The burgers are alright. It was really fresh and everything but I thought it was missing something.
author: Cathy D.

description: That $45.00 ultimate urge don't do it. It's a scam burger worth 18.00 plus tax maybe I feel robbed,cheated & lied to I'm not even full and I'm 5'9 165 ...
author: Mike G.

description: Overpriced to start out with, then they charge a 10% "Service fee" without warning you even though there's no table service. Dishonest business, burger was mediocre.
author: Sami Z.

description: I went here for lunch today for the first time. I had heard mixed reviews about this place but my friend that I was shopping with said it was good so we popped in. It is a small restaurant where you order and pay at the register then they will bring the food to your table. The younger lady at the register was not the most friendly. She was giving a slight attitude when I asked if the veggie burger was vegan. The menu posted above clearly states that it came with cheese and when I asked to exclude the cheese she annoyingly answered that it did not come with cheese (okay?). I added fries and a soft drink separately. Then she went along to tell me that it cost over $16! Holy hippopotamus! That is an expensive lunch! The food was decent and it was a huge burger but I don't know if it was worth $16! I'll think twice about coming back here for lunch. (I was also not too surprised when I saw the low ratings on yelp now)
author: Anthony H.

description: Stale bun made it horrible I asked for it med cooked it came well done and the fries were just ok. There will not be a next time.
author: Chris D.

description:
I was traipsing through the Haight on the 43 Masonic and as we crossed Clayton, I saw for the first time lots of bright signage, Burger Urge and made a note to come back when done with my business at San Francisco Fire Credit Union at California and Presidio.  I went back and walked in with the newly released SF Weekly because I couldn't find the new issue of Bay Guardian.  It's almost garish from the outside and kind of a formula approach, think CHAIN, to it's bill of fare.  Windows and Wood are the main ingredients of the look and decor, toss in a bunch of flat screens and sports from around the world and updated color menu boards.  Very au courant items populate the menu and the place is new, so I forgive them their simple glitches like no napkins with your food when it's served and no cutlery either.  You order at a counter, pay and are given a number on a pointer, then grab a seat and wait for the food to be brought to your table.

I picked a window table fronted by knee high to rooftop level windows that slide open when weather permits, and this is the heart of the Haight Ashbury so there is always plenty to see, probably a lot more than whatever sports are chewing up the flat screens.  So I ordered half pound Niman Ranch burger, the menu said it came on toasted Ciabatta but not this time, some regular fries, battered onion rings and an order of the Slider's which were only $7.99.  The prices are all very good and they're brand new so they are bound to have a few shortcomings in the beginning.  The fries and onion rings were delicious and generous in portion, and they weren't greasy at all.  I repeat that the fries and rings were free of grease and tasty as can be.  I was surprised that the menu said the burgers come on either a toasted whole wheat bun or a toasted Ciabatta roll.  I had my heart set on the Ciabatta but what I got was a very lightly toasted, heavily seeded spongy bun.  The meat was cooked just right and it came with pickles, sliced red onion and lettuce with a small swath of mayonaise on the bottom half of the bun.  I ordered my burger with Swiss and it was melted just right.  The Sliders were just OK.  The meat was good and each tiny meat patty was presented with catsup and a pickle slice and served on what appeared to be some kind of French Roll cut into thirds and it was too chewy for easy eating.

All in all Burger Urge is a welcome addition to the Haight and should do very well in that burger deprived neighborhood.  Well worth a visit.
author: Stu S.

description:
Burger Urge was a huge disappointment!  

The requested medium cooked burgers were cooked to death.  The chili on the burger was just runny tasteless beans.  I did like the bun . Was going to order a salad but other customers said they were too full of lettuce and not much flavor. The sides were small and expensive.

All in all the experience was not what one would expect in the Haight esp. the bright lights and NEON.  I don't really care about decor if the food is  delicious and a good value.

The food is mediocre , it is not a good value and the ambiance is rather cold and efficient.  I would not have any reason to stay any longer than it took to wolf down the food. So why the TVs? I wouldn't go in to watch anything!

My hope is that it improves or I will eat someplace else or at home...just around the corner!!!
author: Alston L.

description: Meh It's a burger with slightly above-quality ingredients but the food isn't worth how much they charge. The garlic fries were good but way too oily. The meat (there was ALOT of it) was cooked alright too. The ambiance is really weird and a large open space. I dunno...something just isn't right... I'm sure they are targeting the tourists on haight, not the local peeps so i it gets an average 3 stars from me. Won't be dying to go there anytime soon.
author: An-Nhien L.

description:
For my first review, I wanted to give a nice review to this comfortable casual Burger restaurant. 

First of all, i was very surprised about the kindness of the employees, specially the hostess "Sunday" - Dimanche in French... ;) -

The food was great, specially the half pound piece of meat. 
I think the price of the French fries ($2.99) is too high, but the portion was like 2 times bigger than what they serve in many other restaurants. So finally it worths it compare to the other places.

I'm always surprised to see people saying here, in Yelp, that $6.99 is expensive for a burger. Do you go out sometimes? Except McDonals, BK and KFC, where do you find some cheaper Burgers? 
Moreover, these people are willing to spend $15/20 on a pizza, with nothing to eat on it. 
Just to remind these persons that the piece of meat is big (1/2 pounds), and meat is expensive for the food cost.

I wish this new business will succeed.
author: Cedric S.

description: I went with my wife to eat American hamburgers.I live here in 8 months, which was the best burger and ate potato It was so delicious and I suggest everyone.I love it
author: Mona O.

description: middle of the road burger joint.  Plain and simple.  Decent burgers, decent rolls, standard price here in SF.  I have been several times now, and I enjoy the fact that the staff recognizes me and that there is ample window seating for the Hight street people-watching circus.  I will most likely return but more out of convenience than preference.  No diss.
author: Artnok A.

description: Hands down, best clam chowder I have ever had. No joke. Everything else is ok to good but the clam chowder is on point.
author: Kari S.

description: I ordered a cheese burger with bacon, garlic fries, and a normal soda...the total came out to $18.70. It was not that special, and hugely over-priced. You can get a better, more affordable, burger somewhere else.
author: Nicholas H.

description: it was much nicer to have that pink shop that was there before, instead of that super greasy place where i could see my reflection on the fries and on the bun as well!! low quality and lame style for someone who Appreciate a good burger dont go there!  TouristTrap
author: Tam C.

description: Ive been twice and the food is okay but the reason why ill go back again and again is this sweet sweet young lady whom i would marry, if she would only take my phone number.
author: Noah H.

description: Too expensive for what it is and service is slow. Waited 20 minutes for a garden burger and fries. Got two burgers and two fries and it cost more than $26 dollars. Not coming back here again.
author: kyle d.

description:
Looks like a food court. 
Elvis, Marilyn Monroe and an American flag?? 
Zero effort was put in to get some of the Haight-Ashbury culture into it (if it even still exists). A big fat 0 for originality. 
Yet Another tourist trap...
author: Jules P.

description: I'm never coming back here ever again. It's expensive. My friend got a vegetarian portobello mushroom burger, sweet potato fries and a drink and ended up paying $18. I don't think there was anything (not even salads) under $8.99. The burger I got (forget the name) made me sick. I now cannot go anywhere too far away from my bathroom otherwise I will have an accident :(
author: Athina L.

description:
This is the closest place to my house, literally two doors down.  I want to love this place.  I am incredibly partial to burgers and would literally be their biggest patron if only they put out a better product.

I'm writing this is because I want them to be one of my default places.  Honestly they'll succeed without my patronage, there's to much foot traffic for them to need to rely on locals.  I just want to feel like I'm getting value when I go there and I don't feel I do.

At the price point they're asking they should have the second best burger in the neighborhood, only the legendary burger at Magnolia should be better.  Fortunately there are two other places within a block that offer better tasting burgers at a much more reasonable price-point with waited service and a less chaotic atmosphere. 

Here's the deal, after spending $11 with tax for a burger and only a burger the highlight of the experience shouldn't be the Brioche roll.  Granted the Brioche is an extraordinary choice and I applaud it, but it shouldn't be a burgers singular outstanding feature.  Notice if you will I'm not using the word "meal".  

Fries or any other side are not included.  For that you will spend another $5 min. each and another $5 for a shake or beer.  More than $20 for a mediocre meal isn't a quantifiable expense for me.

What makes it mediocre.

Let's start with the patties.  The Neiman Ranch beef is lacking on the flavor scale.  With 1/2 pound patties that's a whole lot of lack.  Smaller patties would be advised.  Frickin' 1/2 a pound of flavor deficient beef is wasteful.  Smaller patties would allow them to have less offensive pricing and not run their patron's caloric index to dangerous levels.  When you include this with the price and lack of reasonably sized and priced portions of most of their sides there's an issue.

Spending nearly $25 for a burger, fries and beer/shake is reasonable if you're putting out an extraordinary product or experience.  Burger Urge currently offers neither.  There are places within a couple blocks that do and I'll continue to frequent them.  Until Burger Urge compels a change I'll spend my $20's elsewhere.

I'm actually disappointed by this.  I want to be a regular here, I want to like Burger Urge, but from what I see they are just interested in being a place that exploits the tourist traffic in The Haight.  That's their prerogative, as mine is to eat elsewhere.
author: Jim S.

description: The space is great, and the staff perky, but man, I had the waffles yesterday morning, and they were horrid. Crunchy, dry, and tasteless. How on earth can you screw up a waffle? I never thought it was possible, but Burger Urge has found a way. The syrup was Aunt Jemima-esque, which can be overlooked, but there were sliced green onions in with my strawberries and blueberries. WHY were there green onions in there? Did they not wash the knife before attacking my fruit? I love new businesses in the neighborhood, but for this restaurant, I have no "urge" to return.
author: Bee H.

description: I really wanted this Burger to rock for many reason but #1 I like myself a Burger.  Just opened and its clean and has a nice fire feature to keep you warm.  OK ......Patty was good with onions lettuce and had some pepper Jack with FF. The FF were thin and crispy but not to crispy all in all pretty good.  The only problem is my bun( the bottom ) bun was hard ...like it was exposed to air  long .. not good ... hard to enjoy with a stale bottom but the staff was very nice and the friendly owner talked to us and even brought over some sweet potato fries for us to try.  Because he and the staff were very nice I will definitely come back . I know it will be the cheeseburger I had an urge for so I WILL BE BACK.
author: Scott G.

description:
Turkey burger with blue cheese: not very good. Meat patty was flavorless. Bun was thick, dry, and hard.
