Sweet potato fries descent and voluminous. Dipped in blue cheese salad dressing, they were even better. The blue cheese salad dressing was very good. 

Kid got chicken tenders and fries. Chicken tenders were sub-McDonalds quality--pressed chikin product. 

Service was okay. Restaurant was clean. Large open-air windows make for an almost-dining-outside atmosphere. Only problem: all the hippies and homeless in the Haight smoke. Eating on the sidewalk in the Haight, bad idea.
author: scott h.

description:
One of the cleanest bathrooms on Haight st. Didn't smell like ass? TWO restrooms that were segregated by gender? Automatic sink AND soap dispenser? Oh boy!

I had one of the chicken sandwiches, name escapes me but it was pretty good. It originally comes on ciabatta bread, but since I wasn't a huge fan of that selection, the gentleman cashier gladly substituted sourdough bread instead. Also got a side of garlic fries. It was pretty good! They have shoe-string fries (which are my favorite!) and I saw actual chopped garlic! Everything came out piping hot and the waitress made sure to check on us more than once and even brought over a box when she noticed we had some left over food and had stopped eating.  

It wasn't the cheapest sandwich around, I believe my total was under $15 for the sandwich and side of fries. But the food was still great, it was clean (!!!), there was friendly waiter service, and the restrooms! I just cannot get over it! I mean, have you seen the other restrooms around Haight? Yeah, there aren't any.
author: Sandra W.

description:
NEVER AGAIN!!!

Insanely Expensive, Nasty Service, & 2 out of 3 diners had stomach aches after!

The sad thing is that I'd eaten here before and had a pretty decent experience.  So tonight, when we were in a hurry and hadn't yet had dinner, everyone said YES to burgers and I called ahead to place our order for pickup.  I used the menu attached to this site to make the selections.  I ordered three burgers, each priced at $9.50, no drinks, no sides.  As I was completing the order, the guy asked me for my name several times (how hard is it to get "Jeff" right?), so I assumed he was having difficulty hearing me. As we were finishing, he said "That will be $?1.88".  Since we had only ordered three burgers for less than $10 each, I assumed that the first word was "thirty".  Even though the connection was fuzzy, it didn't occur to me that it could have been "forty".
We pulled up outside the place and my wife hopped out with two $20's to pay for the food.  She came back a minute later saying she needed another two bucks.  As I handed her two bucks I asked her how that could be given that the online menu said it was $9.50 each for three burgers.  When she told this to the guy at the counter, he scoffed dismissively, saying "That's always been wrong", to which my wife answered, "Don't you think you ought to fix it?"
His answer: "I told him how much it was." 
My wife: "Well, apparently he didn't hear you clearly, and your published menu advertises a different price.  Can I speak to the Manager?"  
Him: "She's not here, but she's not going to do anything about it anyway."
My wife: "I think she'd want to be aware that the place she's managing is committing false advertising... I'd like to leave a message for her, anyway."  
Him: "I'll tell her when I see her." 
My wife: "How do I know that you'll tell her?"
Him: "Don't worry about it.  I'll remember." 
According to my wife, all of this was conveyed with a "F... You" attitude.  Granted, I was waiting outside in the car and not present myself, but my wife is not a hothead and she came back to the car STEAMING, saying "We are never coming back to this (expletive deleted) place again!" 
If I were the manager of Burger Urge and I witnessed this, I'd fire the SOB who was on duty tonight, then I'd get online immediately and make sure all the menus that are out there are current.  
If I were the owner of the place, at very least I'd rip the manager a new one for allowing this sloppiness and for commanding so little respect from her employees.
author: Geoff H.

description: Pretty good burger, but a little pricy and a la carte. We realized after ordering two that they were a half pound of beef and one would probably suffice for two people.
author: Colin P.

description: I wish I would have checked Yelp before eating here this afternoon. Overpriced, dry chicken sandwich. My Coke was nearly US$3. Service was rather slow considering there were very few people inside. My total lunch bill was around US$12.  McDonalds would have been tastier and cheaper. Now I know most things in this town are overpriced but this one takes the cake. AVOID AVOID AVOID!!!
author: Alex A.

description: Sometimes you get the urge.  More than yen, less than a compulsion yet strong enough to force the feet to follow the taste-buds to assuage the urge.  Had the bacon cheesburger with blue cheese.  Huge burger covered in blue cheese crumbles just the way I like with nice thick smoked bacon strips.  Kudos here for healthy burger salad.  The tomato slices were thick, the lettuce generous and crisp and the onion slice perfectly thin and tangy.   The fries were less crisp than I like but freshly cut with skin on as god intended.  The vibe is modern, clean, crisp with huge windows to watch the every present Haight St. floor show.  Next time the urge hits I'll be back.
author: Russell D.

description: I liked the ambiance, I liked the background music, and I even liked sitting on those tall chairs in front of a toasty fireplace, but the food was lacking in taste, substance, and value.  I can get a much better burger from Denny's, Bistro Burger, Sonoma Chicken Coop, and In n Out.
author: Akshay K.

description:
I don't know if my description will do justice to my experience here. We were at another place having drinks, when this new burger joint was mentioned. Just outside the window, sat a clean looking new spot I can yelp! A veggie burger and a small Caesar salad were on my mind all morning and this place was like a beacon of hope. Horray!! 
We walk over, starving, and look through the menu. You order at a counter and they bring you out your meal. The place had plenty of open tables, but ALL of them were piled high with dirty plates and food. I mean to say, not a single table was bussed. We had to ask some people at the tall center table if they could make room. 
Now, the order. Some fun menu choices. All pretty pricey....but wait....ala cart menu? Meaning you order fries separate. That bumps your $11 burger to $15. I hate being cheated in restaurants! That's insane. We get to the counter. My friend orders the spicy chicken sandwich for $11 with no side. I order the basic burger but with a veggie patty. I ask if they make small salads and the girl behind the counter snaps back at me, "NO! Only full size!" Then just looks at me like I'm the asshole. So my friend and I agree to split a Caesar. We both just get tap water. This comes to $30! Whatever. As long as I get some good lunch. 
While waiting for our meal, I notice the woman next to me eating a burger that's oozing out of the bun. I start to realize she has the veggie burger! It's like liquid!! And its making a pile of sludge on her plate. I'm praying at this point that she's ordered something I have not. 
Sure enough, my burger comes out. It's huge. So I cut it in half and the patty smears out of the bun like watered down play dough. I don't care. As long as it tastes good. It doesn't. Really. It was so bland and grainy....like wall paper paste. It was the WORST meal I've had in SF! I couldn't even eat it. it was disgusting. I gave up and ate the salad. 
I'm never coming back here. I'm telling everyone I know how turrible this place is. Service was poor. The place was clean because it was new. But tables weren't bussed. The food was atrocious. The prices were insulting.
author: Jena D.

description: A good burger with all the fixings. Onion rings were over cooked but fries were good. Burger was priced well but onion rings and fries were high. Dinner for 2 $32 2 burgers onion rings, fries and 2 waters.
author: Robert O.

description:
Been here twice now, both times we took the food to go.  I've only tried the turkey burger and the veggie burger, will try a beef burger soon.  Both of the non beef burgers were of high quality and had very good flavor.  The fries and onion rings are good too.  

The buns are a bit large for the non beef patties.  Maybe they should grill them to get rid of any staleness.  The buns haven't been absolutely stale, just a little bit.

One of the 2 times we ordered was over the phone.  That was difficult, and the person didn't get the order right at all.  When I came in to pay and pick up the order, they pretty much had to start over, so it took a little extra time.
author: Eddie K.

description: Great location in the Haight, great service, and a bacon burger worth going back for every time. The serving was huge, I eat everything on plate (this is especially when bacon is involved) and I was forced to ask for a to go box.
author: Scott S.

description: These burgers are fine, and it's nice to have the option of a salmon or portobello or whatever, but I'd caution not to appear expecting Kobe beef or any kind of specialty. These are perfectly acceptable if you're feeling a burger at a reasonable price, but this is not burger gourmet. Leave full and happy, not blown away.
author: Jessica H.

description: A surprisingly clean, semi-upscale (relative to rest of Haight) burger joint, the restaurant looks relatively new serving a variety of burgers. The selection is limited and the burgers are pretty ordinary. My double burger lacked seasoning and was overcooked. Not the most exciting food. Although I would say the ingredients were fairly fresh. This is like an overpriced McDonald's without the Happy Meals and kids.
author: Ed L.

description:
I was really excited to see a new restaurant opening up in the Haight.  We decided to walk over and give it a shot last week.  Decor and dining room is great.  I really dig the space.  There is even a fireplace.  Cozy. 
The menu is way overpriced.  There is actually a salmon sandwich that is $15 and that doesn't include sides.  I don't even think it's wild salmon.  I didn't get it but have to say I was shocked at the price at a walk-up burger joint.
On to the burgers.... we got the specialty burger with avocado, bean sprouts and pesto aioli... first of all they were out of sprouts but didn't mention it until we got the burger and I asked where they were.  Would have been nice to know a key ingredient is going to be missing before paying for the order.  The burger was pretty bland.  Just not much flavor at all.  The bun was lacking too.  Never paid too much attention to the bun on burgers but this was dry, flavorless and just not right.
Also got the BLT which was ok.  Hard to screw up a BLT.

One thing I have to write about since it really annoyed me.  The menu says beers are $3.99.  Well it turns out half the bottled beers they have are $10 each.  That is not on the menu anywhere.  I found it very misleading.  The guy at the counter said with tax these beers would come to close to $12 each.  For a bottled Chimay?  I can buy a Chimay draft at a bar down the street for $7 TOTAL.  Total ripoff on beer here.

Bottom line I was disappointed.  I hope they change up the menu and make the burgers more flavorful somehow.  I want to like this place.
author: Alisa M.

description:
great milk shakes - the best.
burgers are expensive.
i like the fries with chili and cheese on the side.
author: Elena G.

description: I went to the Haight once and passed this place, and it looked good and a friend said it probably sucked. he was so right. ten bucks for a burger then another three for fries so i skipped on the drink. the burger had no flavor (even with bacon and cheese and what not), the fries were just...awkward. word of advice: if it looks really good & fancy on the outside, it probably sucks.
author: Yadira M.

description:
This burger spot seemed to have everything going for it. A nice looking appearance, busy street, corner location, cozy fireplace (great on a cold/rainy day).

Counter service was friendly enough. 

Food was horrible (and for a burger spot, you can easily expect and get better).  While the plate was served pretty promptly and looked great, I barely ate (if even) half of my meal:
1. The bun was just a boring/dense bun. Seemed at LEAST a couple of days old or not kept air-tight fresh.
2. The burger was terrible. You could easily feel the filler bits in the burger as you ate. Seemed like some of the cheapest burger meat available. Very unappetizing.
3. Even the Onion Rings were barely edible. Not hard to make good onion rings..but the batter wasn't good tasting at all.
4. ...and for the pleasure, I paid $15.80 ($6.99 for a classic/basic burger, $3.99 for onion rings, $2.99 for a FOUNTAIN soda (which I love, but very low food cost for that price).

The girl clearing plates was attentive and friendly...and did ask me if everything was alright (she could tell I had barely eaten much at all). I told I didn't care for any of it. She did ask if I wanted anything else. I couldn't really tell if that was an offer for a replacement meal or what...but I didn't inquire or take her up on whatever her offer was for (I would have only been interested in a refund). 

If this was a restaurant service establishment, they would have had a hard time getting me to pay my bill with a good conscious but since it was counter-service I was all-in already and paid upon receipt of my food.

Even with average service, the BAD food at HIGH prices make this a big DUD. Even McDonalds at 1/2 (or less?) would have been far superior.
author: A K.

description: Went for lunch last weekend: don't get the salmon sandwich.  The salmon was gross -- yup, I'm using the word "gross" here-- and the bottom bun was rock hard.  My husband had a burger with a hard bun as well.  Those two items, no sides and a coke for $30?  I think we can definitely do better.
author: Kim U.

description: I ordered a grilled cheese and a soda- $11. I got a snack on the way back to work.
author: Jeremy K.

description: Food sucks. Service is HORRIBLE. Please don't go here, it's not worth it.
author: Ashley Z.

description: I was craving Escape from NY but ended up at Burger Urge after seeing someone's burger through the window, it looked good. I was feeling adventourous and got the Elvis Burger, Yes! Peanut butter and Fried Banana with a medium beef patty. I also got a side of Onion rings. My bill was around $13! man better be good. My patty was luckily juicy so i didn't complain about the beef not being cooked medium, it was more medium well. I was expecting slices of Fried banana but it was mushed into the peanut butter, damn. It tasted a little weird but I ate it all, don't think I would get Elvis again. The onion rings are out of a plastic bag, not homemade, they were ok. I saw this girl's french fries, they looked good, thin and looks crisp. She also had a GIGANTIC salad, she was amazed by the size of it. Looking at the menu I see myself going back to try something new, if you are in a mood for a sammy and side of fried items or salad then check it out. I liked the spacious room and good sunlight. Staff was nice and helpful.
author: Karen T.

description: Really disappointing effort here.  I had the bacon cheeseburger.  The bun was too big and crusty, making it difficult to eat.  The meat was cooked decently well, but overall nothing special about it.  Good bacon.  We split the sweet potato fries, which were soggy.  My friend had a salad which was covered in nearly rotten cucumbers - when she informed an employee, the person said "I wouldn't know...I don't eat cucumbers" and walked away.  Overall, I didn't see any reason to go back, especially when a burger, fries and a drink cost $18.  I'd rather go to Magnolia or Kezar Bar and Grill for a burger and better environment.  I'd give it one star, but it just opened so maybe it'll get better.
author: Kevin R.

description: My daughter and I had lunch on this Wed. afternoon right about noon, just before they became busy. I ordered the grilled cheese and liked it okay. My daughter ordered a tuna melt and loved it, although she could only finish half. We shared an order of sweet potato fries that were cinnamony and yummy. Who knew adding ketchup to cinnamon tasted so good. One fry order could serve four women! So big. We ordered at the counter and our food was served promptly to our table. I shall return for a big, ol' burger.
author: Merrilee S.

description: I live in the Haight and I had been waiting to try this place. Its not bad. Its a little pricy, but the burger is  good size and it was tasty. I was with a friend and his order took at least 2 if not 3 times as long as mine, which was kind of annoying. Its not a bad place to stop in if you are in the mood for a burger and in the area.
author: Shanna T.

description: This place has the WORST blue cheese burger I have ever tasted. I took one  bit and it felt like I ate a whole spoon if pure blue chesse . There was no medium. I mean you could not even tastes anything else except.... And the burger was dry. Honestly if your in the area you should walk the few extra blocks to enjoy a REALLY AWESOME BURGER AT BURGER MISTER. And I was forced to give them ONE STAR
author: Marcella R.

description: Not sure what everyone else had, but I had a basic burger with all the fixings and it was only $6.99!  It was so big, I cut it in half and took the other half home for later.  It was a very good burger, better than some here in the city where I have had to pay $13.00 for nothing!  I'll be back!
author: Maureen R.

description: Mmm!!! Although the service was, eh.. the food was delish! I had the chili cheese burger, and added mustard with onion rings. HUGE portions though. No way I could finish.
author: Genna M.

description:
Plain and simple, you want to spend 18 bucks on a burger and fries
 and a drink then your in the right place to waste money..Oh yea I forgot it comes with a slice of orange....over priced... Could of gotten the same service at burgermeister.....done...p.s. the font on the main menu is too small. ;)........just do you...
author: Aj C.

description: The burgers look delicious. It smells so good in here. The only problem is...we have been waiting for over an hour for our burgers.  This seemed like a great place to come. But, we are hungry and no one has come over to explain why this is taking so long....so we probably won't come back. The waitress just delivered some food to our table and didn't even apologize for the wait.
author: Casey D.

description: I don't really get the negative reviews for this place. They make pretty solid burgers (try one of the specialty ones) and their sweet potato fries are great. It may be pricey but this is haight street. If you hate tourists, go on a Monday night. I live a few blocks away and have eaten here a few times. I have very few complaints. The service has been so so at times but I give them the benefit of the doubt because they work in the center of upper haight.
author: Scott A.

description: They are a little bit pricey but the Garlic Fries make it worth the money.  They truly were the best fries that I've ever had... EVER!!   I live in Walnut Creek so it's kind of out of the way but I would make the trip again just for the fries.  I actually think that they've ruined me for all other fries.
author: Valerie A.

description:
I wanted to like this place, but was not impressed. 

The veggie burger was bland, mushy, and the bun fell apart.

The staff are nice, and the place is clean.
author: Lisa T.

description: One of the best burgers I have had in this city and I've been to a lot of burger places.  The food is great!
author: Sheila N.

description: This place motivated me to open a Yelp account and it wasn't because it's praise worthy! I ordered a cheese burger, fries and a coke and they racked me up for $16. What? Message to Burger Urge: French fries are free with $9 burgers. But it was really good, right? No. The girl asked me how I wanted my burger cooked and I said medium rare. It came very well done. I'm sure they would have fixed it, but I just didn't have time for a do-over. Anyway, the burger was bland.  You want the places in your neighborhood to be good, but this place missed the mark entirely.
author: Ger M.

description: This place just opened up in my neighborhood. Being two blocks from home, I had to try it out. It's HUGE for a burger joint, and I am not sure where they are going with the strange decor? (or lack there of) I ordered a cheesburger with pepperjack. They had a few speciality burgers, but I wanted to try the basics first. At $7.99 plus tax, totaling $9.07, this was a bit much for a burger! The Niman Ranch beef is so overrated, and everyone uses it as a "marketing strategy." As long as the beef is high quality, it will speak for itself! I liked to brioche style bun, lightly toasted. It's a 1/2 pound burger, so it is filling. I am still trying to understand the orange twist garnish. Overall, if you just want a basic burger, this place will do you fine. Me however, I don't think I will be getting the "Urge" to go back anytime soon.
author: Damon W.

description:
went for the first time last night and the burgers did not disappoint!  delicious niman ranch beef, generous portion sizes and cooked to perfection.

Had the love & haight burger, san francisco burger & chili fries.  The beef patties were the highlight of the meal -- juicy & flavorful.  The buns were also noteworthy- definitely not your ordinary bun.

Sam the owner was on site that night & going around greeting patrons- great casual atmosphere, will definitely be back!
author: Karen F.

description: Don't waste your time.  Stupidly over priced, quality of food is not worth 50% of the money.  The service is ok but it's such an eye sore on haight street and so overly "tourists eat here".
author: E M.

description: Was blown away with how overpriced this place was and how average the good was. No burger here was less than $8 and it doesn't even come with fries. Someone in the place ordered a $6 shake and it was the most disappointing thing I have seen in a long while. Nothing in this place was great and in my opinion below average. The place just looks cool from the outside that's about it. Not worth the time.
author: Tyler C.

description: I consider myself a burger connoisseur, and this may well be the very best burger I have had in the SF Bar Area.  These people really know what they're doing.  The place was absolutely packed (presumably because it's new), so the wait was a little longer than I would have liked, but the service was good, and the food itself was fantastic.  They clearly use the highest quality meat for their burgers.  I would say that every self-respecting carnivore in SF owes it to herself/himself to make a pilgrimage to the Urge.
author: Mike M.

description: i enjoyed the food but this place is way over priced!  i wish they would have meals with some kind of deal instead of charging for each individual thing you order.  my friend and i each got our own burger but share both fries and a drink and it was still about $36.
author: Jill M.

description: Went there the other day. Ordered a burger and a clam chowder. WARNING: DO NOT ORDER SOUP THERE EVER! Its was horrible, it didnt even taste like a clam chowder. They gave me a whole bowl instead of a cup. The worst part of it? ME AND MY SISTER BOTH GOT FOOD POISONING!
author: Tidani B.

description: Not super great, really expensive and overly crowded. Burgers are o k but that's not really good enough to provide a better atmosphere. But, it's a better burger place than most others so what can you do. You have to enjoy it because of the location really.
author: Beth G.

description: I thought it was okay. $10 average burger, fluffy bun. The garlic fries were pretty good--- a bit greasy and garlicky. Meat was not seasoned well if at all. Overall experience was okay.
author: Lissette L.

description: Great burger and fast service... why the mediocre rating? Price seems fair (for San Francisco standards). I had cheddar and bacon and was quite satisfied. Wish I had noticed the multi-grain bun option though -- perhaps suggest it at the register?
author: T G.

description: Great burger, really good onion rings. Reasonable prices. Definitely will return-BUT I will NEVER buy a soda again, a regular size fountain soda came in at $3.34! Ouch. I guess it was drink prices weren't posted for a reason.
author: N O.

description: Over $40 for cold bland food, dry bun and I think the owner took my fries home as he left. I got home to find no fries in my burger orders. This place will be out of business before end of year. Do yourself a favor and avoid.
author: Simon M.

description: I've only been there once, but had a very good experience. I had the San Francisco special which was really tasty and a nice change from the typical burger. My mate had the chicken pesto and he said it was very moist and tasty. The staff are very friendly. There are lots of big windows for watching the "Haight Street show". Service was quick. The place is clean. I am looking forward to going back and trying other items on the menu. A nice addition to the Upper Haight.
author: Kathleen S.

description: I went to burger urge during its soft open and so we go to try the food for free! Not biased because it was free. The burger was great. The bread is delicious..the owner said it was from a bakery in napa.
author: Erica L.

description: Food was so delicious and the service is outstanding! Even though it's an order at the counter place, the server kept checking back with us to make sure we had everything we needed and that we were happy with our food. I would definitely recommend this place if you like burgers.
author: Elisse L.

description: ok to be fair all I had at Burger Urge was a beer and fries, both delish by the way...but the 5 stars are for the girls who worked there who were super friendly and nice....if I worked in a burger joint on Haight street i'm pretty people would annoy me, but nope, they were as friendly as can be! Thanks ladies!
author: Amy E.

description: I frakking love this place. Garlic fries are good, burgers are excellent, environment is great, and it's not crowded all the time.
author: Stassa H.

description: went here twice with a friend.  buns were stale both times.  chili is little more than mildly spiced pinto beans.  meat is good quality but the rest is not worth the  money
author: Lambchop B.

description: When this place first opened I was so excited because I am a frequent on Haight st and I like to try the different foods it has to offer. So I go in there the first day they open order a medium done burger with mushrooms, mustard, and onions. I waited an appropriate amount of time, got my burger to go and left. When I bit into it I immediately spit it out and looked inside. This burger was not even close to being done it was 70% raw! There were no mushrooms or mustard packets inside. So I went back to tell them, they say oh I'm sorry and proceeded to "fix" it. After again waiting, I got it and left, somewhat annoyed. I open it, look at, when I got the chance to sit down and wow...They used the same bun I had bit into, put more fries on top of the existing ones...this was ridicules. Oh and I got the most dry burnt piece of meat EVER! Besides this, the bite I took had no flavor and I was very unsatisfied for the amount of money I basically put in the trash.
author: Valerie N.

description: Very overpriced, and the meat was a little gristly.  If it was a few bucks cheaper maybe 3 stars, but at ~$15 for a burger with fries I expect much more.
author: Nicolai T.

description: I was pretty excited to step in here and see a big, prominant veggie menu but unfortunately that's where my excitement ended. My veggie burger was $10 with no fries on the side and I can't describe it as anything other than bland. It was a really mediocre veggie patty inbetween two slices of bread with some tomato and lettuce. The service was fine but I really wouldn't bother coming here again.
author: Bella D.

description: Ordered a cheeseburger medium rare. It took forever to get my order and of course, it was well done. They offered to cook another hamburger but I couldn't wait any longer. Although it's supposed to Neiman Ranch it was full of gristle. Keep on walking, too many good places to eat than this place.
author: Robin H.

description: The food is pretty good but will NOT return there. Their service is SO SLOW! They don't even seem to care that their service sucks. The ir hipster attitude is so off putting. Witnessed a girl who waited 30 minutes for French fries! No way should an order of fries take that long...and the girl even had to up to the counter to check on her order! Unacceptable.
author: Mike B.

description: Went here for the first time this evening for some quick take out. Ordered a grilled cheese and a cup of tomato bisque. What I got was a cup of soup that looked and tasted more like blended chili and two pieces of bread (no cheese). Too bad a had to wait til I got home to find out they screwed up my order. Won't be coming back.
author: Erin Z.

description: This stretch of Haight Street deserves better. There's a reason why this place is always empty and Magnolia & Martin Marks are always crowded. Sweet and obliging staff, but the food could ruin your day.
author: Rocco P.

description: I just tried the Burger Urge in the last month or so.  It's a good place...ambience is fine, decorations are fine, menu is clear. Service is friendly.  The burger I ordered (Love and Haight) was delicious and fries were bountiful. They forgot to put my order in, adding 15-20 minutes to the wait...longer than it should have been for a "fast food" experience. They should have offered a free shake or something.   I compare this place to In n Out, Burger King, etc.  I know they have to cook after the order, so I'm willing to wait an extra few minutes, but this was a bit too long. I almost canceled the order and left.  Price was also about 30% more than I would have liked to have paid for such a meal. I hope they can maybe give me a few less fries and charge less since I couldn't finish the fries.  Burger was good though, so I'm not saying it's not a bad place.  I wanted to like it more. Hopefully they can get their act together on speed of service.  I would not say no to trying it again, but honestly I would prefer something like a $7.99 Simpleburger with pickle, tomato, onion, lettuce, and thousand island dressing. One big patty.  Mmmm. Patty.
author: Steven T.

description: i hate to pile on this new spot in the neighborhood, but something is just not quite right.  i have tried a couple of different burgers and while none of them sucked, they were not many notches above "suck".  the burger patty itself is dry.  i don't think they grind the meat in house which in my mind is a big mistake if you are a BURGER place.  these pre pattied nieman ranch burgers just don't cut it.  the meat is at the core of the product, for godsakes it should be big fat and juicy and it just ain't.  It sits on a nice bun and the toppings are fresh, but the patty itself gets a thumbs down (ok, i think i made my point).  The fries aren't that good either.  the fries down the street at mc d's are better (and cheaper)(i hear, because you would never catch me in a mcdonalds...never, i swear, never).  Onion rings get a thumbs up.  The people behind the counter are super nice, so it doesn't seem to be for a lack of trying that this place misses, but man you have to fix that burger.  and god, it's awful bright and flashy for the haight.
author: howdy d.
